loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo se desempeñó como trabajador en una finca durante 20 años donde aprendió mucho acerca del comercio en especial el de carnes pues trabajo con pollo, pescado. Ganado y cerdos que seria las principales carnes consumidas en Colombia, hace aproximadamente 18 años tomo la decisión de tomar su propio camino iniciar un negocio el cual lo enfoco a la actividad que realizo en la finca y es precisamente eso la distribución de carnes en espacial pollo y pescado actividad que le ha dado de comer durante 18 años, solicita el crédito para invertir capital a su negocio comprando más surtido de pollo y pescado y aplicando un plan de promoción de sus productos haciéndolos llegar a más personas ubicados en barrios aledaños a su casa pues el ofrece el producto y le das un plazo para pagarlo estrategia que le ha atraído una buena cantidad de clientes pues se ha trazado una meta de realizar unas mejoras a la casa ampliar y reorganizarla para dejar a sus hijos una residencia en óptimas condiciones en la cual pueda apoyarse en una condición crítica o en la ausencia del señor Ricardo
texts.en:
Ricardo worked as a farm worker for 20 years, where he learned a lot about the trade especially the meat industry, as he worked with chickens, fish, cattle and pigs, which are the main sources of meat consumed in Colombia. About 18 years ago, he made the decision to go on his own and start a business focused on this same line of business. such as distribution of chicken and fish. 
He is requesting for this loan to invest capital in his business to purchase a larger variety of chickens and fish and to implement a promotional plan to advertise his products so they can reach more people located in surrounding neighborhoods. His advantage is that he offers products that can be paid in installments, strategy that has been very successful for him. He's been trying to make some improvements in her home. He wants to expand and reorganize the home, so as to leave his children with a house in good condition that can be a support of them during tough times or in the event Ricardo could not be there for them.

loans.use: to purchase a larger variety of chickens and fish and to implement a promotional plan to advertise his products so they can reach more people located in surrounding neighborhoods

loans.name: Ma. Elsa

texts.en:
Ma. Elsa is 41 years old and has four children.  Ma. Elsa is married and has four children who are in school.

Ma. Elsa is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Ma. Elsa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers.

Ma. Elsa has been farming vegetable for 11 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of dry goods like blouses, shorts, curtains, etc. to sell in her business.

Jacinta has been in this business for 3 years. Jacinta earns additional income from selling eggs and herbal products.

Jacinta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dry goods like blouses, shorts and curtains to sell.

loans.name: Emma Almolanida

texts.en:
Emma Almolanida is 49 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Emma Almolanida has been in this business for 3 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for the care  of her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 42 years old, married and has four children.  

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for 8 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Blanca Elda

texts.es:
Blanca de 43 años de edad,  estudio hasta 4 grado de educación básica, por motivos de escasos recursos económicos y por la distancia de la escuela, no pudo continuar.

Ella es casada su  esposo se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura, ellos tiene 4 hijos, 3 estudian y uno le ayuda al trabajo de la agricultura al papá  y los otros 3 están estudiando.

Blanca se dedica al cuido de animales domésticos,  los cuales son cerdos y vacas,  ella tiene 22 años de dedicarse a este trabajo ya que desde muy pequeña después que dejo de estudiar se a dedicado a este trabajo, ella además de este trabajo es sastre. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 2 vacas y alimentación para estas.

Sus sueños son tener vacas productoras de leche, que le permita sacar alimentación de los derivados de la leche que son, queso, cuajada, crema, etc.  para darles una mejor dieta alimenticia a su familia, así mismo con lo que le sobre lo podrá vender, para obtener  algunos ingresos para poder comprarle vestuario a sus hijos y ayudarles a que sigan estudiado.
texts.en:
Blanca is 43, she only finished 4th grade, as her school was too far away and she didn't have enough resources to attend. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. They have 4 children, 3 of then are in school and the 4th one helps his dad in the fields.
Blanca takes care of farm animals, such as pigs and cows. She stated when she was very young, 22 years ago. And she is also a seamstress.
She is requesting for this loan to buy 2 cows, and to buy feed for them as well.
Her dream is to get dairy cows, which will allow her to produce dairy products like cheese, curd, cream, etc. and to provide a better diet to her family, and also to sell and make some extra money to buy clothing for her children and to help them stay in school.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows, and to buy feed for them as well.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 51-year-old married man and a father of four children. His oldest child is 20 years old and the youngest is 10. Ali lives with his family in Sana'a, Yemen. 

He is an educated man and until recently was a soldier in the army. Over time, Ali was able to accumulate a good amount of money from his salary and he purchased a taxi for a transportation business two years ago. He drives the taxi. Unfortunately, most of what he earns from this business, and most of his time, go on the repair and maintenance of his taxi, as it is now very old. Due to lack of funds, Ali has applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy spare parts and change the taxi's engine, which will help him to save a lot of money.

Ali's vision is to repair this taxi and sell it, in order to purchase a new one. He also has a piece of land and he hopes to build a house on it.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and change the engine on his taxi, which will help him to save a lot of money.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 58 years old and married with seven children. With one child still in school, Rosalinda works very hard to provide for her family.

Rosalinda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, canned goods, coffee, soft drinks, etc. 

In the future, Rosalinda would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Elena Maribel

texts.es: Elena tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo de 5 años de edad quien es su principal fuente de inspiración para luchar y trabajar día con día. Elena se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo y de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. También se dedica a la venta de tamales de forma ambulante lo que le permite percibir más ingresos que le sirven para dar a su hijo mejores condiciones de vida. Elena solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea terminar de construir un cuarto el cual por falta de recursos económicos no ha logrado terminar. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos, puertas y ventanas puesto que desea construir el techo de la vivienda e instalar las respectivas puertas y ventanas necesarias de la misma.
texts.en:
Elena is 37 years old and lives in her own home with her 5-year-old child, who is her main source of inspiration to keep fighting and working every day. Elena has worked providing domestic services for a long time and this is how she makes a living and supports her family. She also sells tamales, traditional corn snacks, on the street. This boosts her income so that she can offer her child better living conditions.

Elena is requesting this loan from FUSAI as she wants to finish building a room which ,because of a lack of money, she hasn't been able to finish. With the amount she is requesting, she will buy galvanized sheeting, wood, nails, doors and windows to build the roof of the home and fit its doors and windows.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, wood, nails, doors and windows to build the roof of the home and fit its doors and windows.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is a 30-year-old married woman. She lives in the small village in the Khoni district with her husband and 3 children.

Lia's family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a small plot of land where they grow nut trees, and Lia sells the harvest at local markets. As the income is only seasonal and not enough for a family of five, Lia has decided to purchase a cow and start an animal husbandry business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,500 GEL which will allow her to purchase a cow and start selling dairy products. 

Lia gratefully awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Luis ha sido un humilde campesino trabajador toda su vida y se gana la vida realizando labores de agricultura.
Este oficio lo aprendió empíricamente desde muy niño al lado de su padre quien le enseño todo lo necesario para sobrevivir.
El trabaja en su propia finca cultivando distintos topos de alimentos como plátano y yuca, en colaboración con su esposa, ha sacado sus cultivos adelante todo este tiempo.
El solicita dinero para comprar elementos para la preparación de sus tierras como abonos y riegos, además necesita comprar semillas para realizar sus cosechas. Esto le permitirá seguir ejerciendo su ardua actividad con la que ha sostenido a su familia todos estos años.
Uno de sus sueños es poder tener otra parcela de tierra más grande y allí tener más cantidad de producto, además de generar algunos empleos a las personas de su región.
texts.en:
Luis has been a humble farm worker his whole life and makes his living doing agricultural work. 
He learned his trade when he was a child by working alongside his father who taught him everything he needed to know to survive. 
He works on his own farm cultivating different kinds of foods like banana and cassava, and with help from his wife, they've had successful harvests over the years. 
He is requesting for some money to buy items to prepare his land as also for fertilizers and irrigation, as well as to buy seeds for his crops. This will allow him to continue with his arduous activity that has sustained his family all these years. 
One of his dreams is to have another larger plot of land that can hold more produce, and also to be able to hire people from the region and generate from jobs.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural products

loans.name: Ma. Lina

texts.en:
Ma. Lina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a retail rice business in the Philippines. Ma. Lina has been in this business for 5 years now. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Ma. Lina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Cecilia is 27 years old and has two children who are in school.

For the past 20 years, Ma. Cecilia has had a handicraft business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials like shells, wire, and nylon threads.

Ma. Cecilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like shells, wire, and nylon threads for her business

loans.name: Ronaly

texts.en:
Ronaly works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines.

Ronaly has been in this business for 8 years. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo and groceries.

In the future, Ronaly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Sheila May

texts.en:
Sheila May works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years.

Sheila May has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

In the future, Sheila May would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Maria Lydia

texts.en:
Maria Lydia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Maria Lydia is 55 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Maria Lydia has had a handicraft business in the Philippines for the past 20 years. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business.

Maria Lydia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 33 years old and has three children who are in school.

Mary Ann has had a general store in the Philippines for the past 7 years. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Ann would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, peppers, onions, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 45 years old, married, and has one dependent child. He lives with his wife and child in a family apartment. He lives in the community of Accra-Teshie in Ghana. For five years, Emmanuel has been selling soft drinks. He sells to customers of all ages. 

Emmanuel is a hardworking man who wants to get ahead in life. He has yet to build his own house. Emmanuel is very happy about working with ID-Ghana and Kiva. He is requesting this loan to buy more soft drinks so that he can make more profit. With the support from this loan he hopes to increase his income and continue working at his business so he can increase his earnings.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks for his business

loans.name: David

texts.es:
Davis tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en su casa propia de material rustico, en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de frutales, arroz y café, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 4 años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Davis is 33 years old.  He lives with his wife and children in their own rustic house in the Pucará district, a community in a hot climate, whose population works in agriculture, especially growing fruit trees, rice and coffee, located in Jaén province that is in Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú.

He works in agriculture, especially with growing coffee, and has done this for the past 4 years. He has requested a loan of 1,5000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop and have a good output to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise (soap, toothpaste, coal, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a member of Umoja Group in Meru, one of the VEP groups in Central Kenya. She is married and has two children, the oldest being eleven years and the smallest six years.

She has a small business near her home where she sells charcoal and paraffin and is able to earn $5 per day. After attending a training by VEP through her group, she learnt about the benefits of solar lanterns as compared to paraffin lights. She now intends to take a loan to expand her business by stocking solar lanterns to sell to her clients who buy paraffin for lighting.This will increase her income to $10 per day, and the added income will be used to improve the living standards of her family. She will also be able to repay the loan.

With these lamps, she hopes to encourage other women to replace their kerosene lanterns with solar lanterns that eliminate smoke, save money, and reduce risk of fires and burns.

loans.use: to stock her retail shop with solar lanterns

loans.name: Matunda Grp Group

texts.en:
Lameck is a married man and aged in his early forties. He is the father of five children and taking care of another four kids, all of whom are in school. Despite being in school, some of them are grown and taking care of themselves.

Lameck is a business man who has been managing three enterprises: fruit selling, transportation and a general store. He has been managing these businesses for 20 years now. Lameck employs business helpers and his business goes from 7:15 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. each working day. With this working time range, Lameck is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his sixth loan request which he will use to replenish his stock of fruits and popular products for his shop. With his previous loans, all of which he paid back successfully, he used them to make his business grow by purchasing more fruits, bought a motorbike for transportation and shop stock. He is doing great and is thankful to Kiva who has supported his group. He used the increased income to cover school fees and home food expenses. He dreams of opening a wholesale shop. 

He will share this loan with his loan group "MATUNDA," which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish stock of fruits and popular products for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, etc., for her business

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is a 27-year-old married woman. She lives in the small village of Gori district with her husband and two children. Lia is involved in the agricultural activities. In particular, she has a plot of agricultural land, where she grows haricot. She is a very hardworking woman and does her best to insure a good harvest. Her husband is employed and gets a small monthly salary. 

Lia decided to start a dairy business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,000 GEL to purchase a cow. As the cow is purchased, she will start producing dairy products to sell locally. This will increase the family income, and Lia will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Eliecer Arney

texts.es:
Eliecer  es un hombre humilde, trabajador que toda su vida se ha dedicado a los duros trabajos de agricultura.
Este oficio lo aprendió empíricamente desde muy pequeño al lado de su padre y unos tíos quienes le enseñaron todo lo necesario para sobrevivir.
El trabaja en su propia tierra cultivando principalmente plátano, y con esta actividad busca el sustento diario de su esposa y sus tres hijos pequeños.
El solicita un apoyo económico para comprar elementos para la preparación de sus tierras como abonos, riegos y fungicidas, además necesita comprar semillas para realizar las siembras del producto. 
Esto le permitirá seguir ejerciendo su precaria actividad con la que ha sostenido a su familia todos estos años.
Uno de sus sueños es poder tener otra parcela de tierra más grande y allí tener más cantidad de producto, además de generar algunos empleos.
texts.en:
Eliecer is a humble man, who has worked his entire life and whose business is the difficult work of agriculture.

He learned this job through experience at his father's and uncles' sides, who taught him everything necessary to survive, from when he was very young.

He works his own land, primarily cultivated with banana, and with this work he looks for the daily sustenance of his wife and three small children.

He asks for economic help to buy things to prepare his land such as fertilizer, irrigation costs and fungicides, in addition to needing to buy seeds to plant his product.

This will let him continue doing his precarious business that has sustained his family for all these years.

One of his dreams is to have a larger plot of land and to produce more product, in addition to hiring some employees.

loans.use:
to buy supplies to work his land, fertilizer, and 
pay irrigation costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal to offer for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, milk and other materials for making falafel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, caustics, and wood for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour and sugar in bags so that she can increase her daily sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more caustic, oil, and other items to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, soap, batteries, etc., for her business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes has been designing and making clothes for more than six years. She also sells shoes and cosmetics, and her business is in a crowded location, which gives her an edge. She wants to take out this loan to buy more clothes and cosmetics, and thus grow her business. It will provide her with a greater  variety of goods to display and attract more customers, leading to more sales and more income for her and her family. 
Lourdes has two sons, who are her reasons for living. Her accomplishments have included providing stability to her family, while her challenge and dream is that her business will become a boutique. Let's help Lourdes in this adventure.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bowls, pans, spoons and cups for her business.

loans.name: Lasalo

texts.en:
Lasalo is a 24-year-old, married man with two children.  He works as a seasonal worker picking kiwi fruit to earn a living.  He has been doing this for two years.

Lasalo has requested a loan to pay for his airfare, visa, clothing and pocket money.

He joined SPBD in 2014. With his earnings, Lasalo hopes to support his family and his children's education.

loans.use: to pay for his airfare, visa, clothing and pocket money for his seasonal work.

loans.name: Pitoai

texts.en:
Pitoai is a 45-year-old, married man with six children.  He works as a seasonal worker in New Zealand picking kiwi fruit to earn a living.  He has been doing this for six years. 

Pitoai has requested a loan to pay for his airfare, visa, clothing and pocket money for New Zealand.

He joined SPBD in 2014. With his earnings, he hopes to improve his family lifestyle and support his children's education.

loans.use: to pay for his airfare, visa, clothing and pocket money for New Zealand where he works seasonally.

loans.name: Vaega

texts.en:
Vaega is a 22-year-old married man with no children.
 
He works as a seasonal worker, picking kiwifruit to earn a living. He has been doing this for three years. Vaega has requested a loan to pay for airfare, visa, clothing, and pocket money.

He joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial service. With his earning, Vaega hopes to improve his family lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay for airfare, visa, clothing, and pocket money.

loans.name: Faasalele

texts.en:
Faasalele is a 42-year-old, married man with one child. He works as a seasonal worker picking kiwifruit to earn a living.  He has been doing this for two years.  

Faasalele has requested a loan to pay for his airfare, visa, pocket money, x-ray and clothing.

He joined SPBD in 2014. With his earnings, Faasalele hopes to improve his family's standard of living and support his child's education.

loans.use: to pay for his airfare, visa, pocket money, x-ray and clothing for his seasonal work.

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
Luzvilla is 41 years old, married and lives at Panalsalan, Tangub City Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs from the neighborhood.  The piglets' owners share in the profits upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending on their agreement.  With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well.
 
Through Paglaum MPC Luzvilla obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she has requested a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy additional feed and piglets. She really hopes and prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her family. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily maintain sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and piglets.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 26 years old and has a banana farm in Langub, Calamba. Her banana planting activities are just starting and run for a year.  Seeing potential income, Agnes wants to venture more in different banana varieties. 

Agnes has taken one loan with Paglaum MPC already and successfully repaid her obligations. Now, she has applied for her second loan to purchase fertilizer.  She deeply wishes to sustain her farming activities.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Jhonbrell

texts.en:
Jhonbrell is married with two children. He is 28 years old and lives in Tangub.  Jhonbrell is a farmer and grows coconuts to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years. He has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer for his farm. 

Jhonbrell has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Jhonbrell hopes to own another coconut field to expand his farming activities.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries in her general store business.

Mary Ann has been in this business for six years. Mary Ann earns extra income from vegetable vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested a new loan to further build her business.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 63 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucia has been raising pigs for two years, and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Carina works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming rice. Carina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Carina has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil and rice for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bread for her business.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  BALIMAYA est constitué de  4 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires  dans le quartier  TORAKABOUGOU de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  grains d’arachide à l’image de DJINESSIRA qui est la 1ère femme assise  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 5 sacs d’arachide non décortiqués avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The Balimaya Group is made up of four married woman, with an average age of 37 and an average of five children each. They live within nuclear families in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni City. They know each other through the bonds of community, friendship and business. In order to strengthen their finances, with the aim of doing better business, they have become members of the Soro Yiriwaso Microfinance Institution. This will be their first loan. This group of women deals in peanuts, just like Djinessira, who is the woman sat on the very left of the photograph. With this loan, she plans on buying five sacks of unshelled peanuts from the wholesalers in Bougouni. She sells this produce both at market and from her home, accepting both cash and credit, to a mixed customer base. She plans on making an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, which will be invested into other businesses and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Fanix Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Fanix a sus 33 años de edad, esta casada, madre de dos niños en edades escolares, su compañero labora en su casa de habitacion ya que es Veterinario de Profesion, ella es comerciante vende frutas y verduras desde hace unos años, el credito lo solicita para la compra de Materiales de Construccion ya que necesita realizar unas modificaciones en sus vivienda, contruira un anexo para poder tener mejores condiciones, utilizara Cemento, Bloques, Arena, Hierro, Agradece el apoyo que Kiva con ayuda de Afodenic le han brindado
texts.en: Fanix is 33 years old, married and mother of two school-aged children. Her partner is a veterinarian and works from their home. She has been selling fruit and vegetables for several years. She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials as she needs to make some modifications to her house. She wants to build an annex to improve their living conditions. She will use cement, cinder blocks, sand and re-bar. She is grateful for the support that Kiva and Afodenic have given her.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is married with 2 children. She is 42 years old and lives in Pagadian, Camanga. She is a farmer and grows vegetables and fruits to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years.

Arlyn has requested a loan to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer for her garden. She has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to become a supplier of vegetables in their community.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer for her garden

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 31 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Michelle is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Michelle has been raising pigs for four years, and earns an additional income from tailoring.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gemma Rose

texts.en:
Gemma Rose works hard to support her family. Gemma Rose is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials for her business.

Gemma Rose has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Doralicia

texts.es:
Doralicia de 27 años de edad, por motivos de escasos recursos económicos no pudo estudiar, ella es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos los cuales viven con ella en su casa, y los 2 están estudiando en la escuela, y sus padres viven con ella.

Ella tiene 15 años de dedicarse al negocio de compra y venta de cerdos, y también al engorde de estos mismos, para venderlos, ella lo aprendió gracias a sus padres que le enseñaron desde cuando estaba pequeña  a este trabajo, del cual ella obtiene sus ingresos para ayudarle a sus hijos a estudiar, y para  darles su alimentación.  Su trabajo lo realiza en la casa, y también sus hijos le ayudan cuando salen de estudiar.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 6 cerdos pequeños para engordarlos, y  luego venderlos,  comprara 10 quintales de harinilla, vitaminas y minerales para darles una buena nutrición, para que desarrollen rápido.  

Ella a futuro desea tener y sacar al mercados cerdos grandes que le permita obtener una mejor ganancia, para tener mejores ingresos y así ayudarle a sus hijos con su estudio, para que sean personas que le sirvan a  la sociedad.
texts.en:
Doralicia is 27 years old. For economic reasons she couldn't study. She is a single mother of two children who live with her in her house, They both go to school and her parents live with them.

For the past 15 years she has been buying and selling pigs and fattening them to sell them. She learned this activity from her parents when she was small and this is how she can make the money to educate her children and feed them. She does this at her house and her children help her after school.

The loan Doralicia is requesting is to buy 6 small pigs to fatten and later sell them. She will also buy 10 quintals of wheat middling, vitamins and minerals to nourish them and create a rapid growth. In the future she wants to have and take to market big pigs which will provide more profits. With the revenues she will help her children with their studies so they will become people who are useful to their society.

loans.use: to buy small pigs, feed, vitamins, and minerals to feed them.

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en:
Sarin is a citizen located in Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. She is 35 years old. She is a married mother of five kids; three of them are in school, and two are still young for schooling. 

She is a farmer who not only does rice farming, but also grows cassava as the main source of her income. The business that she has had for ages has generated income of 33,300 KHR per day. This is the second-time borrowing for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her loan with success, and it has helped her to uplift her lifestyle at a gradual pace. 

As the leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to pay for the plowing fee and to purchase fertilizer for her cassava field. She has strong hopes to gain extra income than before.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee and purchase fertilizer.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
A local citizen from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Sokun is a young mother of one little kid who is still young for schooling. For her family, rice and cassava farming are the main source of income for her to earn. She has been engaged in this business for six years, and it returns her 33,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first cycle loan for her and her co-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Both of them are requesting loans of the same amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee for her cassava field. 

She hopes this business will enable her to improve her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sarodjon

texts.ru: Сароджон пожилая женщина ей 62 года у нее четверо детей, которые давно женаты и живут отдельно от матери. Муж Сароджон умер и сейчас она одна ведет хозяйство, дети всячески помогают ей. Но Сароджон не может сидеть только на попечении детей она и сама  помогает детям ухаживать за подрастающими внуками. Она трудолюбивая, позитивная женщина , которая очень любит своих детей и внуков. Сароджон  содержит крупный рогатый скот и перерабатывая молоко она зарабатывает на то , чтобы помочь детям и внукам. После долгой холодной зимы  запасы кормов , которые она делала закончились  и с наступлением весны потребовалось приобрести дополнительно корма для содержания скота. Так как содержание скота и переработка молока являются основным источником дохода Сароджон, она не хотела бы продавать свой скот из-за нехватки кормов и тем самым потерять кормильца. Для приобретения необходимого количество кормов Сароджон необходим кредит за которым она и обратилась в "Арванд". Она  заранее благодарит "Арванд"  в поддержке.
texts.en:
Sarodjon is an elderly woman of 62. She has four children, all of whom have long been married and living on their own. Sarodjon's husband has passed away and now she has to maintain her household on her own, with help from her children when they are able. But Sarodjon can't depend solely on her children - she herself helps to take care of her growing grandchildren. She is a hardworking, positive woman who loves her children and grandchildren very much.

Sarodjon keeps a cow and processes the milk she gets in order to earn money to help her children and grandchildren. After the long, cold winter she has run out of feed and with the arrival of spring she needs to buy more feed for her cow. Since processing milk from this cow is Sarodjon's main source of income, she wouldn't want to sell her because of a shortage of feed and in that way lose her means of earning a living. In order to purchase the necessary amount of feed, Sarodjon needs a loan, which is why she has turned to Arvand. She thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed

loans.name: 01 Trường Thi Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thịnh has a service business providing housing rentals. Thịnh has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Thịnh faces in her business is the lack of capital. 

Thịnh is 61 years old and married with two children. Thịnh supports no dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 01 Trường Thi solidarity group. This is Thịnh’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Thịnh hopes to travel for vacation within the country, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase material to repair her house for rental.

loans.name: Solidaridad De Cachimayo Group

texts.es:
La socia Bernardina pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD DE CACHIMAYO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cachimayo, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 58 años de edad tiene 06 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solictan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la crianza de animales, tienda de abarrotes, confeccion, venta de ropa, venta de golosinas, venta de comida, venta de pollipapapas.
texts.en:
Bernardina belongs to the "SOLIDARIDAD DE CACHIMAYO" communal bank which is located in the Cachimayo District, Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.

She is 58 years old, is married and has 6 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business of raising small animals like guinea pigs and chickens amongst others. She has been doing this for a long time and things are going well for her thanks to the efforts she brings to her work every day. She raises these small animals to sell to her customers who request them and in this way she supports her family.

Bernadina is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs for her business. She is grateful for the loan and promises to pay the installments on time. The other members sell animals, have a grocery store, sew, sell clothing, sell sweets, sell meals and sell pollipapapas (a local food).

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Nilza Isabel

texts.es: Nilza de 61 años de edad, fabrica bollos de maíz desde el año 1980, cuando como madre soltera decidió generar ingresos,  para lograr sostener a su familia conformada por 5 hijos, hoy adultos.  Sus productos los elabora trabajando desde las 4 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde diariamente, y  los vende de contado y a crédito a las tiendas cercanas  y vecinos que le encargan progresivamente. Su meta mas adelante, es comprar un molino eléctrico y terminar de remodelar su vivienda, pero su mayor desafío es competir con precios, calidad e incrementar su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará maíz en mayor volumen, y materiales de construcción para remodelar al cocina y ofrecer comodidad en el lugar de trabajo y mayor calidad, en la medida en que incrementa su producción, lo cual constituye la mejora del negocio con esta inversión.
texts.en:
Nilza is 61 years old and has made corn fritters since 1980. As a single mother she decided to generate income so as to be able to sustain her family made up of 5 children who are now adults. 

She makes her product daily starting at 4 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon and she sells them for cash or on credit to nearby stores and neighbors who place orders. Her next goal is to buy an electric mill and finish remodeling her home but her biggest challenge is to compete with prices, quality and to increase her clientele. 

She is currently applying for a loan from Kiva, her first one through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With this she will buy wholesale corn and construction materials to remodel the kitchen, provide comfort in the workplace and better quality. With this she will increase production which constitutes a business improvement from this investment.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn and construction materials to remodel her kitchen.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 48 years old and married with 5 school-age children. She lives in Siloy, Calamba. She has a retail business selling eggplants. Her business is doing well with promising monthly income of PHP 6,000.  

In 2011, Herminia was in need of start-up capital, so she reached out to Paglaum MPC for a loan. She has repaid her previous loans and now she has applied for another loan to buy additional kilos of vegetables for resale. 

In the future, Herminia hopes to own a stall in the market.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables for resale

loans.name: Tuti

texts.en:
Tuti is a 29-year-old single woman. She started a motorcycle taxi business last year. To start this business, Tuti bought a motorcycle in installments from a dealer. 

Tuti has regular customers every day. She provides shuttle service, usually starting work at 6 am. Most of her customers are school-age children who live near her house.

Tuti plans to pay the last installments on her motorcycle, but she does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, she has requested a loan from TLM in the amount of IDR 3,000,000. She believes that through the improvement of her business, her income will increase.

loans.use: to pay off the last installments on her motorcycle

loans.name: Hoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Hoeurn is a villager from Kampong Cham province, and she is 32 years old. To overcome her financial burden, she farms rice and cassava. She has been farming for a long time and she earns a decent income in return. 

Hoeurn has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three previous loans, which she has fully repaid. These loans have enabled the timely support of her business and provided sufficient food for her kids. For this cycle, she is the leader of a borrower group consisting of six members. The total loan amount requested by her group is 5,200,000 KHR, of which 800,000 KHR is Hoeurn's portion. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing, labor, harvesting fees, fertilizer, and pesticide  for her field. She hopes to gain a better yield and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To pay for plowing, labor, harvesting fees, pesticides, and fertilizer

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is married with 2 children. She is 40 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Marissa raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested a loan to buy piglets and feeds.

Marissa has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to have more pigs to raise.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feeds

loans.name: Riya's Group

texts.en:
Riya is 22 years old, married and has no kids yet. She lives in Siem Reap province. 

To make a living, she grows rice and cassava as the main source of income. It is the business that she has had for several years, and it has earned her about 23,800 KHR per day. 

This is the original loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is the team leader of a group consisting of three borrowers. She and her joint borrowers are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As a leader, she will spend entire loan portion to pay for the plowing fee and to buy fertilizer for her cassava farmland. 

She hopes to earn more income via this business.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee and to buy fertilizer.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Dany's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Dany is 25 years old and a mother of two kids who are still in school. To cover her family’s expenses, she grows rice and cassava as the main source of income. She has had this business for seven years. 

This is Dany’s second-time borrowing with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), while her joint borrower is in the first-cycle loan. Dany has completely repaid her past loan, and it has enabled her to support the business in a timely manner with a better crop yield than before. 

Now, she is seeking a loan of 1,200,000 KHR, and her group member is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for the plowing fee and to purchase fertilizer. 

She highly believes this will increase her family’s income more than before.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee and purchase fertilizer.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Saroun's Group

texts.en: Saroun is 32 years old and a mother of three kids. Nowadays, only two of them still rely on her and they are in school. The main source of her income is from rice and cassava farming, which she has been involved in for more than 10 years. Saroun is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is a group leader of three. She has fully repaid back her past loan and it has enabled her to improve her family’s condition of living. Now, she is seeking a loan of 1,200,000 KHR and her joint borrowers are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for fertilizer and plowing costs for her cassava farmland. She hopes to improve her lifestyle so it is better than before.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and plowing costs

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cookies, caramels, sodas, and other products.

loans.name: 01.thiệu Phú Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phiếu works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Phiếu is 44 years old and married with three children. Phiếu is the group leader of theo 01.Thiệu Phú solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2004, Phiếu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Phiếu has successfully repaid one loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phiếu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Phiếu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Phiếu hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: 07Thiệu Dương16 Group

texts.en:
Phương sells fruit at her food stall/restaurant and has been in business for 10 years.  She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Phương is 38 years old, married, two children and two dependents in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Phương has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns Phương is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Phương hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit..

loans.name: Grecilda

texts.en: Grecilda is 47 years old and married with one school-age child.  She is from Langub, Calamba.  She has been engaged for almost 10 years in root crops farming.  She has a monthly income of PHP 4,000 doing this type of work.  She joined Paglaum last 2011 and took prior loans. She has repaid all her loans in a timely manner.  Grecilda wants to expand her farming activities. She has reached out to Paglaum for another loan to purchase fertilizer.  She deeply wishes to own a stall in the market to display her root crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: 01Thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Minh has a service business selling fish, shrimp and frogs. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to catch fish, shrimp and frogs. Minh is 45 years old and married with three children. Minh is the group leader of the 01Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Minh has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years The main hardship that Minh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Minh hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to catch fish, shrimp and frogs.

loans.name: 03 Y Bích - Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Luân operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.  

Luân is 42 years old and married with three children. She is the group leader of the 03 Y Bích - Hải Lộc solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

In 2012, Luân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Luân has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Luân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Luân hopes for her children to do well in school, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: 01 Y Bích Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Ký is applying for a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. She operates a food stall/restaurant and sells eggs and has been involved in this business for six years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital..

Ký is the leader of a four member group, the 01 Y Bích Hải Lộc solidarity group.  In 2012, Ký joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Ký has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Ký hopes to maintain a successful business, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry.

loans.name: 04 Hưng Thái Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Hà is applying for a loan to purchase general food to resell. She has operated a grocery store for about one year.

Hà is 38 years old, married with three children.

Hà is the group leader of the 04 Hưng Thái Hải Lộc solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

This is Hà's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main harship that Hà faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hà hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her grocery store.

loans.name: Waldin Alcides

texts.es:
Waldin de 27 años de edad, solo estudio 4rto  grado ya que antes era bien difícil estudiar, es acompañado su esposa se dedica a hacer bordados en manteles, por el  momento solo tiene una niña que estudia kínder, con él solo vive su madre, su esposa, su hija y dos hermanos más.

   Waldin se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz, frijol y maicillo. También saca mescal cuando esta la cosecha. De raspar mescal tiene 8 años y de sembrar granos básicos 10. Aprendió el oficio porque su padre trabajaba también en estas actividades y le dejo el motor que se necesita para ello y él decidió sembrar  más mescal y  es así como se dedica a ello. Pues no tiene otra actividad productiva, casi siempre ha sido jornalero y con ello a ayudado al sustento de su familia. El terreno donde trabaja le queda detrás de su casa, no camina mucho para llegar al lugar de trabajo sólo cuando trabaja para alguien más. En el trabajo solo su esposa es quien le ayuda. 


Con el financiamiento Waldin comprara los insumos agrícolas para sembrar, hilos para repoblar su mescalar y con el resto pagara la mano de obra que le ayudara a realizar las labores. Con el crédito podrá comprar lo que requiere y aumentara su patrimonio

El   sueño de él, es aumentar su hato ganadero, y que por el momento solo tiene dos bovinos, y comprando más , podrá tener vacas de ordeño lo que le generara ingresos de la venta de los lácteos, todo esto lo hará con esfuerzo sabiendo administrar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Waldin is 27 years old. He only went to school up to 4th grade because it was very difficult to study before. He has a wife, who works making embroidery products such as tablecloths. He only has a daughter who goes to preschool. His mother, wife, daughter and two more brothers live with him.  
Waldin works growing basic grains such as corn, bean and sorghum. He also gets mezcal when it is in harvest. He has been scraping mezcal for 8 years and growing basic grains for 10. He learned this from his father who worked in these activities and who left him the motor that is needed for it. He decided to grow more mezcal and this is how he works doing it. He does not have any another productive work since he has almost always worked as a daily worker, and with this he has helped to support his family. The lot of land where he works is behind his house. He does not walk much to get to his place of work; just when he works for someone else he does. Only his wife helps him in his work. With this loan Waldin will buy agricultural inputs for farming, agave pups to repopulate his mezcal field, and with the rest he will pay for hand labor to help him in his work. With the loan he will buy what is needed and increase his capital. His dream is to increase his cattle since at the moment he only has two bovines. When he buys more he will be able to have milking cows, which will generate income through the sale of dairy products. Everything he will do with hard work and knowing how to manage his earnings.

loans.use: to buy agriculture inputs for farming, agave pups to repopulate his mezcal field, and with the rest to pay for hand labor to help him in his work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock for his store.

loans.name: 01Thiệu Phú Group

texts.en:
Hương operates a food stall/restaurant selling poultry and has been in business for 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Hương is 44 years old, married with three children.  She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Hương is the group leader of the 01Thiệu Phú solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In 2010, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  Hương has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical business difficulties concerning Hương is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: Picaflor Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PICAFLOR” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Roxana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de víveres, taller de costura, venta de comida, venta de verduras, venta de salteñas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Roxana es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; nos cuenta que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, ya que ayudaba en su negocio a su madre, quien tenia el mismo negocio, en la actualidad trabaja varios años en el mismo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá en las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el servicio de salud que le ofrecen en la institución.
texts.en:
The "PICAFLOR" communal bank is on its ninth loan cycle with "Pro Mujer", through the Villa Exaltación regional office. The group has nine members, run by a board of directors that has Roxana as president. The members have various businesses, including: selling groceries, dressmaking, selling vegetables, and selling meat pies.

This loan will benefit small business owners in Roxana's group. Roxana herself tells us that she joined "Pro Mujer" two years ago following an invitation from one of the organisation's representatives who visited her at home. Roxana currently has a business selling vegetables. She says that she started the business a few years ago, and received help from her mother, who has a similar business. Roxana has had the business for a number of years.

This loan will be used to increase capital by buying vegetables in bulk from wholesalers in El Alto city. Roxana will then sell the goods in the markets of La Paz. This work allows Roxana to earn money to support her family. She is married and has one son.

When asked what it is that she likes about "Pro Mujer", Roxana tells us that she likes the health care provided by the organisation.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 64 years old, married with two adult age children.  She lives in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental.  She buys and sells calfs.  

Concepcion joined Paglaum in 2006 and received start-up capital from Paglaum to get her business going.

Now, Concepcion has applied for another loan to purchase another calf.  Concepcion also hopes to sustain her new business venture by selling snacks as an added source of income so she can provide for the family.

loans.use: purchase a calf.

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Mak's Group

texts.en:
Mak lives in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province.  She is 47 year old and a mother of nine children.  Currently, only three of them depend upon her.

Mak is a pineapple farmer and this is her main source of income.  She has been in business for five years and earns about 33,300 KHR per day. 

Now, Mak is seeking for a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She is her team's leader which consists of three members.  

Mak and her joint borrowers are requesting loans of 1,000,000 KHR each.  As a leader, Mak will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor cost for her farmland.  She hopes to gain a better yield than before and to upgrade her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: 01.thiệu Vận Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vân works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Vân is 63 years old and is married with three children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with three dependents.

The main hardship that Vân faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Vân is the group leader of the 01.Thiệu Vận solidarity group, which consists of three members. In 2009, Vân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Vân has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Vân hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Shalom: Dios Con Nosotros Group

texts.es: Ingrid de 41 años es separada con 02 hijos aún dependiente. El grupo “Shalom Dios Con Nosotros” conformada por 09 mujeres emprendedoras que buscan mejorar cada día. Este es el caso de Ingrid la cual cuenta con un video pub hace más de 10 años, negocio que le ha permitido educar a sus hijos. Solicitó el crédito, para la compra de bebidas. El deseo de Ingrid es de ampliar y ambientar su local para así dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. El grupo “Shalom: Dios Con Nosotros” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Ingrid se encuentra de pie, es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo celeste.
texts.en: Ingrid is 41 years old, separated and has two children who still depend on her. The "Shalom: Dios con Nosotros" group has ten enterprising women as members. Every day they look to improve their lives, and this is the case for Ingrid. She has had a pub with television for over ten years and this business has allowed her to bring up her children. Ingrid is applying for this loan in order to buy drinks. She wants to expand her business, and give her pub some atmosphere in order to offer better service. The "Shalom: Dios con Nosotros" group is grateful to those who are making this loan possible. In the photo, Ingrid is first on the left, standing up and wearing a little blue top.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
María de 33 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos ,de dos de los cuatro estudian octavo y primer grado en la comunidad donde residen, ella creció con sus padres donde trabajo muy duro para apoyar a sus padres en trabajos de la agricultura y en trabajos varios.
María estudio hasta quinto grado, no tuvo la oportunidad y el apoyo de sus padres para continuar con los estudios.
María actualmente tiene un pequeño comedor en el mercado de la ciudad, dicho negocio lo inicio hace una año donde todos los días de la semana va ha vender desayunos y almuerzos a los trabajadores y demás personas que laboran en los mercados y alrededores, posee experiencia de mas de cuatro años ya que anteriormente ella laboro en un comedor y fue ahí donde ella se motivo para emprender dicha actividad.
Tiene que viajar todos los días desde las cinco de la mañana, donde aborda el bus que la lleva por veinte minutos hasta llegar a su puesto de trabajo. Su hijo mayor le apoya para cuidar a los mas pequeñitos mientras esta en el negocio.
ella solicita el crédito en credicampo, para comprar una plancha para iniciar también con la venta de pupusas, ya que ha dejado de laborar por cerca de dos meses porque tuvo un niño hace cuarenta días y ha tenido que reposar, luego de su parto.
El crédito le permitirá reactivar su pequeño negocio para con ello ganar dinero y sacar adelante a sus cuatro hijos.
Sueña con hacer su propia casa, ya que donde vive es de un familiar y ella quiere en el futuro hacer su propia vivienda. De las ganancias que vaya obteniendo pretende ir ahorrando para lograr sus sueños de darles a sus hijos un hogar mas digno donde poder crecer juntos y sacarlos adelante en los estudios.
texts.en:
María is 33 years old and a single mother to four children. Two of the children are in eighth and first grades at the local school. María grew up with her parents and worked very hard to help them with their farming work, and other jobs.

María completed up to fifth grade. She did not have the opportunity - or support from her parents - to continue studying.

María has a small café in the city market. She started this business a year ago. Every day of the week she sells breakfasts and lunches to the workers and other people from in and around the market. María has over four years experience - she used to work in a café, where she was motivated to start her own business.

María has to travel to work every day. She takes the bus at 5 a.m and, after a 20 minute journey, it brings her to her workplace. María's eldest son helps to look after the younger children while she is working.

María is applying for a loan from "CrediCampo" in order to buy a grill to start selling "pupusas" (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans). María had to stop working for around two months as forty days ago she had another baby and had to rest after the birth.

This loan will help María to start up her little business again so that she can earn money and help her four children to prosper.

María dreams of having her own house. She is currently living in a house owned by a relative. María plans to save up her profits in order to achieve her dream of giving her children a decent place to live where they can grow together, and progress in their studies.

loans.use: to buy a grill to start selling "pupusas".

loans.name: 20 Tt Vạn Hà Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga operates a food stall/restaurant selling soft drinks. Nga has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Nga faces in her business is the lack of capital.She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to maintain the refreshment bar (Small bar with coffee, tea, soft drinks, fast food…). 

Nga is 45 years old and she is married with 2 children. Nga is the group leader of the 20 TT Vạn Hà solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Nga joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nga has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Nga hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is married with 4 children. Rosalinda is 61 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Rosalinda sells rice to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to have additional capital. She wants to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Rosalinda is an old member of PMPC. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Nguick Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est une partie du banc qui a été créé le 27 mars 2014. Il regroupe 21 femmes qui habitent le même village et développent de très bonnes relations amicales.

La représentante de ce groupe, Ndoumbe, est une femme de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants dont 1 garçon. Elle fait du petit commerce de légumes. Elle s'approvisionne à dans les marchés environnants pour revendre dans son village. Elle a une bonne expérience dans le domaine du petit commerce pour l'avoir exercé pendant au moins 10 ans. Sur la photo, elle est à droite debout avec la main levée.

Son crédit lui permettra de mieux développer son petit commerce de légumes en s'approvisionnant suffisamment en légumes chaque semaine. Parallèlement elle va acheter un mouton pour faire de l'embouche.

Les Bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettra de prendre en charge les besoins familiaux et de soutenir son mari est pris par le poids de l'âge
texts.en:
This group belongs to the banc villageois which was created on 27th March 2014. This group is made up of 21 women who live in the same village and who are all very good friends.

The group representative, Ndoumbe, is a 54-year-old woman. She is a married mother to nine children, one of which is a boy. She sells vegetables. She gets her supplies from the surrounding markets, which are then resold in her village. She has solid experience in the retail sector, in which she has worked for at least 10 years. In the photo, she is the woman to the far right with her hand raised. 

This loan will further develop her vegetable-selling business by allowing her to purchase sufficient supplies each week. Alongside this, she will purchase a sheep to raise as livestock. 

The profits generated by her business will allow her to meet her family's needs and to support her ageing husband.

loans.use: purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To support her son who is doing his bachelor degree.

loans.name: Nhóm 05 Lý Nam Group

texts.en:
Song is applying for a loan to purchase food for poultry and tools for her farm. She works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Song is 63 years old and she is married with 5 children. Song has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Song faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Song is the group leader of the Nhóm 05 Lý Nam solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

This is Song's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Song hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase food for poultry and tools for the farm.

loans.name: Voeurn's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from Kampong Cham province and a 28-year-old, Voeurn, is a mother of two kids - one schoolchild and one child under school-age. Her entire family relies on rice cropping as the main business and her paid-working job which is a supplementary source of income to support her family. She has been in this current business for ten years. 

She is not a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan with success and it has enabled her to support her business in a timely manner. For this cycle, she is a leader of a group consisting of three people who are looking to get a new loan. The total amount requested by her entire group is 4,000,000 KHR, of which 1,500,000 KHR is her loan portion. 

As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes she will have decent financial aid to support her family’s business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Jeany

texts.en:
Jeany is 54 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with nine children.

To earn a living, Jeany has a fish-selling business. She earns about PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business. Jeany has a requested a loan for additional capital to purchase additional fish to sell.

Jeany has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Jeany would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Nhóm 05 Mỹ Trí Group

texts.en:
Ms. Trâm works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Trâm has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Trâm is 48 years old and she is single with two children. Trâm is the group leader of the Nhóm 05 Mỹ Trí solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

This is Trâm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Trâm hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Srey Roth's Group

texts.en:
Srey Roth is 31 years old and a widowed mother of two children who are both still in school. To strive for a living, she grows cassava as the main source of income and has a paid-working job to supplement her income. She has been involved in this business for 11 years and it earns her 29,200 KHR per day. 

This is the first-time loan for her and her co-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking a loan of 1,200,000 KHR and her joint-borrower one of 1,000,000 KHR. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy cassava seedlings for her cassava farmland. She hopes to gain better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy cassava seedlings for her cassava farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Im's Group

texts.en:
A mother of two children residing in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Im is 51 years old. Her two kids are of school age. Her entire family counts on her agribusiness which is rice and cassava farming and her husband's occupation as a policeman. She has been engaged in her business for 31 years and it brings her a decent income. 

This is the second cycle loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Im has fully repaid her past loan and it has enabled her to improve her lifestyle so it is better than before. 

Now she is leading a group of three to get a new loan. Im will use her entire loan portion to buy cassava seedlings. She strongly believes that her cassava will produce a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy cassava seedlings.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Faso Kanou Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  FASO KANOU  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  31 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FAKOLA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités de vente de produits alimentaires, de fruits, d’habits et d’articles divers à tout moment. Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.
Mme  SITAN  (1ère sur la photo de la gauche  à la droite) compte acheter avec son prêt 3 sacs d’attiéké. Elle vend quotidiennement  à  FAKOLA et est très sollicitée surtout les jours de foire.Elle s’approvisionne à GUEYA. Elle vend au comptant et parfois à credit à une clientele mixte.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Faso Kanou group are married women averaging 31 years of age, with two children. They all live in polygamous families in Fakola, a prefecture in the third administrative region of Mali.
