They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their business selling food products, fruits, clothing and miscellaneous items. They are on their seventh loan with the institution, and anticipate paying it back without issues.

Mrs. Sitan (the first one from left to right in the photo) plans to use her loan to buy three bags of "attiéké" [a dish made from fermented cassava couscous]. She sells in Fakola every day and has a lot of demand, especially on market days. She stocks up in Gueya. She sells for cash and sometimes on credit to a mixed clientele. She plans earn an average monthly revenue of 20,000 West African francs. This revenue will allow her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy a traditional dish on the base of cassava.

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en:
Rin is 37 years old. She is the mother of four children, one of whom is in school. 

Rin struggles to make a living through construction and contractor jobs. She has been in this occupation for a long time.  She makes about 32,000 KHR daily.

Previously, Rin took out a loan with VisionFund, Kiva's partner.  Now, she is requesting a loan with the three-person loan group she leads. Rin will spend her loan purchasing construction tools that she will need for an upcoming job.

loans.use: to buy construction appliance

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Em's Group

texts.en:
Em is 39 years old. She is married and a mother of four children. Currently, she only needs to support three kids as two are in school and one is too young for schooling. 

To tackle her daily living costs, Em grows rice on two hectares. This is her primary source of income. Additionally, Em works as a paid worker at construction sites. She is able to earn about 42,000 KHR per day. 

Em is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a two-person loan group. Em will spend her first loan buying fertilizer and rice seed. She very much hopes that she can increase her yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ileana Maria

texts.es: Doña Ileana siempre trabajando por el bienestar de su familia, ella continua con sus planes que es mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ella comecializa cosmeticos y debes en cuando vende Ropa, el credito lo esta solicitando para la compra de Cosmeticos, Perfumes, Tratamientos de cuidado de Piel y Cabello, etc. ella con sus ganancias ha podido mejorar su vivienda. Agradece el apoyo que ha recibido de parte de Kiva y Afodenic.
texts.en:
Ileana has always worked for the good of her family. She continues with her plan, which is to improve the conditions of her life. She sells cosmetics and clothing.

The loan she is requesting is for purchasing cosmetics, perfumes, skin and hair treatments, etc. Ileana has been able to improve her home with her earnings. She is grateful for the help she has received from Kiva and Afodenic.

loans.use: buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 37 years of age, and happily married with two children. She is involved in direct selling and networking business. Jean's house is near the beach, so she offers an entertainment option for vacationers with a cheaper budget for cottages.

Jean is business minded and is full of hopes in life. Now, she would like to take out a loan of PHP 10,000 to keep her networking and direct selling business. She will use her loan to buy more stocks of herbal food supplement and coffee for her networking business. In addition, she will buy blouses, shoes and sandals for her direct selling business. She hopes that through this requested loan, she could be able to improve her income, educate her two children and sustain their family basic needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her direct selling business

loans.name: Srors' Group

texts.en:
Srors is a single man who resides in Kampong Cham Province. To earn a living, he farms rice and catches fish.  He has been supporting himself in this manner for several years now.

Srors is new to Kiva's partner, VisionFund. Currently, Srors and other two borrowers are seeking a loan of 400,000 KHR each. Srors will spend his entire loan by purchasing cow dung to fertilize his crops. He very much believes he can triple his current yield.

loans.use: to purchase cow dung to fertilize his crops

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to maintain her coffee crop throughout this season.

loans.name: Veasna's Group

texts.en: Veasna is 35 years old and a mother of two children who are in school. For her family, income received from her rice cropping and paid-working job is  used to cover her daily cost of living. She has been involved in the current business for 10 years, earning about 42,000 KHR per day. This is not the original loan for Veasna with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan with success and it has enabled her to improve her lifestyle progressively. Now, she joins a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and insecticide for her crop. She strongly believes that she can triple her yield.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and insecticide for her crop

loans.name: Ban's Group

texts.en: Ban is 60 years old and a widowed mother, residing in Battambang province, where rice cropping is the common cash-crop in the area. She has been in the current business for 11 years. This is not the original loan for Ban with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loan with success and it has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle better than before. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fee, and to buy 8 sacks of rice seed. She hopes to plant her crop seasonally so as she can gain more yield than before.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fee and to buy 8 sacks of rice seed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural products such as organic fertiliser, vitamins and others.

loans.name: Bernadine

texts.en:
This is Bernadine, 45, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Noly, an office staff member, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Bernadine operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. She also has an apartment and a food stall for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 3,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Bernadine dreams of having another branch and hopes that her family is always in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell

loans.name: Yolebie

texts.en: Yolebie is 29 years old and married with one school-age child.  She busies herself tending her little sari-sari store in Oyan, Sibutad. This has been going on for seven years with an income of PHP 8,000 per month.  She became a member of PMPC in 2013 because she wanted to purchase more inventory for her sari-sari store.  She applied for a loan to purchase basic commodities, soft drinks, canned goods and laundry soap.  The profit she earned from her business will be saved with Paglaum in preparation for the education of her child.

loans.use: to purchase basic commodities, soft drinks, canned goods and laundry soap

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 42 years old and married, and they lived at Amulung with their children. 

Her source of income is selling grocery items to the people in her village. She manages her business well in order to achieve good sales. She offers friendly service as well. 

Catherine is now asking for additional capital of PHP 30,000 to buy soft drinks, bread, biscuits, soap, and shampoo to sell. This will help increase sales capacity for the business. 

In the future, she hopes to gain more sales for continuous education of her children.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, bread, biscuits, soap, and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Zaalicah

texts.en:
Zaalicah is a 29 year old woman. She lives in Coron, Palawan, Philippines, one of the areas affected when typhoon Haiyan hit last November 2013. Her partner is Nassir, a businessman and they have children. She and her partner manage their household while operating the business. They both work hard to provide for their everyday needs. 

Zaalicah operates a souvenir shop store. Coron is a tourist spot in the Philippines and many tourists local and international alike visit the place because of the beautiful beaches and scenery. She sells souvenir shirts of different designs and colors. Her customers are foreigners and local tourists. Her minimum everyday sales is PHP 5,000. 

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more souvenir t-shirts for her business.

Zaalicah dreams that her shop will have an extension and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more souvenir shirts needed in her business.

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en: Sambath, 56, is a resident from Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district. She has eight children. To strive for a living, rice cropping and her paid-working job are the main sources of income for her family. Sambath is not a new borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) as she has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past seven loans with successful repayments. Now, her living conditions are getting better than before. For this cycle, in a group of three, she is the leader. For Sambath, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crops. She strongly believes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap is 59 years old and a married mother blessed with six kids. She tackles her family’s hardship via rice cropping, dessert selling, and her paid-working job with which she has occupied for more than 10 years. 

Sopheap, an eighth-cycle borrower, makes up a group of two with a fifth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Sopheap has repaid her past loans completely and it has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle better than before, especially in providing three decent meals a day for her family. 

Now she is seeking for 1,300,000 KHR while her joint borrower is applying for 1,200,000 KHR. As the leader, Sopheap will spend her entire loan portion to pay the plowing fee and buy rice seed and fertilizer for her crop. She strongly believes that she can gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: To pay a plowing fee and to buy rice seed, and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle in order to double production and have enough capital to buy his own land.

loans.name: Pe's Group

texts.en: Pe, a mother of six kids who is in her early 50s, is a villager from Bovel district of Battambang province. She does rice cropping as her main business and works for others for a fee as her supplementary business. She has been involved in her current business for ages. Pe has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for her past seven loans with successful repayment. Now, her living conditions are getting better than before. Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees and to buy fertilizer for her crops. She strongly believes that she can gain a higher yield better than before.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees and to buy fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 64 years old and  a businesswoman from Marapong, Rizal. She has two adult-aged children who help her in their business. 

She has sustained her business for 25 years and Paglaum has been her constant financing partner. 

Recently, she applied a loan  to purchase additional inventory like rice, canned goods, laundry soap, sugar, and oil. Thelma wishes to maintain the label of being a member in good standing with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory like rice, canned goods, laundry soap, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
Cecille is 34-years-old and married with eight school-aged children. She lives in Libertad, Sapang Dalaga.  She has been engaged in farming different fruit varieties, which supplies their village market for four years.  

She joined Paglaum for financial help. She wants to expand her business by requesting a loan. She wants to purchase fertilizer for her farming activities and start snack vending for additional income.  The profit she earns from this business will be saved for educational purposes for her school-aged children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Gnil

texts.en:
Gnil is 41-years-old, married, and has five children who live with him and his wife in a wooden house located in Banteay Meanchey province. He is a farmer and has one and a half hectares of land that he and his wife inherited from both-sides of their parents after they were married. Gnil aims to develop his farming business by expanding the areas for growing rice to have a steady means of sustaining his family’s finances. Gnil has been a rice farmer for more than 15 years, earning approximately USD 9 per day.

Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program with a special rate, Gnil is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding his family's health, and protecting the environment. He will use the loan he's applying for to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve his household's sanitation practices for his family's sake.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve his household's sanitation practices

loans.name: Analissa

texts.en:
Analissa is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines, one of the areas affected by typhoon Haiyan last November 2013.  She is 27 years old, married to Eddie, a tricycle driver, and they have a child. She and her husband manage their household as they operate their business. They both work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP-5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. She also has an apartment and a food stall for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Annalisa hopes to get out of poverty and dreams of giving her child a good education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Kaom's Group

texts.en: Kaom is 56 years old and a widowed mother of four children. She manages a rice cropping farm and works for others for a fee to earn a decent income to support her living. Occupied in the current business for 15 years, she has been able to generate up to 34,500 KHR per day. Kaom has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past one cycle with a successful repayment of her past loan. Now, she leads a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop. She hopes that she can double her yield so it is better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop

loans.name: Sangoem's Group

texts.en: Sangoem is 56 years old and a married mother blessed with six kids. To earn a decent income for her family, she does rice cropping and has a paid-working job to supplement her income. She has been involved in her current business for ages and she can earn up to 33,000 KHR per day. Sangoem is in her ninth loan cycle and her co-borrower is in her sixth loan cycle. The successful repayment of her past loans has enabled her to improve her lifestyle so it is better than before. For this cycle, she is seeking for 800,000 KHR and her joint borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and insecticide for her crop. She strongly believes that she can gain a good yield that is better than before.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and insecticide

loans.name: Kelly José

texts.es:
Kelly es una joven mujer con muchas ganas de progresar y salir adelante, por esta razón decide iniciar con su propio negocio que consiste en una pequeña tienda instalada afuera de casa y consiste en un par de mesas pequeñas y algunos ganchos para colocar sus productos.
Desde allí ofrece distintos productos como frituras, dulces, algunas bebidas y galletas. Es una mujer emprendedora y con grandes esperanzas.
Tiene la ilusión de aumentar su negocio y por eso necesita comprar surtido de productos para su tienda.
De esta manera podrá tener un inventario un poco más amplio para ofrecerlos a sus clientes.
Trabaja de lunes a sábado todo el día y es muy dedicada en su actividad.
Aunque por el momento no le genera mucha rentabilidad por la poca cantidad de clientes ella sueña con tener un gran local donde pueda exhibir y vender sus productos.
texts.en: Kelly is a young woman with great ambitions to make something of herself and get ahead. That's why she decided to start her own business, a little store out front of her house that consists of a couple of little tables and some hooks to display her goods. From this set-up, she offers various products like fried snacks, candy, a few beverages, and cookies. She is an enterprising woman with big dreams; she has a vision of growing her business, and for that she needs to buy various products for her store. This way, she'll be able to offer a somewhat broader inventory for her customers. She is very dedicated to her business, working Monday through Saturday all day long. Though it's not earning her much  for the moment, given the small number of customers, she dreams of having a big store where she can display and sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise like fried snacks, candy, beverages, and cookies

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en: Chan is 55 years old and a villager from Battambang province. She is a widowed mother of six children. To earn a living, she raises chickens and works for others for a fee. The 15 years involvement in the current business has generated her about 35,000 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Chan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan completely and it has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle in a gradual pace. Now, she joins a group of two to get a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR, of which she is requesting 500,000. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more chickens and feed. She hopes that she can expand her chicken raising business in a larger scale.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and feed

loans.name: Reth's Group

texts.en:
Reth is 24 years old and a single lady residing in Battambang province where her rice crop is grown and her paid-working is performed. 

Her three years' involvement in the current business has enabled her to improve her living conditions at a gradual pace which resulted from the past loans that she has fully repaid. Now, she can earn about 30,000 KHR per day.  With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is not a first time borrower, nor are her joint borrowers. 

Reth leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can double her previous yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Barot

texts.ru:
Барот 47 летний мужчина, женат имеет 3 детей. Он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультурой, у него растет виноград и абрикос. Зарабатывает на жизнь в сельском хозяйстве, которому научила его мать и отец для выращивания кукурузы. С самого раннего возраста он делал эту деятельность, работая каждый день. Он также имеет скот, несколько голов коров. Каждый день он  встает рано, чтобы доить своих коров, и водит  их на пастбище,   которое находиться несколько  километров от своего дома.
Деньги от займа будут использованы для покупки минеральных удобрений. В будущем, Барот надеется вырастить больше урожая.
texts.en: Barot is 47, married and has 3 children. He farms apricots and grapes for a living and also has a few cows to boot.  He gets up early every day to milk his cows and take them to pasture a few miles from his home.  He's plied his trade since he was little, working each and every day; as a kid, he first learned how to farm from his mother and father when they grew corn.  He's currently seeking a loan to buy mineral fertilizers for his farm, and is hoping for a bountiful harvest.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Trea's Group

texts.en: A young mother in her mid-20s who needs to support one little kid, Trea is a local farmer who does rice cropping and raises pigs as her main source of income. To earn more income, she uses her spare time to work for others for a fee. This is the original loan for Trea with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more piglets to raise. She highly hopes that she can gain a high income from her business so as she can send her kids to school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Alatina

texts.en:
Alatina is a 23-year-old married man with three children. He works as a seasonal worker in New Zealand, picking kiwifruit to earn a living. He has been doing this for four years.

Alatina has requested a loan to pay for airfare, visa, clothing and pocket money. 

He joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services. With his earnings, Alatina hopes to support his family financially.

loans.use: to pay for airfare, visa, clothing and pocket money for his seasonal work in New Zealand.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora offers charcoal to her locality. She has been involved in this kind of business for ten years. Leonora is 42 years of age, married, and blessed with three children. Two of her children go to school, while the other one is still an infant. With her determination to improve her living conditions, she is requesting for a loan of PHP 7,000 to use to buy an additional 15 sacks of charcoal to sell. She knows that through this loan amount, she could obtain greater income and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, and insecticides for her coffee crop

loans.name: Mars' Group

texts.en: Mars is 41 years old, married, and a mother blessed with two sons. To cover the daily costs of living, she grows rice and works for others for a fee. She has been involved in the current business for ages with a decent income in return. This will be the fifth loan for Mars and her joint-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). The past loans, which she has fully paid back, have enabled her to uplift her lifestyle better than before. For this cycle, she is seeking for 700,000 KHR, whereas her co-borrower is applying for 500,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees. She strongly believes that she can prepare her farmland on time, so as she can replant her crop seasonably.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Heab's Group

texts.en:
Heab is 52 years old and a married mother blessed with one child who is in school. Rice farming, which she has been engaged in for 20 years, and fishing are the family's main sources of income, generating about 34,000 KHR per day. 

Heab, not a first-time borrower with Kiva partner VisionFund, has repaid her previous loan, a loan that enabled her to improve her family's living standard. Now leading  a borrowing group of three, Heab will use her loan portion to pay for a plowing fee, fertilizer, rice seed and fishing materials. She strongly believes that she can earn more income with the support of this loan.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fee, fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Andres

texts.en: Andres is a resident of Tubod, Aloran. He earns a living through fish selling. He signed up for membership with the Cooperative in 2010, and he enjoys the benefits of being a member. He is seeking financial help to buy additional kilos of fish to sell. He deeply wishes to maintain a membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy additional kilos of fish to sell.

loans.name: Crecer Group

texts.es: El grupo “Crecer” está conformada por 05  personas emprendedoras que buscan mejorar cada día. Bertha de 61 años es casada con 05 hijos mayores de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Gracias a su negocio a podido tener una mejor calidad de vida. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de azúcar, arroz, frejol y leche. Seguir trabajando positivamente es su mayor deseo.  La Alcancía Comunal “Crecer” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito.  Bertha es la segunda del lado derecho y viste blusa floreado.
texts.en: The "Crecer" [Grow] group is made up of 5 enterprising people who look to improve every day. Bertha, 61, is married with 5 children, of age. She makes a living selling groceries. Thanks to her business she has been able to have a better quality of life. It's for this that she applied for the loan for the purchase of sugar, rice, beans and milk. Her greatest desire is to continue working. The "Crecer" village bank thanks the people who made this loan possible. Bertha is the second on the right side and seen in a floral blouse.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans and milk.

loans.name: Remberto Antonio

texts.es: Remberto de 46 años de edad está casado y tienen dos hijos menores de edad (de 9 y de 12 años de edad). Remberto desde la edad de 12 años comenzó a trabajar como ayudante de albañil, hoy ya es muy reconocido por la calidad de sus trabajos y su honestidad como albañil de la zona. Remberto ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina galvanizada y sustituirla por la existente del techo de una habitación y del corredor de su vivienda ya que está muy deteriorada.
texts.en: Remberto, age 46, is married and has two children (ages 9 and 12). Twelve years ago, Remberto began working as an assistant to a stone mason, and today he is well recognize for the quality of his work and his honesty as a neighborhood mason. Remberto is seeking a loan with FUSAI to buy corrugated metal to replace the roof over a room and the hallway of his house, which is in very poor condition.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal to replace the roof over a room and the hallway of his house

loans.name: Leok's Group

texts.en: Leok is 44 years old and a married mother blessed with three kids (one not yet school-aged and two who are in school). She is a farmer who grows rice and raises pig. To earn additional income, she works at a part-time job, wrapping fermented fish. She has been involved in her current business for 15 years, earning about 37,000 KHR per day. Loek is not a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid a past loan successfully and it has enabled her to improve her lifestyle. Now, in a group of three, she is a leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy two sacks of fertilizer, rice seed, insecticide, and to pay for a  pig-fee and a plowing fee. She strongly believes that she can gain a good yield better than before.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of fertilizer, rice seed, insecticide, and to pay for a pig-fee and a plowing fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Saveth's Group

texts.en:
Saveth, 40, is a resident of Battambang province, where she runs her business. She has three kids, one of whom is too young for schooling. The main source of income for her family is rice cropping, fish selling, and a paid job of traditional music during wedding events. She has been occupied in the current business for 15 years.

This is the second loan for Saveth and the fifth loan for her joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). With the successful repayment of the past loan, it has helped her to improve her lifestyle better than before. 

For this cycle, she is seeking 1,400,000 KHR, while her joint borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy seed, three sacks of fertilizer, and insecticide, pay for the plowing fee, and buy fish for resale. 

She strongly believes that she can gain a good yield from her crop, better than before.

loans.use: to buy seed, three sacks of fertilizer, and insecticide, to pay for the plowing fee, and to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Koeurn's Group

texts.en: Koeurn is 56 years old, married, and a mother blessed with three kids. She deals with her daily costs of living via rice cropping, cassava farming, and her paid working job during her spare time. She has been occupied in the current business for 15 years. Koeurn has been with VisionFund  (Kiva’s partner) for six loans already, with successful repayment. Now, her living conditions are getting better than before. For this cycle, she teams up in a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees, rice seed, and to pay for transplanting fees for her cassava. She strongly hopes to gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, rice seed, and for transplanting fees.

loans.name: Soeury's Group

texts.en: A local villager from Bovel district of Battambang province, Soeury is married and has four children. Besides rice cropping and cassava farming, she has other paid work as part in her income generating activity. She has been involved in the current business for 14 years. This is the fifth microloan for Soeury with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The successful repayment of her past loans has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle better than before, especially her household. Now, she and her joint borrower are seeking 1,800,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees and rice seed for her cash crops. She hopes that her living conditions are getting better than before.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees, and rice seed for her cash crops.

loans.name: Trabajadoras Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TRABAJADORAS HORMIGUITAS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lourdys es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de faldas, tienda de barrio, venta de cosméticos, tejido de mantas, venta de shampoo.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lourdys es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de shampoo; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió sola, al observar el comercio del producto, es por ello que ya lleva ocho años con este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de shampoo por mayor) que adquirirá en las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Thrifty Workers" Community Group will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Center. The group is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors of which Lourdys is the Secretary. The members' engage in a variety of businesses, including: making skirts, running a general store, cosmetics sales, blanket weaving, and shampoo sales.  

This loan will help the small businesses that Lourdys is involved in. She recounts that she is in her second cycle with Pro Mujer, having been invited by a friend who was a member. Currently, she run a business selling shampoo, which is a business she developed on her own by watching others sell this product. She has been in this business for eight years. 

The loan she is taking out now will increase her capital, by purchasing shampoo at wholesale in distribution stores in the City of El Alto and then selling them out of her home. This work allows her to earn an income to support her family, as she is single and has three children. When asked when she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health and hygiene training offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy shampoo at wholesale

loans.name: Kevin Gregory

texts.es: Kevin de 19 años de edad, es soltero y se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Odontología en la Universidad. Su carrera tiene  un periodo de 5  años viene estudiando  3  años. El está muy entusiasmado y motivado en terminar su carrera, cuenta con el apoyo  de  sus  quienes  le  brindan su  apoyo para  salir  adelante. Uno de sus mayores anhelos  es  abrir  un consultorio  dental, actualmente ya se encuentra prestando servicios de apoyo en un consultorio dental, generando ingresos el cual lo destina para pagar sus estudios, a sus estudios le pone mucho entusiasmo y dedicación. Su objetivo para el futuro es convertirse en un profesional de éxito. El agradece a las personas que  le  han  brindado su  apoyo, ya  que  le  están ayudando  a cumplir  con sus  metas.
texts.en:
Kevin is 19 years old. He is single and is studying the degree of Odontology (Dentistry) in the university. His degree takes 5 years, and he is coming upon studying for 3 years. Kevin is very enthusiastic and motivated to finish his degree. He has the support of his parents who give him their support to get ahead. One of his greatest desires is to open a dental office. Presently Kevin now finds himself providing support services in a dentist´s office, earning income which he puts toward paying for his studies. He puts a lot of enthusiasm and dedication into his studies.

Kevin's objective for the future is to make himself into a successful professional. He is grateful to the people that have given him their support, because they are helping him to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy dentistry instruments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine for her mother and also to buy clothing for all ages

loans.name: Chetra's Group

texts.en: A mother of three kids and in her early 40’s, Chetra is a resident from Bovel district of Battambang province. For her family, three hectares of rice cropping and a pig-raising business are the main sources of income, which she has been occupied with since she was 20 years old. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she and her co-borrower in a group of two are in their sixth loan cycle with successful repayment of the past five loans. The positive impact of her past loans have helped her to provide three sufficient meals for her kids, and to set aside some money for future needs. Now in the same cycled loan, she and her co-borrower are applying for 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees, fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for labor costs. She strongly believes that she can gain a goody yield from her paddy rice, so she can keep improving her lifestyle in a gradual pace.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, fertilizer, rice seed, and for labor costs.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en: Raul is 42 years old and single. He has been in the footwear business for 18 years.Through this kind of business, he was able to sustain his family's basic needs and provide farm supplies for his farming business. Now, he would like to grow his footwear business,  consequently he is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP. He will use this loan to buy more stocks of footwear such as shoes, sandals and slippers for resale.  He believes that he could make his business a viable source of his family income and satisfy his costumers demand.

loans.use: to buy stocks of footwear such as shoes, sandals and slippers for resale

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a 59-year-old businesswoman from Marapong, Sibutad. She has supported her three children by having a sari-sari store.  She has been able to sustain the store for 15 years and credits PMPC with the capitalization of her business. She took several loans before and was able to pay off all her obligations in a timely fashion.  Now, she has applied for another loan to restock her store with basic commodities. She wants to purchase bags of rice and kinds of canned goods to sell. She deeply hopes to sustain her business and continue to be member in good standing with the Cooperative.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Samith's Group

texts.en: Samith is 47 years old and a villager from Battambang province where rice cropping is the common crop in the area. The five hectares of rice farming and her paid working job brings her a decent income to support her family; after the 15 years of involvement in her current business. Samith is already a borrower her in eighth loan cycle.  She has repaid her past loans completely, and that has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle. Now, she and her joint borrower are applying for 600,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crop.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela es soltera pero tiene un hijo, ella vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento y paga un anticretico (una modalidad de renta) Marcela es psicologa y trabaja con niños violentos en una institucion.Marcela necesita un prestamo para compra de una movilidad Ella es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda para tener un medio de transporte que le permita transitar por largas distancias por motivos de su trabajo
texts.en: Marcela is single and has a son, she lives in La Paz in a brick-and-cement house. She pays for it with an "anticretico" (a type of rent). Marcela is a psychologist who works with violent youth at a center. Marcela needs a loan to buy a means of transportation. She is the only bread winner for her household. The means of transportation will enable her to travel the long distances required for her job.

loans.use: to buy a form of transportation

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline owns her furniture shop business. She is happily married and blessed with four children. All of her children are still studying. The couple both work hard in order to obtain greater income. Evangeline's furniture shop business has been in operation for ten years.

Evangeline would like to seek financial assistance amounting to PHP 10,000. This amount of loan will be used to purchase raw wood, varnish and nails for her furniture business. She is hoping that lenders will grant her requested loan amount in order to keep it profitable someday. Evangeline is looking forward to continuous growth of her furniture business.

loans.use: to buy raw wood, varnish and nails for her furniture business

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is a businesswoman from Sinaad, Sapang Dalaga. She owns a small sari-sari store in their barrio. At the age of 53, with six children, she never tires of tending her store.  She is a new member of Paglaum and has applied for her first loan. She is in need of finances to purchase additional inventories of sugar, oil, and laundry soap to sell. The profits she earns from her business will be saved, because she plans to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventories of sugar, oil, and laundry soap to sell.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy, a 44-year-old married mother of three, lives in Sinaad, Sapang Dalaga, where she runs a business selling used clothing. She finds joy in this new business and the potential for good earnings that it offers.

In need of start-up capitalization, Mary Joy joined Paglaum and is now requesting a loan to purchase bundles of used clothing for resale. She will save her profits to buy a delivery van for the easy transport of her stocks.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing for resale

loans.name: Florida

texts.en: Florida is 60 years old, living in Upper Dicayas, Dipolog City, Philippines. She has been a member in good standing from the very beginning of her membership at Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. She is blessed with five children, and all of them were sent to school, and some of them are already married. Starting with a capital of 10,000 PHP, she opened a Sari-sari store and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings, and enjoys the benefits given by the coop. Currently she is applying for 14,900 PHP to buy additional stocks for her Sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. She hopes and prays for the success of her business.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies for her Sari-Sari store.

loans.name: Mendanilla

texts.en:
Mendanilla is 60 years old, married with two adult age children. She has a farm in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga. Farming is their primary source of income. She joined Paglaum for financial help.

Since 2010, Mendanilla has maintained her membership with a good repayment record. Recently, she applied for another loan to buy farm inputs.

She wishes to buy another parcel of land to till.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Cheer

texts.en:
Cheer is 48 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with two children who are now at their adult and school age.

Cheer has had a little store and sold groceries and other consumable products for 10 years already. Cheer earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of business activity. At present, she is also an appointed secretary of her barangay. She has requested a loan to be used for the processing of her brother’s papers for employment abroad.

Cheer has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Cheer a hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to pay for the processing of her brother’s papers for employment abroad.

loans.name: José Felipe

texts.es:
José de 39 años de edad,  es padre de cuatro hijos los cuales tres de ellos ya tienen sus propios hogares y viven en la comunidad, se acompaño hace un año con su esposa y tiene un niño de un año de edad, su esposa trabaja en los oficios del hogar y también por las mañanas trabaja donde un familiar por días haciendo tortillas para la venta en la comunidad.
José  estudio octavo grado del nivel básico en la escuela que esta en la comunidad. De él solo depende su esposa, su hijo y a su madre a quien también apoya.
José  trabaja en diferentes actividades, conoce muy bien el arte de la música y tiene un grupo cristiano con un grupo de amigos de la comunidad y van a amenizar actividades religiosas a diferentes comunidades donde se les invite, también es peluquero en su comunidad y trabaja en diferentes oficios.
Esta actualmente impartiendo conocimientos de la música a un grupo de jóvenes de una comunidad aledaña. Viaja tres días por semana al lugar donde enseña  a las personas a tocar diferentes instrumentos musicales. Aprendió desde joven y fue así como fue mejorando cada día.

Cliente solicita el crédito en credicampo, para mejorar la vivienda donde reside, actualmente esta por mejorar una habitación  y la cocina del hogar pues en el invierno presenta graves problemas por que se inunda de agua cuando las lluvias son muy fuertes en la zona.
Será de gran utilidad el financiamiento pues ayudara para que tener en mejores condiciones el hogar donde reside con su esposa y su madre.

José  esta convencido de que tiene que trabajar muy duro cada día, para lograr el sueño de tener una casa en mejores condiciones cada y hacer un grupo de música cristiana con un mejor sonido para apoyar a las comunidades en diferentes eventos.
texts.en:
José is 39 years old and is the father of four children, three of whom already have their own homes and live in the community.  He was remarried a year ago and he and his wife have a one year old child.  His wife works in their home and also in the morning works with a family member making tortillas to sell in the community.

José was educated through the 8th grade in the community school.  He takes care of his wife, his youngest child, and his mother.  

José works in different fields. He knows the field of music very well and he has a Christian band made up of friends from the community and they play at different religious and community events where they are invited.  He is also a barber in town and works in other areas.  Currently he is sharing his musical knowledge with a group of young people in a neighboring town.  He travels three days a week to a place where he teaches young people to play different musical instruments. He learned this when he was young and he continues to get better every day.

He is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Credicampo in order to improve the house where he lives.  Currently the loan is for improving a room and the kitchen of the house since in the winter these present grave problems because they fill with water when the rains are strong in the zone.

The loan will be of great help because it will enable him to have better living conditions in his home, where his wife, child, and mother reside. 

José is convinced that he has to work very hard every day in order to achieve his dream of having his house in better condition and enabling his Christian musical group to have a better sound in order to support the different events in the community.

loans.use: To improve a room and the kitchen of his house since in the winter these present grave problems because they fill with water when the rains are strong in the zone.

loans.name: Falaniko

texts.en:
Falaniko is a 36-year-old married man with one child.

He works as a seasonal worker in New Zealand for five months picking kiwifruit to earn a living. He has been doing this for three years. Falaniko has requested a loan to pay for airfare, a visa, clothing and pocket money.

He joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services. With his earnings, Falaniko hopes to support his family financially.

loans.use: to pay for airfare, a visa, clothing and pocket money

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
A mother of two and married to a farmer, Merlyn, age 58, is happy tending her sari-sari store. It is her means of earning a living in support of her family. Fortunately, the store is located in a populous neighborhood, so she makes good daily sales.  

Merlyn has requested a loan of 14900PHP  to expand her inventory in order to earn additional income. She has confidence that she can remain a member in good standing.

Merlyn believes that with the help of Paglaum Cooperative, she will sustain her family and beat the competition.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store.

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bricks for the floor

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 56 years old, married and lives in Toril, Aloran, Philippines. In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood. The piglets' owners share in the profits upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending on their agreement. With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well.

Through Pauglam PC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional feed. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional feed

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Anna. Anna is a smallholder rural farmer based in Kitale, an agricultural farm in rural Kenya. She was blessed with one child. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past seven years. On her farm, she grows maize, keeps a dairy cow and raises poultry. Anna sells milk, eggs and maize from her farm. When she is not farming, she is off offering produce transportation services to other farmers on her motorcycle. Her highest monthly expense is family. To meet these expenses and provide the best for her family, Anna often engages in small personal businesses to make extra money.

Farming gives Anna a great sense of satisfaction despite the meager income, "I enjoy it most when I see my customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!"

Her biggest challenge is drought. The long dry season usually leads to crop failures and poor yields. To a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family.

Because of this challenge, Anna formed a group and joined Juhudi, a microfinance supporting smallholder rural farmers. She acquired a dairy cow that she later named Mrembo (Swahili for beautiful). Mrembo produced milk daily, which Anna sold to a co-operative union. "The money from milk comes regularly and it is not very affected by sudden changes in weather if you have stored feed," said Anna. The money Anna got from selling the milk was adequate to repay the loan.

Today, Anne is seeking a loan to purchase another dairy cow. She is planning to transition to become a fully-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage.

With your loan, Anne is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer. All she wants is her family to enjoy the abundance of life, good health and livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Freddy Ariel

texts.es:
Freddy, es un pequeño caficultor de 26 años de edad. Con mucho esfuerzo propio y de su familia, logró estudiar hasta quinto año secundaria. Este productor vive en su pequeña finca en una comunidad de Jinotega, al norte de Nicaragua. El se ha dedicado a la producción de granos básicos, pero debido a la baja rentabilidad de este rubro y conociendo el potencial de la zona donde vive para producir café, se decidió a sembrar café desde hace más de 5 años. 
Este productor de carácter pasivo, amable y con un gran sentido de la responsabilidad, cuenta con 0.7 hectárea de café y tiene el reto de aumentar los rendimientos productivos de su plantación. Para esto se ha puesto como meta implementar un plan de mejoramiento en el mantenimiento de su  finca, para lo cual solicita un crédito para la adquisición de insumos agrícolas que le ayuden a conseguir su meta. 
Su sueño es incrementar el área de café, rubro en el que ha tenido utilidades en estos años, y además formar una familia a la cual le pueda brindar una casa con mejores condiciones a las que le tuvo acceso, además de que sus hijos puedan llegar a estudiar en la universidad.
texts.en:
Freddy is 26 years old and a coffee grower. With much efforts of his own and his family, he studied until high school. This producer lives on his small farm in the community of Jinotega, in the north of Nicaragua. He has worked in the production of basic grains, but due to the low profits of this work, and knowing the potential of the region where he lives to produce coffee, he decided to sew coffee five years ago. 

This producer has a passive and friendly character, with a great sense of responsibility. He has 0.7 hectares of coffee crops. He has the challenge of increasing the productive performance of his land. For this he has set a goal to implement a plan of improving the maintenance of his farm, for which he is requesting a loan for the acquisition of agricultural supplies that will help him reach his goal. 

His dream is to increase the area of coffee, a crop that has been useful in recent years. Furthermore, he hopes to form a family, for which he can provide a house with better conditions than the ones he had access to. He also hopes his children can study in a university.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Yamileth Del Rosario

texts.es: La Señora Yamileth continua con su sueño que es mejorar su vivienda, su esposo siempre la apoya en todos las decisiones, ella tiene su negocio en su propio domicilio, alquiler de Nintendos, el cual le genera ganancias que utiliza para los gastos del hogar ella adicional labora como domestica para una casa privada, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de Materiales de construcción como Piedras, cemento, Hierro, Arena etc. ya que construirá un muro en su vivienda, Agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le ha brindado
texts.en: Yamileth continues with her dream of improving her housing. Her husband always helps her with all the decisions. She has a business in her own home renting Nintendos which generates her income that she uses for the household expenses. She additionally does domestic work for a private household. She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials like stone, cement, iron, sand, etc. She will construct a wall in her housing. She is grateful for the support that Kiva and Afodenic have provided.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic compost and cacao seedlings

loans.name: Salin's Group

texts.en: Salin, 66, is a citizen from Bovel district of Batatmbang province. She has two kids who are still students. The main source of her family income is from rice farming and her husband's occupation as a house builder and paid-worker. The business that she has done for 15 years has enabled her to earn up to 30,000 KHR per day. Salin is in a sixth-cycled loan VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan completely and it has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle.  Now, she leads a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees, to buy fertilizer, and to pay labor costs. She highly believes that she can gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, to buy fertilizer, and to pay  for labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy components of a solar power system (battery, regulator, and other items)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and iron to finish building a bath with a shower and to cement the floor of the hallway of the house.

loans.name: Thembinkosi

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 29-year-old Thembinkosi from Masvingo. She is single with one child. She also cares for two dependents. Thembinkosi runs a clothing business selling clothes, shoes and weaves. The business has been in operation for 7 years. She says the main challenges she faces are low sales during mid months. Thembinkosi has requested a loan of $600 to purchase stock for her boutique. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to assist her brother in paying his school fees. In the future Thembinkosi plans to ensure growth of the business and have a variety of stock in the store.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her boutique.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as corn, rice, vegetables, and other items

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es:
Nobleza, dignidad, constancia y cierto risueño coraje, definen a Leticia, quien día a día comercializa queso en un mercado popular, donde una de sus amigas le cedió espacio en su tramo. Ella tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos, todos mayores. Es una mujer que aprendió a ganar su dinero de manera honrada, empezó a trabajar desde joven. Vendía granos básicos, cuyas ganancias le facilitaban el acondicionamiento de su hogar.  Su mano derecha es su esposo, juntos buscan asegurarse una vejez tranquila.
Ella solicita el crédito para aumentar la producción de su capital. Necesita comprar queso al por mayor, de manera que pueda cumplir la demanda de su clientela, que día a día aumenta y al mismo tiempo desea incrementar sus ganancias. Ella deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, puesto que cumplirán uno de sus sueños, mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Uno de sus planes futuros es lograr comprar un tramo y que su negocio crezca poco a poco, asegura que pondrá todo su esfuerzo y dedicación.
texts.en:
Nobility, dignity, perseverance and some cheerful courage, define Leticia, who sells cheese each day at a popular market where one of her friends gave her space in her stall. She is 62 years old, married and has three children, all older.

She is a woman who learned to earn her money honestly, beginning to work at a young age. She sells basic staples. The proceeds facilitate the upkeep of her home. Her right hand is her husband and together they seek to ensure a peaceful old age.

She is requesting a loan to increase the production of capital. She needs to buy cheese in bulk so she can meet the demand of her customers, which increases day by day, and at the same time she want to increase her profits.

She puts her trust in this funding to fulfill one of her dreams which is to improve the living conditions of her family. One of her future plans is to buy a stall of her own and grow her business bit by bit.  She assures she will do this with every effort and dedication.

loans.use: to purchase cheese in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an intensive English course and to buy required educational materials.

loans.name: Maleko

texts.en: Maleko is a 28-year-old married man and has 2 children. He works as a seasonal worker picking kiwi fruit to earn a living. He has been doing this for 3 years. Maleko wants a loan to pay for a visa, airfare, clothing and pocket money. He joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services. With his earnings, he hopes to support his family financially and pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to pay for a Visa, airfare, clothing and pocket money

loans.name: Ledelia

texts.en:
Ledelia has operated her variety store for seven years. She is also a hog raiser within her locality. This time she wants to focus herself on her variety store so she can obtain greater income and satisfy her customers' demands.

Ledelia plans to purchase grocery items such as soft drinks, coffee, sugar, biscuits and canned goods to sell but her capital is not sufficient. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP. She is hoping that in the future she can educate her two children and improve her living condition.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as soft drinks, coffee,sugar ,biscuits and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Nimol's Group

texts.en:
Nimol is 38 years old and a villager from Battambang province. She is widowed and has four children.  Three of her children are attending school.   Her main source of income is from her paid-working job. 

She is a nine-cycled borrower. She has repaid back her past loans with success and they have enabled her to improve her lifestyle. Now, in a group of two, she is a leader. Nimol will spend her entire loan portion to buy a decent motorbike for commuting,  The money saved from transportation expenses will be used to support her children instead.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike

loans.name: Souy's Group

texts.en:
A mother in her late 40s, Souy is a widow and resident from Phnom Proek district of Battambang province. She has five children, two of whom are in school. The main sources of income for her family are from Rice farming, maize and cassava planting. During her spare time, she also provides paid-services for plowing the rice farmland. She has been involved in her current business for ages with a decent income in return. 

Souy is not a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan completely and it has enabled her to provide enough food for her kids and can set aside some money for her crop. For this cycle, she leads a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed, to pay for labor costs, and to pay for plowing fees. She strongly believes that she can gain a good yield so that she can keep providing the basic needs for her kids.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, to pay for labor costs, and to pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Loun's Group

texts.en:
Loun is 38 years old and a married mother blessed with four children. All of her kids still count on her, as one is too young for school and the remaining three are in school. Loun is a vendor and a rice farmer. She has been involved in this business for six years.

This is the third loan for Loun and fourth loan for her co-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan completely and it has enabled her to improve her lifestyle at a gradual pace. Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees, and to buy rice seeds. She hopes that she can gain a good yield.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food products such as cereals, sugar in bulk, drinks.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 61, widowed and has three adult-age children. She lives a rural community and cooks and sells meals and snacks. She has been in this business for almost 10 years. She aims to further improve this business in order to earn a higher income. 

She wants to prepare more recipes to sell but she has limited capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy vegetables, meat, fish, flour and other ingredients needed for her business. Through this financial assistance, she believes that she will be able to improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fish, flour and other ingredients needed

location.town: Brgy. Bone South, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 60-year-old single lady blessed with four children. She has been in business for ten years now. Her monthly income is 10,000 Kenyan Shillings. She is requesting a loan to purchase more potatoes to sell.  The profits she will get will be used to expand the current business. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are for her family and business to prosper.

loans.use: to buy and sell potatoes

loans.name: Xerses

texts.en:
Xerses lives at Solana, with his wife and child. Xerses is an entreprenuer who buys soft drinks and sells them at wholesale to sari-sari (variety) stores in his village and nearby communities. He has been in the business for over four years now. He also opened a store selling grocery items. 

Xerses is now asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy more soft drinks and grocery items such as soap, shampoo, biscuits, and noodles to sell. This will help increase sales and profits as well. Additional revenue will be saved for the family's future expenses. He uses a motorcycle to transport soft drinks to nearby communities.

Xerses photo was taken at ASKI office during his visit.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks and grocery items such as soap, shampoo, biscuits, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Reginah

texts.en:
Reginah is 27 years old and married. She has been blessed with two children. She has been in the butcher business for five years now and currently makes an estimated monthly income of 6,400 KES.  She would like a loan of a 10,000 KES.   

Through this loan she will buy more goats for slaughtering and selling. She anticipates that she will one day own a wholesale shop. Her hope is that in the future she will educate her children to higher levels.

loans.use: to buy meat for the butcher shop

loans.name: Lumturi

texts.en:
Lumturi bought a watering pump with your help through a previous loan. Now she wants to buy seeds of potato, corn and beans.  She has already prepared the soil for planting and is waiting for the seeds. 

She has been photographed with a handmade broom that she makes herself and sells them to the Egyptian Albanian market. Kindly note that members of this community are known for being very handy, whether men or women. The broom that you see in the picture is made of flax seed straws.

loans.use: to buy seeds of potato, corn and beans for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic compost and chickens in bulk.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines, one of the areas affected by typhoon Haiyan last November 2013, She is 58 years old and she is married to Felimon, a farmer and they have a child. She and her husband manage their household and operate their business. They both work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Mercedes operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. She also has an apartment and a food stall for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Mercedes dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to help her child financially. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Meet Regina, a small-scale farmer in Kitale, Kenya. She owns a small piece of land where she lives with her 6 children. For the last 12 years, she has been growing maize on the piece of land. She has managed to make a living selling the maize grains to millers after harvest. She is also involved in other small personal businesses to make extra money. 

Recently, she started keeping poultry for fun. She liked the fact that she could wake up in the morning and collect eggs for her family's breakfast. She started looking at poultry as a business when she had more hens and surplus eggs for breakfast. She started selling eggs to neighbours. More neighbours kept coming wanting more and more everyday. 

Regina seeks a loan to purchase poultry.. She can hardly meet the demand as it is today. Her major challenge is raising funds. She was, however, referred to Juhudi Kilimo, KIVA's field partner, by a well-wisher.

With your loan, Regina will grow her poultry business to the next level. The extra income will meet her high business-related costs. The loan will help her family improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 24 years old. She is married and together with her husband have one child. She has two adult dependants. She has been offering tailoring services for four years now. She would like a loan of 20,000 KES. 

She would like to improve her business by buying material and a sewing machine through the loan. She currently makes an estimated monthly income of 30,000 KES. She anticipates that from her profits she will buy supplies of materials in bulk. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loan and she hopes that in future she will make her business successful and be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy material and a sewing machine

loans.name: Annonciatha

texts.en: Annonciatha is 29 years old. She is married and has two children. She sells food items and has been in the business for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy cassava and rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to purchase items such as cassava and rice for sale

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a businessman living in Nairobi. He owns several houses in Mukuru Slums and would like to provide better services to his tenants. He seeks a loan to help him purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets for his tenants. 

The toilets will also serve as a means to create a cleaner environment around the area where his houses are. He hopes that the toilets will add value to his plots and attract tenants for the vacant houses. He plans to add more toilets in the future to help avert the sanitation problem in urban slums.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilet

loans.name: Roth's Group

texts.en:
Aged 24 years old, Roth is a married mother of two children living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Rice farming is the main source of the family’s income. She has been in this business for five years. 

Roth’s group consists of two members who are just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her rice paddy, by selling the rice for a good price.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer to help the soil in order to plant in this new season.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is married with two children. Jeanette is 33 years old and lives in Señor, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Jeanette sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 5000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 50000 PHP to restock her store with basic commodities.

Jeanette has been a member of PMPC for two months. In the future, Jeanette hope to expand her business and save more.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Sarim

texts.en:
This client is Sarim. She is 42 years old and a resident living in a village of Bakan district, Pursat province. She described herself to be a low-educated woman who is dedicated to agriculture, specially growing and harvesting rice for sale. She has been a farmer for nearly 20 years and has the support of her husband and children.

Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program with a special rate, Sarim is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding her family's health and protecting the environment. She will use the loan she's applying for to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a responsible house wife who helps her husband in gaining income. She is 54 years old and blessed with two children. They aim to improve their standard of living in order to give their children a bright future. 

As a way of generating income, she engages in making ice candies with different flavors that she sells in her community. She aims to continue and improve this business, but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy buko (coconut), sugar, milk, plastics and other ingredients needed in making ice candies. Being a hard working mother, she believes that she will be able to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy buko (coconut), sugar, milk, plastics and other ingredients needed

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 46 years old. She is married and together they have been blessed with one child. They also support four adult dependents. She has been running her saloon for four years now. She would like to purchase a hair dryer and beauty products for the saloon however, she needs capital, and is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES. 

She currently makes an estimated monthly income of 14,000 KES. She will use her anticipated profits to pay for her loan in good time.

In the future, she hopes and dreams of having a business that can sustain her family and elevate their living standards.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and beauty products for use on clients

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Caroline is 51 years old. She is married and together she and her husband have been blessed with four children and one adult dependent. She currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES.32,524 and would like a loan of KES.75,000. 

She anticipates that through her profits, she will improve her family's welfare. She has successfully repaid all her previous loans. She hopes and dreams to see all her children and grandchildren succeed.

loans.use: buy more secondhand clothes for selling.

loans.name: Regarn

texts.en:
Meet Regarn, a smallholder rural farmer in Kitale, a rural agricultural town in Kenya. For 10 years, Regarn has been planting maize on his plot to raise his 3 children. He also owns a motorcycle for ferrying his produce to the market. He makes extra income providing transportation services to other farmers. 

He enjoys growing food and serving others. He invests in relationships with his clients to encourage repeat purchases. His biggest challenge is droughts. Lack of enough rainfall has led him to losses in the past. 

Regarns wife keeps poultry because it is kind of a requirement in the traditional way of life. Regarn is impressed with the progress he has witnessed from starting with one chicken: They have eggs for breakfast everyday; they eat chicken every special occasion, and his wife is selling eggs to shops and hotels. 

Regarn is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. He knows the potential is there. He joined Juhudi Kilimo through a group called Nawanga SHG. As a group, they were taken through various trainings. "I learned the importance of working as a team or in a group" Regarn said. 

With your loan, Regarn is going to make his poultry business a success. The extra income will help him manage the high farming costs. Your loan contribution will help his family increase their income. "I will improve the living standards of my family by buying them enough food, clothes and better education for my children."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Regarn owns the following: 'cow, bicycle, motorcycle' but does not own 'a pig, poultry, pump, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'a mosquito net, running water' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, a sewing machine, a TV, a DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Cornelius

texts.en:
Cornelius is 26 years old, married and has been blessed with one child. He has been selling male clothes for four years and the business is doing well with a good income of 7,000 KES. 

He would like a loan of 10,000 KES which he will use to buy sports t-shirts to attract more male clients.

loans.use: to buy male sports t-shirts

loans.name: Febronie

texts.en: Febronie is 30 years old. She sells engine diesel and stone for construction. She has spent few months in this new business. With the loan, she would like to buy more engine oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a car. She moved to this new venture, as she realized many people demand engine oil.

loans.use: to buy more engine oil for sale.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: Vanna, 27, is a mother of two kids who are in school. Her family solely relies on rice farming on four hectare of farmland and her husband's occupation as policeman. This is the original loan for Vanna with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She formed a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees, fertilizer, and rice seed.
