She strongly believes that she can gain a good yield, better than before, so she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, fertilizer, and rice seed

loans.name: Houy's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Moung Russey district, Houy is 53 years old and married. She has four children. She is a rice farmer. Having been in this business for almost 20 years, she currently earns about 40,000KHR per day.
 
Houy has been with VisionFund for three cycles and the past loans have helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar power system.

loans.name: Bunchouy's Group

texts.en:
Bunchouy, 26, lives with his wife and three children in a rural village of the Bovel district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Bunchouy and his wife earn a living as farmers who have been farming rice and cassava for several years, earning about 37,000KHR per day to spend for their family’s needs.

Bunchouy has been with VisionFund for three cycles. He completely paid back the past loans with VisionFund and has used the loans to improve his family’s livelihood. As the leader, he is leading his group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. Bunchouy is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for his family’s business. He hopes to increase his crop yields so as to generate more income to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his family’s business

loans.name: Vert's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Vert is aged 40 years old, married, and has five children. The main source of the family’s income is from rice farming which she and her husband have been involved in for 20 years. 

Vert’s group consists of four members and she has been with VisionFund for eight cycles. She successfully used the past loans to better support her family. Now she can earn about 50,000 KHR per day. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Vert, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Erando

texts.en:
Erando is a 26-year-old hard-working man who wants to build a stable for the animals. He worked as a police officer for almost three years, then he had a car accident from which he was left with broken hips and bones. He got bone replacements, but he cannot work as a police officer anymore, thus, he shifted his focus to agriculture/livestock.

Erando has two cows and plants beans, potatoes, corn, fodder and wheat. He sells the raw milk to dairy farms and also the agricultural products to wholesale buyers. 

The village where Erando resides is known for the production of large quantities of plums and apples; sheep and cows are the animals that villagers prefer to keep the most. Traditional foods are the pies baked in a primitive way and pickles made of almost any vegetable.

loans.use: to build his animals' stable

loans.name: Mwinyi

texts.en:
Mwinyi is 37 years old. He is married and together they have been blessed with three children. They have three adult dependents. He would  like a loan of 30,000 KES and currently makes an estimated monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

Through this loan he will buy items like flour and cooking oil for use in the hotel to boost his business. 

From the anticipated profits, he will educate his children to higher levels. His future hope is to have a good future with his family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour and cooking oil to boost the hotel business

loans.name: Roxana Del Carmen

texts.es: Roxana de 23 años de edad está acompañada y desde hace 4 años viven en un terreno de su propiedad. Roxana y su compañero de vida trabajan en una hacienda y sus actividades son agrícolas. Además Roxana vende artículos de belleza por catálogo. Hace dos años levantaron las paredes de su vivienda pero debido a la falta de capital disponible no la finalizaron. Hoy Roxana ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para completar el dinero y comprar e instalar puerta metálica, ventanas y la cubierta y estructura de techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Roxana, age 23, is in a relationship.  They have lived on a piece of land that is their property for four years.  

Roxana and her life partner work at a ranch, and they do agricultural work.  Roxana also sells beauty products by catalog.  

Two years ago they raised the walls to their house.  However, due to the lack of available capital, they have not finished it.  Roxana has now requested a loan from FUSAI to supplement the money and install a metal door, windows, and the covering and structure of the roof of their house.

loans.use: to buy materials to continue building their house.

loans.name: Jose Guillermo

texts.es: José de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y su hija de 7 años de edad. José se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 27 años y su esposa se dedica al quehacer del hogar y cuidar de su hija quien está estudiando en un centro público de la localidad. Antes de que el invierno comience a caer José desea cambiar la lámina galvanizada del corredor de su vivienda ya que actualmente están deterioradas. Por lo que ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar nueva lámina galvanizada, clavos para lámina y cuartón para la estructura del techo. José solventará su deuda según el acuerdo firmado con la institución así dejar las puertas abiertas para futuros créditos.
texts.en: José is 40 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and his 7 year-old daughter. José has worked in construction for 27 years and his wife takes care of the house and their daughter, who attends a public school in town. Before the start of winter, José would like to change the galvanized sheet of the corridor in his home, as it is currently deteriorated. This is why he is requesting a loan through the FUSAI community association to buy a new galvanized sheet, nails and beams for the roof's structure. José will repay his loan according to the terms of the agreement with the institution in order to leave the door open to obtaining future loans.

loans.use: to buy a galvanized sheet, nails and beams to repair the roof in his home's corridor.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar, helps her husband operate their own farm for a living. Aside from this, she prepares suman and sells it in their village and she earns a good income from this to help contribute to her husband's income. She had many orders from her customers this season. Because of this,  she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy raw ingredients to prepare suman for sale. 

In the future, she wants to ensure a better source of income to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare suman for sale

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: Vanna, 38, is married and lives with her family in a village in the Kam Rieng district. She has two children and has earned a living for the last 15 years by farming rice and planting cassava. There are two people the loan group she leads, and Vanna is requesting her third loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farm and hire workers to help on her land. She hopes to increase her income from her current business so that she can provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Yeb's Group

texts.en:
Yeb, 61, is widowed with three dependent children. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof located in Battambang province’s Bovel district and the main sources of her family’s income is from farming rice on two-hectare of farmland. To supplement the income, she has been working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Yeb has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She completely paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to make a better living..

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Benbesigija Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENBESIGIJA  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  27 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FAKOLA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités d’achat et de ventes de produits alimentaires, de médicaments traditionnels, de fruits, des condiments et de la restauration,  à tout moment. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.
Mme  BINTOU  (1ère sur la photo de la gauche  à la droite) compte acheter avec son prêt 10 colis de médicaments traditionnels. Elle vend quotidiennement au marché, à la maison et est très sollicitée surtout le jour de foire.Elle s’approvisionne à FAKOLA et à GUEYA. Elle vend au comptant et parfois à credit à une clientele mixte.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the  Benbesigija group are married women averaging 27 years of age, with three children. They all live in polygamous families in Fakola, a prefecture in the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their businesses selling food products, traditional medicines, fruits,  condiments and cooked dishes. They are on their first loan with the institution, and anticipate paying it back without issues.

Mrs.  Bintou (the first one from left to right in the photo) plans to use her loan to buy  ten packs of traditional medicaments. She sells  every day at the marketplace as well out of her house and has a lot of demand, especially on market days. She stocks up in Faokola and Gueya. She sells for cash and sometimes on credit, to a mixed clientele. She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 20,000 West African francs. This revenue will allow her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy traditional medicines.

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mey is 50 years old, living in a rural area of Bakan, Pursat province. She is married and the loving mother of seven children, four of whom are her dependents. Mey works in agriculture and earns an income selling her crops. She has about two hectares of land where she grows rice and other seasonal crops alongside her husband. Mey has been in this occupation for more than 20 years, and earns well for her family.

The loan she is requesting now is to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family. Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program with a special rate, Mey is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding her family's health and protecting the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank

loans.name: David Reinaldo

texts.es: David de 37 años de edad está casado y tienen una niña de 6 meses de edad. David trabaja en una finca de la zona de Occidente del país y también sabe el oficio de albañilería, su esposa se dedica a la costura y tiene un pequeño taller en su vivienda. David y su esposa están decididos a salir adelante y esforzarse aun más por su pequeña hija. Por lo anterior David ha decidido mejorar su vivienda iniciando con trabajos de reparación en el techo cambiando las láminas galvanizadas que ya están muy deterioradas, también desea iniciar a construir las paredes con ladrillo de bloque. Actualmente las paredes de su vivienda, como se ve en la fotografía son de madera. Espera que con el crédito que le ha otorgado FUSAI comprar lámina galvanizada, ladrillo de bloque, hierro, cemento, arena y grava, alambre de amarre. Poco a poco (dice David) irá  mejorando las condiciones de su vivienda así darle mejor entorno y seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
David is 37 years old, married and has a daughter who is 6 months old. David works on a farm in the western region of the country and also knows the masonry trade. His wife is a seamstress and has a small workshop in their home. David and his wife are determined to get ahead and work hard for their young daughter. 

For this reason, David has decided to improve their housing by beginning the repair work on the roof and changing the galvanized sheet metal that is already deteriorated. He also wants to begin to build the walls with brick blocks. Currently the walls of his house, which is seen in the photo, are made of wood. 

With the loan granted to him by FUSAI, he hopes to buy galvanized sheet metal, brick blocks, rebar, cement, sand and gravel and tie wire. Little by little, says David, he will improve the conditions of his housing and give his family a better environment and greater security.

loans.use: To buy galvanized sheet metal, cement, brick blocks, sand, gravel, and rebar to repair the roof and begin to put up the walls of his house.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es: Blanca de 35 años de edad está acompañada y tiene un hijo de 14 años de edad. Blanca ha establecido un pequeño chalet en un centro escolar de su localidad, teniendo sus ingresos con los que apoya a su compañero para los gastos de su hogar. Blanca ha decidido construir un cuarto de habitación para su hijo menor de edad y a la vez distribuir mejor el área de la cocina. Por lo anterior ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar ladrillo de barro, hierro, cemento, arena y grava además de pagar la mano de obra para la construcción de la habitación para su hijo. Blanca menciona que pagará puntualmente sus cuotas para adquirir más adelante otro crédito y seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca is 35 years old, is in a relationship and has a son who is 14 years old. Blanca has established a small stall at a school in her locale, so she has income to help her companion with the household expenses. 

Blanca has decided to build a room for the bedroom of her minor son and to better distribute the kitchen area. For this reason, she has requested a loan from FUSAI to buy clay brick, rebar, cement, sand and gravel and also pay for the labor for the construction of the bedroom for her son. Blanca mentions that she will make her payments on time, so in the future, she can get another loan and continue improving her house.

loans.use: To buy clay bricks, rebar, cement, sand and gravel, as well as pay for the labor for the construction of a bedroom for her son.

loans.name: Narin's Group

texts.en:
Narin is 40 years old and married with two children. Her family lives in a village of the Bovel district of Battambang province and she and her husband earn a living through farming rice and planting cassava and corn. To add up more income, she also sells grocery items in her village. She has been engaged in this business for 13 years.

Narin is an existing client of VisionFund who has received one previous loan. The past loan has helped her family relieve financial burden to a great extent. She is going to use her portion of funding to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it for land plowing and labor costs. With this loan, she hopes to make more crops and sell them for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 29 years old. She married and has been blessed with two children. She also has two adult dependants.
She has a motorcycle transport business and also sells charcoal. She would like a loan of KES.20,000 to buy charcoal to sell. 

She currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES.16,200. Through her anticipated profits, she hopes to educate her children to higher levels. In the future, she hopes to own a rental house and a stable business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Poern's Group

texts.en:
Aged 59 years old, Poern is married and has six children. He lives in a rural village in the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To support his family, Poern has been farming rice for 30 years in the village. The current business earns him about 45,000KHR per day. 
Poern has been with VisionFund for three cycles and has completely paid back the past loans. He has successfully used the past loans from VisionFund to better support his family and business. He is now leading his group to ask for a loan. As the leader, he wants to use his portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farmland. He hopes to increase his crop yields and sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Chem's Group

texts.en:
Chem, 47, is married and lives with her husband and three children in a village in the Bovel district of Battambang province. She and her husband are rice farmers and they supplement their family’s income through growing cassava and working for others for a fee. She has been in this business for six years, earning about 80,000KHR per day to feed her family.
Chem’s group consists of four members who live in the same village. Chem has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Chem wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to better her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district, Oun is 56-year-old and widowed. The source of her family’s income is selling various fruits. She and her husband have been in business for several years. The current business earns her about 70,000KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 
This is the first loan for Oun with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Oun wants to use her portion to buy more fruits to resale. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to resale

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 58 years of age. He is a member of the self help group “Bethel”, founded in Kwanza village in Kitale, Kenya. Patrick is married and has eight children.

For six years now, Patrick has been running a small poultry business with his wife on her farm. In the beginning of the year, he decided to approach Juhudi Kilimo, KIVA's field partner, for a loan to expand the business.

Besides poultry, he grows maize and keeps a dairy cow. He very much enjoys milking his cow. He sells eggs at the local market. The family uses most of the money to settle family expenses. Part of the money is channeled towards the education of the children.

With your loan, Patrick is going to purchase more poultry. He will use the remaining amount to renovate the cowshed and the poultry house.

The loan will enable him to pay school and college fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Jereil

texts.en: Jereil has helped her husband in their transportation business for four years to support her child and the entire family's needs. The couple earns well from this and was able to sustain their daily needs and had successfully repaid the previous loan used for buying tires. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to cover the costs of license renewal and motor maintenance. She wants secure and better services for her customers.  Her plan in the future is to improve her business.

loans.use: to cover the costs of license renewal and motor maintenance

loans.name: Zadock

texts.en:
Zadock is a 35-year-old from Kakamega county, married to Lucy who is also a business lady in the same county. They have five children aged 15, 12, 10, 9 and 8 years respectively.

He operates a retail shop, a business he has done for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000. He is taking his first loan of KES 10,000 with VisionFund Kenya, which he intends to use to expand his business by adding retail goods like sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc. to sell and use part of it to educate his children.

The anticipated proceeds will be used to pay the loan and add more share to VisionFund Kenya.

His dream is to bring up a stable family.

loans.use: to buy more goods like sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Sevdiye

texts.en:
Sevdiye has two children. She used to sell sewing notions from her home and make her own products. She recently moved into housing the government built for low-income families, but it's not a suitable location for her business. Here she can sell ready-made clothes, scarves and underwear. With her loan from Maya, she'll buy merchandise at a good price. She'll use some for stylish clothes and nightgowns and some for scarves and underwear. Her children go to school, and she is working to provide a better future for them.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Sevdiye Hanım’ın 2 çocuğu var. Evinden tuhafiye malzemeleri satışı yapıyordu. Üretimini kendisi yapıyordu. Şimdi ise,devletin yoksullar için yaptırdığı evlere geçti. Orada bu iş için uygun değil. Burada ancak hazır giyim ve şal,çamaşır satışı yapabilecek .Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile uygun fiyatlı mal almaya çalışacak. Bir kısmıyla,abiye kıyafet,gecelik,bir kısmı ile de şal ve çamaşır alacak. Çocukları okula gidiyor.Daha iyi bir gelecek için çabalıyor.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at a good price

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa  is 48 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Her general store business has grown and become successful. She is now taking a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She is very positive, and she hopes to be able to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is 37 years old, married and blessed with four children. She also has two adult dependants. 

She has been running her salon for three years. She makes an estimated monthly income of KES 12,400, and would like to take out a loan of KES 10,000 to buy beauty products like hair shampoo and treatments to use on her clients. She will use her anticipated profits to educate her children to higher levels. 

In the future, she dreams of having a successful business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products like shampoo and treatments to use on clients

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house in the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham Province, Phal is 54 years old and married with five children. 

The main source of her family’s income is from growing cucumber, chilli pepper and eggplant in her village. Having been in this business for 34 years, Phal is able to earn about US$ 17 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is Phal's second loan with VisionFund. Now she is seeking a loan to pay for her son’s tuition fees at university. She hopes her son will get a good job after his graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s tuition fees at university

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is 36 years old and lives with her husband and one kid in a rural village of the Kampong Siem district.

Rice farming is the main source of her family’s income and she has been farming rice for about 18 years. The current business earns her family the daily income of about 50,000 KHR, and she is able to save 40,000 KHR each day.
 
This is Sokha's second loan with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland, and she hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Teody

texts.en:
Teody has been providing transportation services in his community for more than three years. He earns well from this alongside farming, which is his main source of income. His children are successful in their careers and he has to support himself. 

Recently he has taken out a new loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to cover motorcycle maintenance costs. 

In the future, he wants to sustain his transportation business and to save his profit for when he gets old.

loans.use: to cover motorcycle maintenance costs

loans.name: Syra

texts.en:
Syra is a 28-year-old woman. She lives in Coron, Palawan, Philippines, which is one of the areas damaged when typhoon Haiyan hit last November 2013. She is married to Nassir, a tricycle driver, and they have a child. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. They both work hard to provide for their everyday needs. 

Syra sells feeds for chickens and oil for vehicles. She also has an electronic loading station and a piggery for additional income. Her customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 every day. 

To help her to continue to run her business, she is requesting a PHP 32,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more chicken feed and oil for vehicles to sell.

Syra hopes that her business will be stable and dreams of having a better living.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for chicken feed and oil for vehicles to sell.

loans.name: Trabajando Unidos Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Trabajando Unidos” está conformada por 05 socias emprendedoras y responsables.  Este es el caso de Leonidas de 44 años casada con 04 hijos 02 de ellos en etapa escolar. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Se siente feliz pues cada día sigue  mejorando su negocio. El crédito que solicitó lo destinó para la compra de azucar, leche, arroz y aceite. El anhelo de Leonidas es de seguir aumentando el volumen de venta de sus productos. El grupo “Trabajando Unidos” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Ella se encuentra de pie, es la segunda del lado derecho y viste polo color morado con raya negra. En la parte superior a lado derecho se encuentra Andrea  la cual no pudo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
This is the "Trabajando Unidos" communal bank which is comprised of five members who are responsible entrepreneurs.  This is the case of Leonidas, 44, who is married and has four children, two of which are school aged.  She sell groceries for a living and is content that business is going better every day.

The loan she requested was to buy sugar, milk, rice and oil.  Her goal is to continue increasing sales of her products.

The "Trabajando Unidos" group is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support and the members are committed to continue working well.

Leonidas is standing, second from the right, in a purple top with a black stripe.  On the right is a photo of Andrea who was absent because of work.

loans.use: To buy sugar, milk, rice and oil.

loans.name: José Hilario

texts.es:
José de 25 años de edad, vive con sus padres desde pequeño, no estudio porque no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a un centro escolar cercano, tiene otros tres hermanos quienes también viven junto con sus padres en la comunidad.  Trabaja cada día para apoyar a sus padres en trabajos en la agricultura (siembra de granos básicos)
José trabaja de ayudante de albañil en la zona y en diferentes trabajos de donde obtiene sus ingresos económicos, trabajo anteriormente en un proyecto de la construcción de una calle durante mas de una año, de cada pago que recibía cada quince días iba comprando materiales para la construcción de su propio hogar, y fue así como ahora en día tiene su propia vivienda pequeño pero ya propio.
Los trabajos los aprendió gracias a sus padres quienes le motivaron para  tener así sus propios activos, además puede hacer pan de diferentes variedades.
José solicita un crédito en credicampo, para la compra de materiales como lamina, cemento, arena, cerámica, pergamino, 25 pernos, pintura, etc, ya que pretende ponerle piso a su vivienda y terminar de colocar lamina a una parte del techo a la cual le hace falta. Tambien para cancelar la mano de obra.
Con el crédito podrá contar con mejores condiciones de vida, ya que en el invierno se inundaba de agua su casa y el piso se mojaba todo, ahora podrá tener mejores condiciones en el hogar.
José es un joven luchador que su sueño es ir haciendo cada vez su casa como él la ha querido, esto le permitirá vivir mas cómodo.
texts.en:
Jose, 25, has lived with his parents since he was a little boy.  He was unable to get an education because there was no school nearby.  He has three siblings who also live at home in the community.  He works every day helping his parents in their agriculture activity (growing basic grains).

Jose works as a bricklayer assistant in the area and carries out different jobs to earn an income.  For a year he worked on a previous construction project building a street.  With the salary he received every two weeks he would buy construction materials for to build his own home, and little by little he has his own small house.

He learned his trade because his father was the one who encouraged him to have his own property.  Jose also makes different kinds of bread.

He is requesting a loan through Credicampo to buy materials such as metal sheeting, cement, sand, tile, wallpaper, nuts and bolts, paint, etc. as he wants to put down a floor in the house and finish the roof with metal sheeting.  He will also hire workers.

Through the loan he will be able to enjoy better living conditions because the house was inundated with water during the winter, so now is the time to make repairs.

Jose is a young man who is determined to reach his goal of finishing his house the way he wants so he can live more comfortably.

loans.use: To finish his house and to hire workers.

loans.name: Lilian Del Socorro

texts.es: Lilian es un reconocida peluquera de la región, ya que lleva desempeñando el oficio hace ya varios años los cuales le sirvieron no solo para llenarse de experiencia, si no para para adquirir clientela, pero dicha clientela le ha sugerido muy respetuosamente que realizara mejoras al local, para hacerlo más atractivo ya que en la región están llegando cada vez más peluquerías y barberías con un excelente aspecto y esto atrae clientes, por ende la señora Lilian solicita un crédito para realizar reformas locativas y hacer de su salón de belleza un sitio agradable no solo en la atención si no en la espera pro el servicio, con estas mejoras espera adquirir más cliente ya que estará a la vanguardia en diseño sin perder la calidad del servicio, con esta inversión quiere atraer clientes para acumular un capital con el cual pueda montar otra sucursal y llevar su buen servicio a otros barrios dándole una excelente calidad de vida a su familia
texts.en:
Lillian is a renowned hair stylist in the area.  She has been in the business for several years which has given her not only experience but many customers.  They have respectfully suggested that she renovate her salon to make it more attractive because more and more beauty salons and barber shops are opening and their excellent image attracts customers.

Therefore, Lillian is requesting a loan to renovate her salon to make it nicer not only as far as customer service is concerned but also to make the waiting area more attractive.  Her aim is to attract more customers with a vanguard design without giving up quality serivce.  She wants to earn enough capital to open another salon in other neighborhoods so she can give her family a quality lifestyle.

loans.use: To renovate her salon for a more vanguard design and structure compared to other stylists opening business in the area.

loans.name: Abigail Del Carmen

texts.es:
Abigail de 42 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casada y su esposo trabaja de seguridad, tiene 3 hijos y solamente una vive con ellos que estudia en la universidad; además vive en su casa dos sobrinas que están a su cargo, toda la vida Abigail se ha dedicado a los oficios domésticos.

Necesita el dinero para la reparación del vehículo, específicamente reparara la dirección  será de gran ayuda, ya que su esposo va a traer a su hija a la Universidad, ya que sale a las 7 de la noche y no hay bus a esa hora y por el peligro también. Su sueño más grande es ver a su hija graduándose de la universidad.
texts.en:
Abigail is 42 years old and did not have the opportunity to have an education. She is married and her husband works in security. They have 3 children and of these just one daughter, who is studying at university, lives with them. She also looks after two nieces who live in the house with her. Abigail has spent all her life doing domestic work.

She needs the money to repair the vehicle, specifically to repair the steering. This will be a great help, since her husband takes her daughter to university because she leaves at 7 o'clock at night. There is no bus at that time and it is also dangerous.

Her main dream is to see her daughter graduate from university.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle, particularly the steering.

loans.name: Marte

texts.en:
This is Marte, feeding a calf inside the stable. She is 50 years old, and is married with two children aged in their early twenties. 

Marte is seeking your financial help to expand her livestock by adding one more dairy cow to the existing herd of two. In addition to selling raw milk to locals, she also plants and sells seasonal veggies and has grapevines. Marte’s husband works with private companies in road construction.

Prior to their arrival in their current location about fifteen years ago, they lived in a very rural area where plantations of any type of veggies were almost impossible due to the weather, climate and terrain. Their village was covered in snow most of the year, and the roads were not paved, thus they lived in complete seclusion, according to Marte.

loans.use: to expand their livestock activities by adding one more dairy cow.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a 22-year-old lady from Katito region, which is located within the western part of Kenya. She is married to Geofrey who is a businessman, and they have one child who is five years old.

Dorothy sells molasses to her clients, as it helps in boosting milk production in cows. She has been in this business for the last five years. 

She has applied for her first loan with VISION FUND KENYA, which she will use to increase her working capital. She will use the anticipated income to put back into the business. Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Elizabeth De Jesús

texts.es:
Elizabeth, es comerciante, estudio hasta sexto grado, actualmente está soltera no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres, 1 hermana y un sobrino, desde hace 6 años tiene un cafetín en la escuela de su comunidad y aprendió ya que su madre tiene una tienda en casa, el horario del trabajo es de 7 de la mañana a 12 del mediodía,  le queda a unos cinco metros de su casa.
 Solicita el crédito para pagar la operación de su madre ya que la vista la tienen mala y otra parte para surtir su pequeño negocio.  Los sueños es que su madre recupere la vista y en un futuro remodelar el cafetín ponerle paredes ya que son de laminas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a merchant and has a sixth grade education.  She is single, with no children, and lives with her parents, a sister and a nephew.  For six years she has been running a food stall at a community school.  She learned the business from her mother who has a store at home.  Her work schedule is from 7:00 a.m. to 12:00 noon and the stall is located about five meters from her house.

She is requesting a loan to pay for her mother's eye operation and to stock her small business.  Her dream is for her mother to regain her eyesight; and in the future Elizabeth wants to build walls around her food stall because now what she has up is metal sheeting.

loans.use: To pay for her mother's eye operation and to stock her small business.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en: Maricris is a very dedicated daughter who wants to become successful in the future. She is studying at university in order to fulfill her dreams, and is taking a BSBA - Financial Management. She needs financial assistance to pay tuition fees. With her GDMPC education loan, she will be able to continue her studies and hopefully in the future, she would find a better job according to her desires.

loans.use: to pay for school tuition fees.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, a mother of four children, helps her husband operate their own farm to make a living. For ten years, the couple has earned well to provide for the family. 

She has planned to improve their farm in order to send her children to school. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer to have higher returns. In the future, Mary Ann wants to provide a good education to her children and improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm land.

loans.name: Zeynep

texts.en:
Zeynep has two children. 

When her husband lost his job after an earthquake, she began working out of necessity. She sold hosiery, blouses, underwear, pajamas etc. She would drive around in her husband's car selling. Her husband then began working for a phyllo dough maker, and Zeynep stopped working for a while after having two children. However, her husband's wages weren't enough to survive on, so she decided to work again like before. With the loan from Maya, she will buy materials and products. She will buy the best and most sellable items she can find at wholesale and resell them.

loans.use: to buy materials and products to re-sell.

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en:
Lolito is married with one child. He operates a service based business providing transportation in his community to make a living.  

He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to cover the cost of motorcycle maintenance. He plans to improve his business by having another motorcycle for rental and transportation services. In the future, Lolito wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to cover the cost of motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en:
Ret is 44 years old and has five children. She lives in a rural village in the Koh Sotin district. Ret and her husband grow sesame and tobacco, and sometimes they work for others for a fee. She has been in this business for 26 years. The current business earns her about 38,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
  
Ret has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now, she is leading her group of four to ask for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en:
Nat, aged 52, is married with three children, and lives in a rural village in the Tbaung district of Kampong Cham province. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava for 32 years. Together, they can earn about KHR 28,000 per day and can save about KHR15,000 each day for their future needs.
 
Nat has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her family lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Chhey's Group

texts.en:
Chhey is 51 years old, and is married with six dependent children. She lives in a rural village in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung district. She earns a living through farming rice and planting cassava. Together, Chhey and her husband can earn about KHR26,000 per day from their current business.

This is the fourth microloan for Chhey with VisionFund. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow more cassava as well as rice, and sell it for a good price so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Edith Del Carmen

texts.es:
Edith de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, actualmente está separada, tiene dos hijos que vive con ella y estudian séptimo y tercer grado, vive con sus padres y su hermano se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Edith se ha dedicado en toda su vida a los oficios domésticos su ex pareja le ayuda en la manutención de sus hijos y sus padres le dan ayuda, ella se encarga del cuido de sus hijos. 

El préstamo lo necesita para mejorar la vivienda y específicamente levantar el techo no sentirá demasiada calor, espera algún día tener un empleo y generar ingresos para mantener a sus hijos y ser independientes y que sus hijos sigan estudiando y que puedan prepararse para el futuro.
texts.en:
Edith, 30, has a seventh grade education.  She is currently divorced and has two children at home who are in seventh and third grade.  She lives with her parents and brother and takes care of the domestic duties.

Edith has always taken care of domestic tasks.  Her ex-husband helps support her children and her parents help her as well.  She is the one who cares for the children.

The loan she needs is to renovate her house, especially to on a roof to protect it from the heat.  Someday she hopes to be employed and generate an income to support her children and be independent.  She wants her children to continue their education so they can prepare for the future.

loans.use: To renovate her house, especially the roof, to protect it from the heat.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven is 38 years old and is from Kisumu county. He is married to Lynette, who is a saloonist. They have three children aged 9, 7 and 5 years old. 

Steven is a painter, a business that he has operated for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES. 25,000. He is taking his first loan of KES. 15,000 with Vision Fund Kenya, which he intends to use to expand his business by buying equipment to use in his service, like brushes, paint thinner, etc. 

The anticipated proceeds will be used to repay the loan. His dream is to bring up a stable family.

loans.use: to buy equipment to use in his service, like brushes, paint thinner, etc.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 28 years old. She is married to Mohamed, and they are blessed with three school-going children. 

Jackline runs a motorcycle transport business in Kapsabet town, and is served by the VisionFund Kenya Kapsabet Branch. Jackline has been in this business for the last eight years, receiving an average monthly profit of KES. 15,400. 

She has borrowed a loan of KES 120,000, which she will use to buy another motorcycle for her business. With the anticipated profits, she will pay her children's school fees and repay her loan, as well as expand her business.

Her dream is to give her children the best education, as well as expand her business to a point that she will be able to meet all her financial obligations, and also start a taxi service business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Lida's Group

texts.en:
Lida is 22 years old, married, and lives in a rural village of Tbaung Khmum province’s Kampong Cham district. To earn a living, she has been farming rice and growing cassava for several years. The current business earn her about KHR 27,000 per day, but she can manage to save about KHR 14,000 after daily expenses. 

Lida is in her third loan cycle with VisionFund. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Lida wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland, and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sren's Group

texts.en:
Sren is 36 years old, and is married with two children. She lives in a village in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. 

To make a living, Sren has been growing rubber and selling grocery items. Sren is able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Sren is leading her group to ask for a loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Sren will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy more grocery items. She hopes to grow her rubber healthily, so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 36-year-old mother from Kisumu region which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Barack who is a businessman; he supports the family by providing income. She supports 3 people in their family and has 2 children who are 6 and 4 years old respectively.

Pamela has a kiosk where she sells cereals. She has been doing this for the last 5 years and makes a monthly income of KES 8,000. She is taking her third loan with VisionFund Kenya and she will use it to purchase more cereals. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

Pamela's dream is to expand her business and support the family.

loans.use: to purchase more cereals for resale.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en:
Artemio is operating a service-based business providing transportation services in his community to earn a living. He has been doing this for more than two years, and he earns enough to provide for his family. 

He is requesting a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase new set of tires so he can give a better service. In the future, Artemio hopes to support his children to finish their studies and to get twice the amount of income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase new set of tires.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 38-year-old lady from Katito town, which is located in Nyanza province, in the western part of Kenya. She is married and supports seven people in her family, although she has no children. 

She has been operating a retail shop for the last four years, and generates a monthly income of KES. 18,000. She has now applied for her fourth loan with VISION FUND KENYA LTD, which she will use to purchase maize flour and other shop items in bulk. 

Florence will use the anticipated profits to grow her business. Her dream is to have a big business and support the family.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour and other grocery items in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Johnny Fe

texts.en:
Johnny Fe's husband operates a fishing business to make a living. She sells the fish he catches in their village. She has been in this field of business for ten years and they earn well enough to provide for their family. 

Recently, she took a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy a new fishing net to use for fishing. In the future, the couple wants to own a stall in the market in town where they could sell fish. She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net.

loans.name: Donathile

texts.en:
Donathile is 28 years old. She has been selling shoes and lotions for the past four years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes to sell. She plans to use the profits for reinvesting in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Naisrun's Group

texts.en:
A resident from Kampong Cham province, Naisrun is a mother of four dependent children; two children under school-age and two schoolchildren. She struggles for a living via rice cropping and cassava farming which are her main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. Naisrun has been involved with her current business for ages and it provides her with a decent income. 

This is the second microloan for Naisrun and her joint-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan with success and it has enabled her to support her living standards as well as to buy household appliances for her family. 

Now, she is joining a group of two to get a new loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to get a yield twice that of her previous one.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Kunthea, 47, is married with two children residing in a rural village located in the Kandal province province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. For the last 10 years, she has been farming rice and working as a garment worker. 

Kunthea is just with VisionFund for this cycle and she is applying for a loan to buy a plot of farmland. She hopes to extend her agribusiness so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Phally is 30 years old and is widowed. She lives with three children in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has been selling grocery items for 5 years. The current business earns her about 41,000 KHR per day. 

Phally is in her first loan cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Phally wants to use her portion to buy more fruits to resell. She hopes to earn more income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to resell.

loans.name: Cheang's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Cheang is 59 years old and married with six children. She earns a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 41 years, Cheang can earn about 10,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

This is the second loan for Cheang with VisionFund. Now leading her group of four to apply for a loan, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crops so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Felipe Amador

texts.es:
Felipe de 45 años de edad,  padre soltero con un hijo menor de edad, el cual está estudiando. Es originario del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar veterinaria. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarle a su hijo un futuro mejor, y lograr  su más anhelado sueño como es formar a su hijo en un profesional.

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la crianza y venta de cerdos en pie. Actividad que la desempeña en su casa de habitación y por encargo. El dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo  y surtir su negocio en la compra de lote de cerdos para la crianza, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Felipe agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Felipe is 45 years old. He is a single father, with a young son who is in school. He is from Sauce, in the northern part of the León region. He is hardworking, responsible, and keen to improve himself. Unfortunately, he was unable to go to university due to a lack of financial resources, but he would have liked to study veterinary medicine. Currently, he strives from day to day to give his son a better future, and to achieve his most longed-for dream of giving his son a professional education.

Thanks to his efforts and his desire to do well, Felipe is able to earn his living rearing and selling pigs. He carries out this work at his home, and rears pigs to order. He works on his business for eight hours a day, including promoting his product to customers. His aim in seeking a loan is to invest it in his business. He will buy stock up buy buying a batch of pigs to rear, so that in the near future he will be able to earn a better income. Felipe is grateful for the help that Kiva investors give to people with few resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, to help them have decent means of earning a living.

loans.use: to invest in pigs to rear and sell.

loans.name: Tabara

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Tabara est une jeune fille âgée de 21 ans qui s’active dans le commerce de cosmétiques, de mèches et greffages. Tabara a déjà eu à bénéficier de 2 crédits au niveau de l’IMCEC et vient cette fois ci afin de bénéficier d’un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter des produits cosmétiques, des greffages, des mèches pour revendre. Elle n’a pas encore de local pour son activité mais, elle est bien connue dans le milieu et possède une clientèle assez fidèle dont certains font la commande avant qu’elle ne parte chercher la marchandise.
Tabara est célibataire et vit avec ses parents ; avec le bénéfice qu’elle gagne, elle donne sa participation dans la gestion de la maison. Elle peut aussi s’occuper de ses petits besoins personnels.
Elle aimerait ouvrir un grand magasin où elle vendra aussi des tissus à la mode et développera son commerce de cosmétiques.
texts.en:
Tabara is a 21-year old girl who trades in cosmetics, hair extensions and hairweaves. She has already benefited from two loans from IMCEC and has now come to get a loan which will enable her to buy cosmetics, hairweaves and hair extensions to resell. She does not yet have premises for her business but she is well known in the area and has a relatively loyal customer base, some of whom order products before she goes off to buy them. 

Tabara is single and lives with her parents; with the profit she makes she will participate to the household expenses. She is also able to provide for her own personal needs. She would like to open a big store where she would also sell fashionable fabrics and develop her cosmetic business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, hair extensions and hairweaves for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar power system.

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Monsieur BAKARY né vers 1961 à SOUKOURANI cercle de SIKASSO, polygame et père de 8 enfants il réside avec ses épouses et leurs enfants dans une famille traditionnelle à HAMDALLAYE  un quartier populaire dans la ville de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès monsieur BAKARY s’est initié aux activités d’achat et de vente des intrants (engrais et herbicides)., il s’approvisionne  auprès du représentant de TOGOUNA ( usine de fabrication des engrais et autres) à SIKASSO.
 Il est à son sixième prêt  individuel avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 8 cartons d’herbicide de marque différentes et 25 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais. Sa vente se fait dans sa boutique au quartier HAMDALLAYE à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes  au comptant et à crédit. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 85 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Bakary was born around 1961 in Soukourani in the Sikasso circle. He is polygamous and father to eight children, and he lives with his wives and their children in a traditional family in Hamdallaye, a working-class district of the town of Sikasso, the Republic of Mali's third administrative region.

After a large number of unsuccessful activities, Bakaru started up a business buying and selling agricultural inputs (fertilizers and weedkillers). He gets his supplies from the Togouna (a manufacturer of fertilizers etc.) representative in Sikasso. 

He is on his sixth individual loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of being able to better satisfy the requirements of his ever-growing customer base. This loan will enable him to buy eight cartons of various brands of weedkiller and 25 50-kilo sacks of fertilizer. He sells his products in his shop in the Hamdallaye district to a mixed customer base made up of men and women, for cash and on credit.

He expects to make an average monthly profit of 85,000FCFA and this will enable him to repay the loan and the interest on it and to reinvest the remainder in his business.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar power system.

loans.name: Lucila Santos

texts.es:
Lucila de 50 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar pero aprendió a escribir y leer esta acompañada y su pareja es agricultor, tiene tres hijos los cuales ya se acompañaron y solamente vive en casa con su pareja, la señora tiene un molino desde hace 20 años. Además, tiene un negocio de pupusas ambos oficios los realiza en casa el molino lo abre a las 7 de la mañana y lo cierra al medioda, el negocio de pupusas de 5 a 8 de la noche. 

El préstamo lo necesita paar surtir el negocio de pupusas ya que comprara mesas y sillas para la comodidad de sus clientes y para el molino comparar otra tolva, espera que su negocio vaya creciendo en un futuro poder comprar otro molino porque el que tiene esta deteriorado.
texts.en:
Lucila is 50 years old, and never had the chance to study. She did, however, learn to read and write. She has a partner who is a farmer, and three children, who are already grown-up, so she loves alone with her partner. 

Lucila has had a mill for 20 years. She also has a business selling pupusas, or traditional corn tortillas from El Salvador. She does both of these activities from home. She starts up her mill at 7 in the morning and stops at midday. She then works in her pupusa business between 5 and 8 in the evening. 

She will use the loan to stock her pupusa business, buying  tables and chairs to make her customers comfortable and for her mill, she will buy another hopper. She hopes that her business grows and that in the future, she can buy another mill, because the one she has at the moment is damaged.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to make her customers comfortable and to buy another hopper for her mill.

loans.name: Aissata

texts.fr:
Madame AISSATA née en 1982 à KLELA et  mère de 3 enfants, elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille traditionnelle à MANCOURANI I un quartier populaire dans la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Madame AISSATA est enseignante de sa profession en plus, elle mène des activités d’achat et de vente des tissus et des pagnes wax réal il ya 10 ans, elle s’approvisionne à BURKINA FASO.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle sollicite auprès de l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso un premier prêt individuel. 
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 10 pièces de pagne wax réal et une quantité importante de tissus pour la revendre au détail sur place à ses collègues d’enseignant(es) au comptant et à crédit.  
EIle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 F CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Aissata, who was born in 1982 in Klela, is mother to three children and she lives with her husband and their children in a traditional family in Mancourani I, a working-class district of the town of Sikasso, the Republic of Mali's third administrative region.

Aissata is a teacher by profession but she has also been buying and selling fabrics and "pagnes real wax" (highly decorative and brightly-colored pieces of fabric worn by African women) for the past ten years. She gets her supplies in Burkina Faso. 

She has requested a first loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, so that she can satisfy the requirements of her ever-growing customer base. This loan will enable her to buy 10 pieces of "pagne real wax" and a sufficient quantity of fabrics to resell on a retail basis locally to her teaching colleagues, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 35,000FCFA and this will enable her to repay the loan and the interest on it and to save the rest.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and "pagnes real wax"

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, salt and other shop items.

loans.name: Sokban's Group

texts.en:
Sokban is 51 years old and a married mother of six children. The main income of the family comes from Sokban's rice farming and working as a garment worker. Having been involved in rice farming for 26 years, Sokban is able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day and save about 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. 

Sokban has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four cycles and has completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her to support her family with enough food and basic necessities. Now she is leading her group to request a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow her crops well to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Fidel Alberto

texts.es:
Fidel de 45 años de edad,  estudio hasta noveno grado esta acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen una hija que vive con ellos que aun no ingresa a la escuela. Desde muy pequeño su padre le enseño a sembrar maíz y maicillo, actualmente siembra 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y otros 14,000 de maicillo a unas 20 metros de su casa y se va caminando, además tiene ganado propio el cual le saca provecho. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar equipo agrícola para la siembra de maíz, específicamente abono y fertilizantes, espera sacar buena producción vender y tener ganancias para mantener a su familia y pagar el crédito antes del plazo otorgado.
texts.en:
Fidel is 45 years old and studied up to ninth grade. He lives with his partner, who takes responsibility for running their home. They have one young daughter, who lives with them and does not yet go to school. From when he was very small, Fidel's father taught him how to cultivate maize and sorghum. He currently grows 14,000 square metres of maize and another 14,000 of sorghum, in fields just 20 metres from his house. He also has his own cattle, which provide a further income

He is seeking a loan in order to buy agricultural inputs for his maize crop, specifically manure and fertilisers. He hopes to make a good harvest, sell well, and make a good profit to provide for his family and repay the loan before the deadline given.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilisers for his maize crop, and so produce a good harvest.

loans.name: Luís Alonso

texts.es:
Luis de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado de educación. Es soltero no tiene hijos aun en casa del cliente viven 4 personas sus dos padres y una sobrina que estudia tercer grado. 

Luis se dedica a la albañilería se  ha dedicado por 23 años a esta actividad, es una labor que la aprendió de su padre quien es un excelente albañil y fue una forma de empleo que le ha gustado mucho además de esa actividad también es agricultor siembra maíz, frijol y maicillo.
El trabajo del cliente es frecuente ya que es una persona muy conocida por su trabajo, su horario es de aproximadamente 7 horas al día.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar bloque, cemento, y lamina pues desea reparar parte de la vivienda que está dañada  y está en peligro que se caiga.  El préstamo le ayudara a  tener un  lugar más seguro para vivir él y su familia.

Sus  sueños son construir su  casa para tener una familia donde pueda criar  a sus hijos y trabajar muy fuerte para ser reconocido por su trabajo y así darle a su familia una vida digna, espera seguir trabajando para conseguir sus  objetivos.
texts.en:
Luis is 41 years old. He went to school up to the second grade. He is single and has no children yet. Four people live in his house, his two parents and a niece in third grade.   

Luis works as a bricklayer. He has done this for 23 years. This is work that he learned from his father, who is an excellent bricklayer. He has always liked this work. He is also a farmer and he grows corn, beans and sorghum. He has a lot of work because he is well known for his work. He works approximately 7 hours a day. 

The loan he is asking for is to buy blocks, cement, and sheeting to repair a part of his house that is damaged and in danger of falling down. The loan will help him have a more secure place for him and his family. 

His dream is to build a house to have a family and raise children and work very hard to become well known for his work and give them a dignified life. He hopes to keep working to attain his goals.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, and sheeting to repair his home because is is damaged and in danger of falling down.

loans.name: Yamileth Zuleyma

texts.es:
Yamileth de 25 años de edad, esta acompañada su compañero de vida trabaja en el ingenio, tienen un hijo de cinco años, conviven con los padres de ella a aparte de trabajar en la escuela como cocinera en su tiempo libre se dedica a l negocio de ropa que mientras le ayudaba a una amiga lo aprendió y le dio la oportunidad de comprar para ella y se independizara.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar materiales de construcción, para construir su propia habitación y tener más privacidad, sueña con que su hijo se gradué pero que también aprenda el negocio,  que dice que para tener éxito no es necesario una profesión.
texts.en:
Yamileth is 25 years old, she is in a relationship and her partner works in a sugar refinery. She has a 5 year old child and they live with her parents. 

Besides working in a school as a cook, in her free time she has a clothing business. She learned this while working for a friend and it gave her the opportunity to buy for herself and become independent. 

She will use the loan to buy construction materials to build her own room and have more privacy. She dreams that her child graduates, but that they also learn business, as she says that to succeed a profession is not necessary.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build her own room and have more privacy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, foliar sprays, and more to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 56 years old. She is widowed and was blessed with 5 children. She has one adult dependent. She runs her general store and has also been a farmer for 10 years now. She currently makes a monthly income of KES 90,000. She would like a loan of KES 50,000. 

She will use this loan to add stock to her general store like sugar, salt and soap. In her secondary business, she will also buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in order to improve her farming.

From her anticipated profits, she will pay for her loan and as well save. She dreams of educating her children to higher levels and having a stable life.

loans.use: to buy stock for her general store like sugar, salt and soap.

loans.name: Ana Marina

texts.es:
Ana de 23 años de edad, estudio noveno grado. Está casada. Su pareja se dedica a la agricultura tienen en común 1 hijo el cual  no estudia  pues aun esta pequeño. 

Ana actualmente se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  tanto en su casa como en una casa de una vecina quien le paga por sus servicios,  se dedica a esta labor  ya que no ha encontrado otro trabajo que pueda  ayudar a su familia, el horario de trabajo es de 6 horas al día. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando es comprar azúcar, frijoles, arroz, aceite, jabón, maíz, lejía entre otros,  pues desea instalar una tienda en su casa,  ya que su familia se había dedicado a esta actividad  durante mucho tiempo pero que por falta de dinero dejo de funcionar la tienda y ella desea volver a poner la tienda. El préstamo le ayudara a tener un negocio propio y un lugar que le genere ingresos para ayudar a su familia.

Los sueños de ella, son tener su propio negocio y para su familia que su hija crezca y estudie  espera para su familia que logren sus sueños y cumplan sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Ana is 23 years old. She went to to school up to the ninth grade. She is married. Her spouse works in agriculture and they have 1 child together, who doesn't go to school because he is still small.  

Right now, Ana takes care of the home- both her home and her neighbor's, who pays her for her services. She does this work because she hasn't found another job that can help her family. Her work schedule is 6 hours a day.  

The loan she is asking for is to buy sugar, beans, rice, oil, soap, corn, lye and more. She wants to set up a store in her house, because her family has done this activity for a long time, but due to a lack of money her store stopped working. Now she wants to open the store again. The loan will help her have her own business and a place that will generate income to help her family.  

Her dream is to have her own business and for her family, she wants her daughter to grow and study. She hopes that her family will achieve their dreams and meet their goals.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, rice, oil, soap, corn, and lye, among others. She wants to set up a store in her house.

loans.name: Ol's Group

texts.en:
Ol is a 33-year-old rice farmer who lives with her husband and five children in a rural area of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province. Besides rice farming on a two-hectare area of farmland, Ol’s husband also complements their income by raising cows. Ol and her husband are able to earn almost 35,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. 

Ol has just joined VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to request a loan. Ol, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice fruitfully and in a timely manner so she can earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
Sokhorn, 31, is a farmer in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district of Cambodia. She has three children. She has been farming rice for several years. The current business earns her approximately KHR 20,000 per day and allows her to save about KHR 8,000 each day after offsetting daily expenses.

This is the second loan cycle for Sokhorn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and pesticides for her farmland. Sokhorn hopes to get a high yield from her plantation business so as to keep up the good progress in improving her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Delfin

texts.en:
Deflin is a 24-year-old single woman. She has been an employee since she graduated from a Vocational High School. She helps her mother to pay her young brother and sister's education fees. 

She wants to buy a laptop for her young sister who is attending a vocational school and really needs it. Unfortunately she does not have much cash to do so. Therefore she requested an individual loan amounting to IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. This loan will help her to buy a laptop for her young sister.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for her young sister.

loans.name: Philos

texts.en:
Philos is a 52-year-old lady from Kakamega county. She is a widow and has three grown-up children aged 23, 21 and 19 years.

She operates a salon, a business she has done for the last 12 years, and earns an average income of KES 30,000 per month. She is taking her second loan of KES 15,000 with Vision fund Kenya which she will use to buy salon equipment and chemicals. 

The profits will be used to repay the loan and do some savings.Her dream is to prosper.

loans.use: To upgrade her salon.

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie is 41 years old. She owns a bar and has been in the business for the past eight years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beers and soft drinks to sell. She plans to use the profits to reinvest in the business.

In the picture, Pelagie is holding basins and cups as she was bringing them home from the shops where she got them for her home use. In the photo, other people from her group are looking on.

loans.use: To buy more beer and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Martha Yalibeth

texts.es:
La hermana de Martha Yalibeth fue la que inició el proyecto de abrir una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Sin embargo, ella emigró hacia Estados Unidos, en búsqueda de mejores condiciones de vida  heredándole  a  Martha el negocio.  Al principio, la pulpería  ofrecía pocos productos, hoy en día cuenta con una gran variedad, haciendo frente a las demandas de los clientes. 
La pulpería está situada en una ubicación estratégica, lo que ha generado buenas ganancias. Martha desea mantener el negocio a flote. Por lo tanto, desea invertir en  la compra de  los productos que cuentan con  mayor demanda, como maíz, frijoles, pollo, sardinas y gaseosas. Su sueño es construir su propia vivienda, porque en la que habita actualmente es la de su hermana que reside fuera del país.
texts.en:
It was Martha Yalibeth's sister who started the small grocery story. She emigrated to the US in search of better living conditions, however, and passed the business on to Martha. In the beginning the grocery store had only a few products but it now has a large variety and meets the demands of customers.

The grocery store is in a strategic location, and so has generated good profits. Martha wants to keep the business afloat and so wants to invest in the most popular products, such as corn, beans, chicken, sardines and fizzy drinks. Martha's dream is to build her own home as she is currently living in her sister's (who lives in the US) home.

loans.use: to buy the most sought-after products, such as corn, beans, chicken, sardines and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Daniel Salvador

texts.es: Daniel es un humilde vendedor de comidas rápidas, puntualmente pizzería las cuales aprendió a elaborar cuando era ayudante  y hoy en día las elabora y vende en su hogar este proyecto como microempresario nació ante la necesidad de generar más recursos pues con lo que ganaba como ayudante no le iba de la mejor manera y en ocasiones su familia pasaba necesidades, con unos ahorros que logro juntar pudo comprar un horno con el cual produce un número muy pequeño de pizzas  pero con su venta puede cubrir los gastos elementales en su hogar que era su mayor apuro y preocupación. Con el pasar del tiempo y ya con las cuentas claras le dio oportunidad a Daniel de cómo podría expandir su negocio, este pequeño negocio según él, le  da la oportunidad de soñar de aspirar a grandes cosas como lo es la construcción de un local grande donde pueda comercializar sus pizzas por toda la ciudad pero sabe que un sueño se cumple paso a paso y por ende solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima para la fabricación de pizzas como pepperoni, masa, salchichas, piñas entre otras con la ilusión de que sus ingresos aumenten y comenzar un ahorrar para distribuir sus pizzas en un local comercial buscando siempre le beneficio de sus dos amados hijos por quienes da su propia vida
texts.en:
Daniel is a humble fast-food seller. He makes pizza, something he learned when working as a kitchen helper. Now Daniel prepares pizzas and sells them from his home. The idea to start a small business came from Daniel's need to earn a higher income. His wage working as a helper was not enough and his family needed certain things. With his savings, Daniel was able to buy an oven that allowed him to prepare a very small number of pizzas but, with their sales, he is able to cover basic household costs. This was his most urgent goal and worry.

As time passed, Daniel's financial situation improved and he has the opportunity to expand his business. Daniel tells us that his little business gives him the opportunity to aspire and dream of bigger things. For example he wants to build big premises where he can sells his pizzas to all the city. Daniel knows, however, that this dream is something that must be achieved little by little and so he is applying for a loan in order to buy basic supplies - such as dough, pepperoni, sausages, pineapple and more - for making pizzas. Daniel hopes that this loan will result in an increase in his income, and that he will be able to save a little in order to sell his pizzas from business premises. Daniel is always looking to improve the lives of his two much loved children, for whom he would give his life.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies - such as dough, pepperoni, sausages, pineapple and more - for making pizzas.

loans.name: Héctor Manuel

texts.es:
Héctor de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta  octavo grado de nivel académico, es soltero vive con el papá y la mamá por lo tanto solo depende ellos de él.

Héctor es agricultor desde hace 30 años a este trabajo le enseño el papá, ya que quería que su hijo aprendiera un oficio y fue así que siempre lo andaba cuando trabajaba, su horario de trabajo es de las 6 am a las 11 p.m

El préstamo solicitado lo ocupara para comprar los insumos agrícolas, como herbicidas para la hierba que no le es buena para el cultivo y también comprar el abono que ahorita manifiesta que está barato y ellos quieren aprovechar comprar con tiempo.
texts.en:
Héctor is 46 years old and studied up to eighth grade at school. He is single and lives with his parents, who depend on him.

Héctor has been a farmer for 30 years. He learned this work from his father, who wanted him to have a trade. Héctor always accompanied his father in his work. Héctor now works from 6 a.m. until 11 p.m.

This loan will be used to buy farming supplies, such as weed-killer - as weeds are not good for crops - and manure. Manure is currently being sold cheaply and so Héctor wants to take advantage of the low price.
