loans.use: to buy farming supplies, such as weed-killer - as weeds are not good for crops - and manure, which is currently being sold cheaply.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock to sell in his shop, and to pay off debts to suppliers.

loans.name: Ont

texts.en:
Ont, 37, is from a rural village located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is married with three children. She and her husband earn a living through planting cassava and rice. She and her husband have been in this business for 17 years. The current business earns her about 50,000 KHR per day but she can save about 30,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Ont has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is applying for a new loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Ao's Group

texts.en:
Ao is a father in his late 50s with seven children, one of whom is in school. He strives for a living via rice cropping and his paid-working job as the main source of income. 

Ao is in his fourth loan cycle while his co-borrower is in her seventh cycle. The positive impact of his past loans has enabled him to improve his lifestyle so it is better than before. Now, he is seeking a loan of 200,000 KHR and his joint borrower is applying for 550,000 KHR. As the leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy school materials for his kid. He hopes this loan will enable him to keep his kid in school.

loans.use: To buy school materials.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 38-year-old lady from Kakamega.  She is married to Abisai, who is a civil servant, and they have five children aged 16, 14, 10, 9 and 7 years old.

She sells new clothes, a business she has been in for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES. 20,000. She is taking her second loan of KES. 30,000 with Vision Fund Kenya to purchase bales of clothes. She will use the profits to repay her loan.


Her dream is to become a supplier of bales of new clothes in the region.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en: Florita plants and harvests vegetables for sale in order to make a living. She has been doing this for more than seven years. She earns better income from her farm to sustain their living and has been successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. Recently, Florita took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer in order to improve her farm produce. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Non's Group

texts.en:
Non is aged 52 years old and is married. She lives with her husband and six children in a rural area located in the Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. She is a farmer who has been growing rice and cassava for 20 years. The current business earns about 30,000KHR per day and most of it is used to feed the family. But she manages to save about 10,000KHR each day.

Non has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the previous loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertiliser for her cassava plantation. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her family’s business and earns more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser for her cassava plantation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.en: Alexandre is 23 years old and single.  He sells beans and sorghum. He has requested a Kiva loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings for a better future for his business.

loans.use: To buy beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth is a mother of three children and operates her own farm to make a living. For ten years, she has earned a decent amount to provide for her family. She had planned to improve their farm in order to send her children to school. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to purchase fertiliser which will help her to obtain higher returns. In the future she wants to provide a good education for her children and improve the general living situation of her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a 36-year-old lady from Kakamega and is married to Moses, a police officer.  They have a one-year-old child.  Edith sells second-hand clothes and ladies handbags, a business she has been in for the last 8 years, earning a monthly income of KES. 25,000. 

She is taking her second loan of KES. 30,000 with VisionFund Kenya to use to purchase bales of clothes and handbags.  She will use her profits to repay her loan.  Her dream is to become a supplier of bales of second-hand clothes in the region.

loans.use: To purchase more bags and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie operates her own transportation service while her husband works abroad. She has been doing this for many years in order to support the needs of her three children. Her previous loan was used to buy tires and support her husband's income. Recently, she took a new loan to cover maintenance costs of her motorcycle.

She hopes to improve her business and provide her children a better living in the future.

loans.use: to cover the maintenance costs of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is 27 years old. She is married with four children. She sells different merchandise in her boutique. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar and maize to sale. The profits from the business will be put towards her savings.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and maize to sell.

loans.name: Moern's Group

texts.en:
Moern is aged 43 years old and is married. She is a mother of five children. To make a living, she and her husband have been growing pineapples for 10 years and supplement their family’s income by working for others for a fee. Together, they can earn about 50,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.  
Moern’s group consists of four members who live in the same village of the Moung Russey district of the Battambang province. She is a second cycle client and now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, Moern wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Sokha is a 29-year-old mother of three children. The main source of her family’s income is from planting pineapple. For more income, she also works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 50,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
This is the second loan for Sokha with VisionFund and now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sokha wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her pineapples.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Creb's Group

texts.en:
Creb, 37, lives in the rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, and she is married with three children. The main family’s sources of income are from planting cassava and farming rice. She has been in this business for 15 years, earning about 30,000KHR per day from the business. 

Creb has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the loan, which has helped her relieve family burdens and improve livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Kentice

texts.en:
Kentice is a 39-year-old mother from Katito region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is a widow, supports four people in her family and was blessed with four children who are 17, 14, 11 and 8 years old, respectively.

She has a tailoring stall, which has been operating for the last 10 years, and generates a monthly income of 12,000 KES (Kenyan shillings).

She is taking her first loan with VISIONFUND KENYA, which she will use to purchase clothes materials. She will use the anticipated profit to expand the current business. Her dream is expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric materials

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 31-year-old lady from Katito. She is married to John, who is also a businessman. They have three children, aged 15, 12 and 10 years old, respectively.

She sells maize, a business she has done for the last five years with an income of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). She has requested a loan with VisionFund Kenya amounting to KES 20,000, which she wants to use for buying more sacks of maize. 

She will use her profits to open a store for stocking her maize. Her dream is to build her own home.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 58-year-old lady from Katito. She is a widow and has two children, aged 16 and 9, respectively. She operates a posho mill (for corn grinding), a business which she has done for the past 12 years with an income of 22,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) per month. 

This is her first 20,000 KES loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she intends to use in buying lubricants and repairing the posho mill to keep it in good condition.

She will use the profits to repay her loan and expand the business. She has a dream of giving her children the best education.

loans.use: to buy lubricants and repair the posho mill

loans.name: Primitive

texts.en: Primitive is 47 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and beans for sale.

loans.name: Aimee

texts.en: Aimee is 24 years old. She is single and has been in her business for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is aged 36. She sells pineapple and has been in the business for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more pineapples for resale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate a house.

loans.use: To buy more pineapples for sale.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 28 years old. She owns a bar and has been running a bar for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beers and soft drinks for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more beers and soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is 37 years old. He is married with three children. He sells sorghum and has been in the business for the past seven years. With the loan, he would like to buy more sorghum for sale. He plans to use profits for reinvesting in the same business for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum.

loans.name: Chanthorn's Group

texts.en:
Chanthorn is aged 33 and married. He has three children. Living in a village of the Bovel district, Chanthorn has been farming rice and growing corn. Having been in this business for 15 years, he manages to earn about 66,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to feed his family and children. 

This is the second loan for Chanthorn with VisionFund. He completely paid back the past loan. Now he wants to use his portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland. He hopes to earn a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition fees

loans.name: Eng Srun's Group

texts.en:
Eng Srun is a 27-year-old married woman. She lives in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She and her husband have one child.

To earn a living, she plants and grows cassava. She explains that she has been in this business for nine years and that she earns approximately 25,000 KHR per day from her farming opreations.

Eng Srun is new to VisionFund for this loan cycle. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the group leader, Eng Srun would like to use her portion of the loan proceeds to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland, but she would also like to use a portion of the proceeds to pay for labor fees. She hopes to increase her crop yields and to earn more income in the future so that she can improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and by paying labor fees

loans.name: Karifa Dit Idrissa

texts.fr:
Monsieur KARIFA DIT IDRISSA est né en 1983 à Kayes 1ere région administrative de la république du MALI. Il est célibataire et réside chez son père au quartier  BABEMBA  un quartier populaire dans la ville de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès monsieur KARIFA DIT IDRISSA s’est initié aux activités d’achat et de vente des marchandises de la librairie (cahiers,  bics, règles, des gommes, livres, cartes,  plus divers autres matériels)., il s’approvisionne  dans la sous région.
 Il est à son premier prêt  individuel avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 8 cartons de cahiers de marque différentes, 5 cartons de bics, 2 cartons de règles pour les élèves plus une quantité importante de gommes. Sa vente se fait dans sa librairie à Sikasso  à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme  au comptant et à crédit. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice bimensuel moyen de 100 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Karifa aka Idrissa was born in 1983 in Kayes in the 1st administrative region of Mali. He is a bachelor and lives with his father in Babemba, a popular neighborhood of the city of Sikasso in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. 

Karifa aka Idrissa began his small business of purchasing and selling bookstore items (notebooks, pens, rulers, erasers, books, cards, and various other items.) He stocks up in his sub-region. He is on his first individual loan with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to better meet the needs of his growing customer base.

This loan will allow Karifa aka Idrissa to purchase 8 boxes of notebooks of different brands, 5 boxes of pens, 2 boxes of rulers for students and a large quantity of erasers. He makes his sales in his bookstore in Sikasso to a customer base made up of both men and women for cash and credit. Karifa aka Idrissa whopes to earn an average bi-monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA. This will allow him to pay back the loan and its interest and to reinvest the remainder in his business.

loans.use: to purchase various items for his bookstore

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 52-year-old lady from Siaya town which is in the Nyanza province in the western part of Kenya. She is married and supports her two children who are 23 and 26 years old. For the past five years, Mary has been operating a retail shop and she earns an income of 15,000 KES. 

Mary is requesting her second loan with VisionFund Kenya LTD to purchase maize flour and other shop items in bulk. She will use the profit from her loan to grow her business. Mary’s dream is to have a big business and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase salt, sugar, and bar soap

loans.name: Saphorn

texts.en:
Saphorn is 37 years old. He is the father of two children, who attend school.

He has been farming rice for more than 10 years to earn a living. With the aim of building a strong business, Saphorn has tried hard to manage his daily farming activities so as to secure the overall welfare of his family and his children’s education.

By applying for this loan, Saphorn is planning on buying a solar home system to install on the roof of his house, which is located in an area of the province that is "off the grid." With the help of Hattha Kaksekar Limited, he is able to gain access to micro-finance services and solar energy, which he uses to support household appliances such as lights, TV, and radio so that everyone in his family can work or study at night. He expresses his thanks in advance to all lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system for the roof of his house.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 32 years old. He is married with three children. Jean Bosco sells bananas and livestock. 

Jean Bosco is requesting a loan to buy more bananas to sell. He will use the profit from his loan to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Tsuishitoo Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of a loan group called Tsuishitoo. Group members live in Accra-Teshie where they sell fish, ceramic cups and plates, materials, scarf, panties, singlets, braziers, foodstuff, firewood, hangers, scrubbing basin, pegs, and toothpaste. Sandra is the group leader. She is 34 years old and a single mother of two children who are both in school. For the past 19 years, Sandra has been selling panties, singlets, and brassieres. She is in her sixth loan cycle with ID-Ghana.

Sandra is requesting a loan to purchase material, panties, singlets and brassieres to sell and increase her income. In the coming years, she would like to open up a large store and see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase panties, singlets and brassieres to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an air conditioner to give her humble customers the royal treatment they deserve.

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Chea is a 27-year-old married woman. She resides in a rural village in the Tbaubg Khmum district of Kampong Cham province.

She earns a living by planting and harvesting rice. Having been in this business for seven years, she is able to earn approximately 34,000 KHR per day. Of this amount, she saves approximately 20,000 KHR each day for her future needs.

Chea has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for this loan. She wants to use her portion of the loan proceeds to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn additional income in the future and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand and improve her farming operations by purchasing fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Kam Reaing district of Battambang province, Sokha is thirty-one and married. He has five children, three of whom are in school while the others are too young for school. To support the family, he and his wife have been in farming rice and growing cassava for ten years. The current business earns his family about 68,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sokha has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycles and successfully used the previous loan to better support his family to have sufficient food. He is now leading his group to ask for a loan. Sokha wants to use his portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland. He hopes to increase his crops and sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 47 years old, married, and has seven children. She sells clothes, which she has been doing for four years. 

Beatrice is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more styles of clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used for savings for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more styles of clothes to sell

loans.name: Theavy's Group

texts.en:
Theavy, 25, lives with her husband and one kid in a village of Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost 6 years and they supplement the family’s income by working for others for a fee. She is able to earn about 29,000 KHR per day. 

Theavy has just joined VisionFund this cycle. She is leading her group to seek for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Simean's Group

texts.en:
Simean, 47, is married and lives with her husband and one kid in a village of the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. She and her husband farm rice and fish and they supplement their family’s income by working for others for a fee. She has been in business for 28 years, earning about 30,000 KHR per day to feed her family. 

Simean has been with VisionFund for one cycle and now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Simean is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it on buying fishing materials. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
A married mother of seven children, Run is aged 62 and lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To support her family, she and her husband plant cassava which is the main source of the family’s income and they have been in this business for 15 years. 

Run is in her seventh cycle with VisionFund. She completely paid back the first loan, which has helped her relieve family’s burden. Now she is applying for a new loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Battambang district of Battambang province, Sambath is a 41-year-old mother of seven children. To make a living, she raises pigs and cows and her husband also adds additional income by working as a construction worker. The current business earns her about US$13 per day. 

Sambath has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Now she is applying for a loan to buy piglets and pig feed. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang, 43, lives with her husband and three children in a rural village in the Bovel district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Samnang and her husband earn a living as farmers; they have been farming rice for 10 years. The current business earns her about $17 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Samnang just joined VisionFund for this loan cycle, and she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en:
Nan is 51 years old, married, and has six children, two of whom attend school. Her family lives in a house with thatched roof located in Battambang province’s Bovel district. The main sources of her family’s income are from farming rice and working for others for a fee. Nan has been farming for 15 years, earning about 40,000 KHR per day. She is able to save about 20,000 KHR per day.
 
Nan received her first loan from VisionFund six cycle ago and effectively used it to sustain her family’s business and support her family’s needs. She is now leading her group to request another loan. As the leader, Nan will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Saoem's Group

texts.en:
Saoem is 50 years old and widowed. She lives with her family in a rural area, located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Rice farming is the only primary source of her family’s income to make a living and she has been in this business for 30 years. With the current business, Saoem can earn approximately KHR 50,000 per day and save about KHR 30,000 each day for future needs. 

This is the eighth microloan for Saoem with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Saoem will use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business, so as to earn a larger income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Darling 1 Group

texts.en:
Haidee is the featured borrower of Darling 1 Group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to work as housekeepers or to start their own business in Lebanon, to cover their families' increasing living expenses.

Haidee is a 38-year-old, married mother of two children. She works selling clothes and mobile phones to provide her family with the necessary living needs. Her acquired loan will be invested in buying a new spring and summer clothes collection, in addition to mobile phones requested by her customers. She hopes that, one day, she will develop her business and start her own in the Philippines and stay next to her children.

Haidee is the woman on the right side of the picture. As for the other members, Cristine is the woman at the center of the picture, with the Mickey Mouse top, and Olivia is on the left.

loans.use: to buy a new spring and summer clothes collection, in addition to mobile phones requested by her customers.

loans.name: Hat's Group

texts.en:
Hat is age 55 and married with four children. Her family lives in a village of the Moung Russey district of Kampong Cham province and she and her husband earn a living through farming rice. Engaging in this business for 30 years, Hat is able to earn about 60,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Hat is an existing client of VisionFund who has received loans for five cycles. The past loans have helped her family relieve their financial burden to a great extent. She is now leading a group of two members to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, Hat is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for land plowing and labor. With this loan, she hopes to make more crops and sell them for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Oem's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Ponhea Krek district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, Oem is aged 53 and is married with three children. She has been farming rice and growing rubber for 10 years, earning about 27,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Oem has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two cycle and she completely paid back her loan. Now she is leading her group of three to seek for a new loan. As the leader, Oem wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for growing rubber. She hopes to grow her rubber and also cassava in a timely manner so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for growing rubber.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with newly-released mobile phone accessories and prepaid mobile phone cards.

loans.name: Jiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe JIGUISSEME sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KABOILA un village tout près de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur trente-cinquième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame ALIMATA debout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes JIGUISSEME, fait la vente des  pagnes wax. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  25 pièces de pagnes wax au grand marché où elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. La revendre se fait en détail sur place et à KABOILA à une clientèle composée d’ hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
he five members of the Jiguisseme group are married women averaging 40 years of age, with five children. They live mainly in traditional families in Kaboila, village near the town of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.
They are on their 35th solidarity loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of meting customer demand.

Mrs. Alimata, the first one standing from left to right in the photo, sells traditional colorful “pagnes” wax cloth.
She plans to use her loan to buy 25 sets of wax pagnes at the big market, where she has a lot of demand due to the quality of her merchandise. She resells her goods retail, right at the market and in Kaboila, to a mixed clientele, for cash and on credit. She plans to earn an average monthly benefit of 35,000 West African francs, one part of which will be used to pay off her loan with interest and the other part to bolster her savings.

loans.use: to buy traditional cloth.

loans.name: Maithe Sarahi

texts.es:
Maithe Sarahi  de  29  años  de edad vive con su conyugue, tiene  2 hijos que dependen de ella,  tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 3 años al negocio de  venta de ropa y calzado, su venta es de forma ambulante ella vende con los amigos y vecinos que le compran el producto.
Maithe es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante y altas expectativas para que sus hijos crezcan con mejores condiciones de vida.
Maithe necesita el préstamo para ajustar a comprar un pedido de ropa que tiene para esta época de semana santa. Con el apoyo del crédito ella mejorara su negocio y tendrá más ganancias que le ayudaran a mejorar su calidad de vida.
Maithe su sueño es tener un negocio grande. 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2014.
texts.en:
Maithe Sarahi is 29 years old and lives with her husband. She has two dependent children and she owns their house. For the last three years, she has earned her living in the business of selling clothing and shoes. She sells door-to-door to her friends and neighbors who buy the products. 

Maithe is a hard-working woman with a desire to get ahead; she has high expectations that her children will grow up in better living conditions.

Maithe needs the loan so she can afford to fill a clothing order that she has for the Holy Week season. With the support of the loan, she will improve her business and have more earnings, which will help her improve her quality of life. Her dream is to have a large business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March, 2014.

loans.use: to fulfill an order for clothing for her business

loans.name: Maa Bastrani 'a' Group

texts.en:
In the year 2013, a women entrepreneur named Basanti of Duajhar village, Nuapada, Odisha, India, formed a group with the intervention of Mahashakti Foundation. The group includes three other women from her locality and is named “Maa Bastrani”. The lady standing second from left raising her hand in the photo is Basanti.

Basanti is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, ages 12 and 10 years. She belongs to a below poverty line family (BPL), a segment living on less than a dollar a day. Basanti has two types of business. Her husband runs a cloth vending business, and she herself runs a tailoring center. She started her enterprise four years ago on a small scale and has been working hard to grow her business. She stitches ladies garments and does repair work with her single sewing machine. Her family earns a monthly income of 6,000 Indian rupees (INR). It is very hard to manage the family's educational, domestic and business expenses. Due to lack of financing, she is not able to complete the construction of her house. 

Basanti is planning to expand her business. With the present loan, she will purchase another sewing machine for herself and purchase more sari stock for the cloth business of her husband. Basanti dreams of completing the construction of her house and giving better education to her children. Basanti says, “By successful management of my loans, I hope that I can do even better to support my family in future.”

The other three members of the group, Maena, Mithila and Premsila, have vegetable vending, fast food and puffed rice businesses respectively.

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine for herself and more sari stock for the cloth business of her husband to fulfill her dream of house construction and children's education.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en: Shamshad is 59-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has 10 years of experience in this field. She is the mother of seven children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi 'b' Group

texts.en:
This group comprises four members from a small rural village called Barpadar in the district of Nuapada of Odisha, one of the backward districts in India mainly known for drought and underdevelopment. The lady sitting second from the right and raising her hand in the photo is one of the members, named Anadi. 

Anadi is 39 years old, living with her husband and five other family members. Anadi hails from a very poor, landless, illiterate Schedule Caste (SC), Below Poverty Line category. She is running a business of rope making, a procuring and selling business. This is a traditional business in her community. Previously, the people of this community used to make rope from cow and buffalo skin. Due to social restrictions and a progressive mindset, this has been replaced by plastic rope. These items are especially used for tethering domestic animals like cows, buffalo, sheep, and goats. 

Her family helps Anadi in all aspects of the business, from the processing to the selling of products in different weekly markets at her locality. Her entire family works 8-10 hours daily in making these items. Her husband covers six weekly markets in a week by using public transport and a bicycle for selling the products. Her husband collects raw materials (empty cement bags) from different contractors and builders. 

In a week, her family earns 2,000-4,000 INR, which is not sufficient to manage her family. So, Anadi wants to increase her income by adding some extra stock of empty cement bags and a self-transport facility. She wants to have enough stock for supporting her business to run for long days. Anadi wants to utilize the present loan for purchasing more stock of empty cement bags and procuring ready-made products from her locality.

Anadi dreams to have a bike for supporting the transporting and marketing of her products, as per her own sweet-will. She also wants to complete her half-constructed house. 

The other three members of her group are Tuni, Jasoda and Jaemati, who belong to the same community and are doing the similar businesses of rope making and selling.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of empty cement bags and procure ready-made products.

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
Phal is 40 years old and married. She has one child who is still young for school. Living in a village in the Moung Russey district, Phal has been farming rice and working for others for a fee. She manages to earn about KHR 45,000 per day to feed her family. 

This is the sixth loan for Phal with VisionFund Cambodia. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Phal is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more crushed rock for her business.

loans.name: Kossomine Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe KOSSOMINE sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à  KABOILA un village tout près de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame ADIARATOU assise au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes KOSSOMINE, fait la vente des  pagnes wax réal . 
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  19 pièces de pagnes wax réal  à Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits.  La revendre se fait en détail sur place et à KABOILA à une clientèle composée d’ hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en: The seven members of the Kossomine Group are all married women with an average age of 48 and an average of five children each. Most of them live within  traditional family frameworks in Kaboila, a village very close to Sikasso in the third administrative region of Mali. In order to better serve their customers, this will be their eleventh loan with the Soro Yiriwaso Microfinance Institution. Adiaratou, the woman sat in the middle of the first row of the photograph, alongside the other women of the Kossomine Group, sells waxed pagne cloth. She plans on using this loan to purchase 19 sheets of waxed pagne cloth in Sikasso, where her quality wares are greatly sought-after by her customers. The resale is carried out in Sikasso and in Kaboila to both male and female customers, accepting both cash and credit. She plans on making an average monthly profit of 27,000 FCFA, part of which will be used to pay off the loan and its interest while the rest will go towards her savings.

loans.use: purchase waxed pagne cloth

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy special seasonal production.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 31-year-old, married woman. She has been in the beauty parlor business for the past two years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair-styling, and facials. Through her excellent services, she has become very famous in her community. 

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, Samira is interested in buying a greater variety of cosmetic products for the parlor. For this reason, she applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy haircare products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. 

Samira is hopeful of catering to more customers over time. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy haircare products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more locks, nails, hinges, etc.

loans.name: Silvio De Jesús

texts.es:
Silvio de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno  grado de nivel académico, actualmente está acompañado la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, han procreado tres hijos los cuales los tres viven con él y todos ellos están en la escuela.

Silvio se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 19 años de edad, este trabajo se lo ha enseñado el abuelo, manifiesta que es la herencia que el abuelo le dejara; este trabajo le queda a una distancia de 10 minutos,  viaja a pie este trabajo lo hace con el abuelo y un hermano en un horario de las 6 am a las 11 am 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, fertilizantes, desea aprovechar comprarlos con tiempo esto le ayudara mucho, porque más allá se pondrán  mas caros y gastaran mas.
texts.en:
Silvio is 31 years old and studied up to Grade 9. He is in a common-law relationship. His wife does domestic work. They have three children who live with them and all attend school. Silvio has been a farmer since he was 19. His grandfather taught him this and it is his inheritance from his grandfather. Their fields area 10 minute walk from their house and he does this daily with his grandfather and a brother from 6 am until 11 am.

The loan that he is requesting will be used to buy manure, herbicide, pesticide and fertilizer. He wants to buy them early as this will help him a lot. The prices go up a lot and later it would cost a lot more.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, soap and cold water to expand her sales.

loans.name: Hina

texts.en: Hina, 24, is a married woman and the mother of 3 children. The man shown in the photo is Hina’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for 3 years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Hina has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires with some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers. Hina is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires with some auto spare parts.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is a 44-year-old married woman. She has three children. She is a hardworking lady and wants to provide her family with a good standard of living. Some years ago she started her business selling milk to the people of her locality. Her business is good enough to give her a decent life. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation; currently, she is applying for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. Nusrat expects a boost in her net income through her increased sales. She is in her 9th loan cycle and has shown a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is a 25-year-old married woman. Her business is selling cloth in her locality to meet the expenses of her family members. She buys cloth of different fabrics and in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates. She then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en: Zeenat is 33 years old, very active, and has earned a living as a seamstress for many years. She works for people in her community and uses the income she earns to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to satisfy customer demand. For this reason she has requested a loan of Rs 45,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. Her goal is to increase her output so she can generate a larger income. She is in her eighth loan cycle and has repaid previous loans fully and on time.

loans.use: to buy more thread in different colors and laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
El señor Noé  de  45  años  de edad vive con su conyugue, tiene  1 hijo que dependen de él,  tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 20 años al negocio de  venta de pan de todas las clases y sabores,  su venta es de forma ambulante, el compra el producto en Tegucigalpa y lo vende en san Lorenzo, langue, Nacaome y San Marcos De Colon, el tiene un  camión en donde transporta el producto, son 20 años que él tiene de dedicarse a esta actividad.
Don Noé necesita el préstamo para comprar dos llantas nuevas para su camión ya que las que anda las tiene gastadas y eso le produce inseguridad, con el crédito el suplirá su necesidad de financiamiento es cliente nuevo.
Don Noé su sueño es que sus ventas mejoren cada día.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2014.
texts.en:
Sr. Noé is 45 years old and lives with his wife and son. He owns his house, and for 20 years has sold different types and flavours of bread in the nearby streets. He buys the bread in Tegucigalpa and sells it in San Lorenzo, Langue, Nacaome, and San Marcos de Colon. He has a truck to transport the bread.

Noé needs a loan to buy new tires for his truck as the ones he has are worn out and unsafe. With the loan he will be able to finance the purchase. He is a new client.

Noé's dream is for sales to get better as each day passes.

loans.use: Buy two tires for his truck

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 27-year-old man living in Kisumu County and married to Janet who is also a business lady in the same county. They have two children, aged three and two years respectively.

He operates a motorbike taxi business that he has done for the last two years, earning a monthly income of 25,000 KES. He is taking his first loan of 15,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya, which he intends to use in expanding his business by purchasing spare parts and lubricants in order to maintain his motorbike in a good condition; he also plans to use part of the loan to educate his children. The anticipated proceeds will be used to pay the loan back and add more value to VisionFund Kenya. His dream is to raise a stable family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and lubricants to maintain the good condition of his motorbike.

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William ha sido un hombre de campo toda su vida y se gana la vida realizando labores de agricultura.
Este oficio lo aprendió empíricamente desde muy joven al lado de sus padre quienes toda su vida fueron campesinos.
El trabaja en su propia finca cultivando distintos tipos de alimentos como plátano y yuca, todos los días asiste sus cultivos.
El solicita un apoyo para comprar elementos para la preparación de la tierra como abonos y riegos, además necesita comprar semillas para realizar sus cosechas. Esto le permitirá garantizar la estabilidad de su negocio y podrá seguir ejerciendo su actividad.
Uno de sus sueños es poder tener otra parcela de tierra más grande y allí tener más cantidad de producto para vender, de esta forma dará bienestar y calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
William has spent his whole live in the country and he earns his living doing agricultural work.

From the time he was very young, he learned this trade hands-on, working alongside his parents, who were farmers all his life.

He works on his own farm, growing different types of foods like plantains and cassava. He tends to his crops every day. 

He is requesting support to pay for elements for preparing the land, like fertilizers and irrigation. In addition, he needs to buy seed for his crops. This will allow him to guarantee the stability of his business and to be able to continue carrying out his work.

One of his dreams is to be able to have a larger parcel of land, and thus a greater quantity of produce to sell; then he would be able to provide his family with wellbeing and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a 35-year-old man from Kisumu town, which is found in Nyanza province in the western part of Kenya. He is married and supports four people in his family. He has three children who are eight, four and one years old respectively.

He operates a motorcycle transport, which has been operating for the last six years, and generates a monthly income of KES 10,000. He has applied for his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to repair his motorcycle and any other home items.  He will use the anticipated profits to grow his business. His dream is to have a big business and support the family.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: María Paz

texts.es:
María de 52 años de edad,  estudio cuarto grado de nivel académico, es mama soltera se separó con el esposo desde ya hace 11 años, tiene 4 hijos solo uno de ellos esta en la escuela. 

María vive con el papá,  sus 4 hijos y la mamá.


María se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 11 años que ella se separó, se fue para donde los padres y hoy ella le ayuda al papá a cultivar la tierra.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar dos sacos de abono y el alquiler de 7,000 metros cuadrados de terreno para cultivarlo.  Esto le ayudara mucho ya que el abono por el momento está más barato y quiere aprovechar de comprarlo con tiempo y más barato
texts.en:
María is 52 years old and studied up to Grade 4. She is a single mother who separated from her husband 11 years ago. She has four children, only one of them is in school. María lives with her mother and father and her 4 children. She has been farming for more than 11 years. When she got separated she moved back with her parents and now she helps her father farm.

The loan María is requesting is to buy two bags of fertilizer and to pay the rent on the 7,000 square meter of land that will be planted. This will help her a lot as right now the price of fertilizer is low and she wants to take advantage of this and buy it early and cheaper.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for rent on the land used for growing.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia, age 47, is a married woman. She has four children. Eight years ago, she started her general store in order to meet her household expenses. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She earns a good amount of money to support the needs of the family members. 

To fully stock her store, Safia requested a loan  of PKR 40,000, which she will use to buy packs of rice, sugar, biscuits, grains, and flour from the market, at lower rates. In this way, she would be able to consistently meet the increasing demands. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy packs of  rice, sugar, biscuits, grains, and flour.

loans.name: Sakun

texts.en: Sakun is aged 53 years and married with six children. She lives in a rural village from the Memot district of Cambodia. She earns a living through growing cassava and rubber. She has been with this business for 30 years. Sakun has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four loans cycles and has successfully paid back the past loans. The loans from VisionFund have helped her family relieve the family’s business. Now she is applying for a loan to pay for her son’s tuition fees in order for him to study nursing. She hopes to keep him in school until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s tuition fees in order for him to study nursing.

loans.name: Isrrael Benjamin

texts.es:
Isrrael de 52 años de edad, solo estudio primer grado de nivel académico,  esta casado   la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, a procreado 6 hijos en este matrimonio de los 6 uno esta estudiando y los demás le ayudan a trabajar en la agricultura con él solo viven 4 hijos y la esposa.

Isrrael se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 15 años de edad este trabajo se lo enseño el papá, ya que él quería que aprendiera el oficio para que en un futuro le sirviera y siempre lo inculco en   el buen camino y le enseño  este oficio y se los  enseño para  que en un futuro se pudieran defender, este trabajo le queda a una distancia de 10 minutos  y él viaja a pie.

El préstamo solicitado lo necesitara  para comprar los fertilizantes del cultivo,  ya que con el crédito anterior compro el lugar donde hacer la milpa, con  este crédito lo ocupara para comprar el abono y el fertilizante.

Ella dice que los prestamos les ayuda de gran manera,  porque dan tiempo de cultivar y sacar la cosecha pagar eso es de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Isrrael is 52 years old and studied up to Grade 1. He is married, his wife does domestic work. They have 6 children, one of them studies. The others help him with his farming. Only 4 of them live with him and his wife. Isrrael has been a farmer since he was 15. His father taught him so that he would have work in the future and follow the right path. His father taught him and he teaches his children so that they can get by. The fields are 10 minutes away and he walks there.

The loan Isrrael is requesting is to buy fertilizers for his crops. With the last loan he bought land to grow corn, this loan will be used to buy fertilizer and manure. He says that the loans help in a big way as he has the money to plant and harvest on time.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Build a perimeter concrete wall around his house

loans.name: Eleida Rosa

texts.es: Eleida es una microempresaria dedicada a la venta de mercancía y servicio de hospedaje, negocio que pudo establecer gracias al buen habito del ahorro ya que comenzó con un capital muy bajo de tan solo 50.000 pesos y con la ayuda de varios prestamos logro constituir sus dos negocios los cuales saco adelante sola con la ayuda de sus dos hijos a quien les debe gran parte de su progreso no solo por la inspiración que estos le daban para trabajar si no por la colaboración y cooperación para atender o tomar una decisión de su establecimiento, Eleida está muy consciente de que la mejor forma de seguir progresando y no quedarse en lo que actualmente tiene es invirtiendo capital a sus negocios y esto le ha servido para crear y posicionar sus dos fuentes de dinero que son la venta de mercancía y los hospedajes por ellos solicita un crédito para la compra de tres aires acondiciones para adecuar sus habitaciones y hacerlas más agradables a los usuarios. Sus sueños y metas los define muy simplemente tener un hostal donde pueda combinar sus dos negocios y constituirlo como lugar sitio de residencia turística en su sector locativo
texts.en:
Eleida is a small business owner who makes a living by selling merchandise and providing lodging services, a business she was able to start thanks to the good habit of saving money. She started with very little capital, only 50,000 pesos, and with the help of a number of loans she was able to start her two businesses. She got ahead with just the help of her two children, to whom she owes a large part of her progress, not just for the inspiration they give her to work but for their collaboration and cooperation in attending to or making a decision about her establishment. 

Eleida is very aware that the best way to keep progressing and not remain with what she currently has is to invest capital in her businesses, and this has served her to create and position her two sources of income, selling merchandise and providing lodging. She is therefore asking for a loan to buy three air conditioners to improve her rooms and make them more pleasant for the customers. 

She defines her dreams and goals very simply: to have a hostel where she can combine her two business and to make it a well-known residence for tourists.

loans.use: to buy three air conditioners to make her rooms more pleasant

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
At the age of 54, Hamida is a hardworking married mother of 10 children.  For many years she has operated a business sewing socks to help meet  household expenditures.

Enjoying a good reputation for the quality of her products, Hamida wishes to expand her sales. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase spools of wool and threads in various colors, along with packs of needles. With a good credit history, this will be her eighth loan. 

Hamida expects a boost in her earnings as a result of these purchases.

loans.use: to purchase spools of wool and threads in various colors, along with packs of needles.

loans.name: Shareefan

texts.en: Shareefan, age 56, is a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market for higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her ninth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to aid her coffee crop in the new season.

loans.name: Sandila

texts.en: Sandila is a 26-year-old, who financially helps her family.  Some years ago, she took the initiative in her area and started a school that offers educational services to poor students at cheap rates, so they can have a better future. Her business is beneficial for her household and society as a whole.  Sandila has requested her third loan from Kashf Foundation for 40,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase furniture such as chairs and tables, along with a new black and white board, to accommodate more students. She hopes to have more students in her school in the coming days.

loans.use: to purchase furniture such as chairs and tables, and a new black and white board.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat is a 41-year-old, married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices, and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR, which she will use to buy stocks of grains, rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demands consistently. Musarat wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy stocks of grains, rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Yensy Carolina

texts.es: Yensy es una joven de 25 años de edad quien es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora, casada y madre de un hijo el cual tiene 3 años. Ella tiene un grado de estudio de primaria el cual termino satisfactoriamente gracias al apoyo y esfuerzo de sus padres a pesar de las dificultades económicas en su hogar. En su casa de habitación también vive la mama de su esposo y dos hermanos quienes ayudan y contribuyen con actividades y cuidados en el hogar. Yensy se dedica a la alfarería aprendiendo esta actividad de su suegra quien con mucho gusto le enseño como se lleva a cabo la transformación del barro en una obra de arte para su venta. Su esposo es empleado de la empresa privada el labora en una procesadora de carnes la cual es muy prestigiosa en la zona. En su vida cada necesidad que ella ha tenido a tratado y se ha esforzado porque ya no sea una necesidad y superarla poco a poco y en esta ocasión en su vida se presenta una la cual conlleva al mejoramiento de su vivienda la cual ha ido mejorando cuando hay disponibilidad de dinero; pero que hoy en día gracias a este proyecto el cual ha traído mejoras y alegrías con los vecinos y amigos en la comunidad en sus diferentes cultivos ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción para poner un piso digno en su casa de habitación el cual en este momento es de cemento por lo que espera ser apoyada en esta ocasión por los inversionistas en la plataforma de Kiva. Sus planes para el futuro, ampliar poco a poco su casa de habitación, cambiarle el techo el cual está un poco deteriorado, el repello y pulido de las paredes así como también apoyar a su hijo para que pueda estudiar y ser un excelente profesional.
texts.en:
Yensy is 25 years old, and is a determined and hard-working woman. She is married, and is the mother of a 3 year old son. She has finished her primary schooling, which she successfully finished thanks to her parents' support and hard work, despite the economic difficulties in their home. 

Yensy's husband's mother and two brothers also live in her home, and they help and contribute with the domestic activities and caregiving necessities in the home. Yensy works with pottery, learning this skill from her mother-in-law who taught her with pleasure how to make clay transform into a work of art to sell. Her husband is a worker for a private company, and he works in a meat processor which is well-regarded in the area.

In her life, every need that she has had, she has worked hard to make it so that it is no longer a need, and to better herself little by little. In this occasion in her life, she has the need to improve her home, which she has been improving when she has money available. Today, thanks to this project which has brought improvements and happiness to her neighbors and friends in the community with their different projects, she is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials to lay a decent floor in her home. Currently, the floor is made of cement, and she hopes to be supported by the investors on the Kiva platform.

Her plans for the future include making her home bigger little by little, changing the roof which is a bit worn-out, and to fill in and to sand the walls. She would also like to support her son so that he can study and be an excellent professional man.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to lay a floor in her home

loans.name: Yamama

texts.en:
Yamama is a 48-year-old married mother of three children. She has been selling home products and mobile phone accessories and prepaid cards since 2010 to help her husband cover some of their family's expenses and improve their living standard.
Yamama is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special offer products, especially to meet summer needs, and increase her mobile phone prepaid card business.
She hopes to develop her business in a well-managed way, making sure she will be able to respond to her customers' needs.
This is her third loan as an Al Majmoua borrower. Her previous loans helped her develop her business and living standard.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special-offer products, especially to meet summer needs, and increase her mobile phone prepaid card business

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La venta de cosméticos es la principal fuente de vida de Mercedes. Ella ofrece maquillaje para todo tipo de piel y perfumes de todas las fragancias. Lleva dos años en el negocio, logrando excelentes ganancias que sustentan su vida familiar. Gracias al primer préstamo otorgado por KIVA Mi Crédito  compró una mayor cantidad de productos, satisfaciendo las demandas de sus clientes. Mercedes  se caracteriza por ser una mujer atenta  en sus ventas y responsable en sus créditos. 
Su hija es un apoyo esencial, la ha apoyado desde que inició en este proyecto. Mercedes se siente satisfecha y contenta, ya que cada día los pedidos aumentan. Por lo que recurrió a otro préstamo en KIVA Mi Crédito  para la compra de una mayor cantidad de perfumes, maquillajes y cremas corporales, que son los productos más preferidos entre clientes. En sus planes está seguir trabajando de la mano de esta institución.
texts.en:
Selling cosmetics is the main source of income for Mercedes. She offers make-up for any type of skin and perfume of all fragrances. She has been in this business for two years and generates excellent income which allows her to support her family life. Thanks to the first loan given by Kiva MiCredito she bought a greater quantity of products to satisfy the demand of her customers. Mercedes is a thoughtful woman and is responsible with her loans. Her daughter is an essential support who has been behind her since the beginning of this project.

Mercedes feels satisfied and content as each day her sales grow. So she has requested another loan from Kiva MiCredito to buy a greater quantity of perfumes, make-up and body creams, which are the most sought after product bu her customers. She plans to continue to work hand in hand with this institution.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of perfumes, make-up and body cream.

loans.name: Denyse

texts.en: Denyse is 44 years old. She is married with nine children. She sells foodstuffs such as beans and sorghum. She would like to buy more beans and sorghum for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Manuel Esteban

texts.es:
El señor Manuel ha sido un humilde campesino trabajador prácticamente toda su vida y se dedica a las labores de agricultura.
Esta actividad la aprendió desde muy joven al lado de su familia.
El trabaja en su propia finca cultivando distintos tipos de alimentos como plátano y yuca, con esto se gana la vida y lleva el sustento diario a su hogar.
El solicita un apoyo para comprar insumos para la preparación de la tierra como abonos, riegos y pesticidas, además necesita comprar semillas de plátano para continuar con sus cosechas. 
Esto le permitirá seguir ejerciendo su difícil y precaria actividad con la que ha sobrevivido todos estos años.
Su mayor anhelo es sacar a su familia adelante brindándoles todo lo necesario para vivir
texts.en:
Manuel has been a humble and hardworking farmer for practically all of his life. Agriculture is his work, which he learned from a very young age through his family. He works on his own farm, growing various types of consumables such as plantains and yucca. Through this work he makes a living and earns the daily bread for his family.

He requests support to purchase irrigation supplies, compost and pesticides to prepare his land. He also needs to purchase plantain seeds to maintain that crop. This will enable him to continue the difficult and risky work he has survived all of these years. His greatest dream is to get has family ahead by giving them everything they need to survive.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his farmland.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 52-year-old, married woman. She has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has two buffaloes and three cows, which she uses for the milk she sells to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Nasreen has become famous for providing good quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her fifth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Nasreen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her, and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida is a 52-year-old married woman. She runs a business making and selling pakora, a dish consisting of vegetables and chicken dipped in gram flour (besan). She is an expert in making good-tasting pakoras and earns enough through this business to contribute to the family income. To increase her sales, she needs to purchase gram flour and packs of oil, salt and spices. She contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000  She is on her third loan and has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase gram flour and packs of oil, salt and spices.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is a 23-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a business selling dressmaking supplies. She offers various colorful laces, buttons, ribbons and cloth to the people of her community and earns enough to lead a decent life. She has gained four years of experience in this field and has attained a regular list of customers. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy more cloth, threads, laces and ribbons in different colors and designs. With this loan, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is on her fourth loan and has an excellent repayment record. She wishes to use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy more cloth, threads, laces and ribbons in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Fatina

texts.en:
Fatina is a 33-year-old married mother of two children. She has been working as a hairdresser from her house for 13 years. She is also employed at a beauty salon for additional income to improve her family's living standard.
Fatina provides special beauty services to some customers in their homes. That makes having a car a must in order to serve those customers. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to register her car so that she can go to several nearby villages easily and safely.
She hopes to open her own salon in the future and provide several beauty services to her customers.

loans.use: To register her car to develop her business providing beauty services to her customers in their homes.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is a 51-year-old, married mother of two children. She has been working at selling underwear and lingerie for five years to support her husband in developing their living. Rita is well known in her region with the special quality of products she sells at encouraging prices. She is working hard to develop her living, but she is hindered by her family's increasing needs. Thus, for this reason Rita is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with a special summer collection. This is her second cycle as Al Majmoua borrower. Her previous loan was invested the same way and created impressive results. She hopes to expand her business more through diversifying her products and expanding her working place.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a special summer collection.

loans.name: Peres

texts.en:
Peres is 58 years old and is from Manyatta in Kisumu town, Nyanza province in the western part of Kenya. She is a widow and supports two children in her family. 

She sells detergent and has a shop which has been operating for the last 15 years, generating a monthly income of KES 15,000. She has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, Ltd. to purchase more chemicals for making detergent and other shop items in bulk. She will use the anticipated profit to grow her business.

Her dream is to have a big business and support the family.

loans.use: to increase her working capital for her detergent business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, onions, etc.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is now 52 years old, married and blessed with seven children; he supports five of them. He does house construction in Kapsabet town. He has been in this business for over twenty years. From this business he gets an average income of KES 70,000 a month. He has borrowed a loan of KES 100,000 of which he will use to pay school fees for his children who are in school.

With the anticipated profits, he will pay his children’s school fees and loan repayment, as well as expanding his business. His dream is to give the best to his family, meeting the financial needs and giving the best education to his children.  He wants to expand his business and open offices for his construction company in Kapsabet town and others nearby towns.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Saeda

texts.en:
Saeda is a 34-year-old married woman from a small village near Nablus city called Bedya. She is the mother of three sons and two daughters. Her husband works as an electrician in a small workshop. He gets a low and unstable income. Saeda decided to help her husband with part of the family expenses. She started her own business two years ago selling used clothes. She gets a good income.

Saeda took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more used clothes to resell. By taking this loan, Saeda will be able to increase her sales and also her income.

Saeda appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a display cabinet for the exhibition of her products and products in bulk to get larger earnings

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 51-year-old married mother of three children who works hard with her husband to provide them with the necessary living needs. Nada has worked selling beauty cosmetics and Tupperware from her house for three years. She is working hard on developing her business and increasing her capital to attract more customers and increase her income.

Nada is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a special summer collection that will attract customers' attention and increase her income.

She hopes to develop her business more in the future by diversifying her products and increasing her capital to open a shop of her own.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special summer collection

loans.name: Berónica Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Beronica es una mujer muy inquieta y le gusta trabajar independiente.
Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de comidas, desde desayunos y almuerzos hasta empanadas y pasteles de pollo. Todas las recetas las aprendió desde muy joven al lado de su madre quien se las enseño con el afán de que aplicara todos sus conocimientos para la vida.
Ella desea trabajar mucho más cómoda, rápida y eficientemente, por esta razón requiere de insumos para sus preparaciones, una mesa y utensilios de cocina.
Esto le dará la oportunidad de trabajar mejor y generar mucho más ingresos al aumentar sus ventas.
 Su mayor sueño es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales por eso trabaja incansablemente para apoyarlos en todo.
texts.en:
Señora Beronica is a very lively woman who likes to work independently.
She makes her living preparing and selling food, from breakfasts and lunches to "empanadas" (stuffed pastries) and "pasteles de pollo" (fried chicken pies).  She learned all her recipes at a young age at her mother's side.  Señora Beronica's mother taught them to her with the hope that she would apply all her knowledge for life. 
Señora Beronica wants to work much more comfortably, rapidly and efficiently.  That is why she needs supplies for her preparations, a table and kitchen utensils.  
These items would give her the opportunity to have a better work space and to generate a much greater income, as she would be able to increase her sales. 
Señora Beronica's greatest dream is to see her children become professionals, which is why she works tirelessly to support them in everything.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for preparing her food and a work table.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en:
Elvis is a 28-year-old man from the Kakamega region which is located in the western part of Kenya. He supports six people in his family, and has two children who are 1 and 7 years old.

He has an agro-forest where he plants flowers and seedlings. He has been doing this business for the last seven years and generates a monthly income of KES 6000. He has applied for his first loan with VISION FUND KENYA, which he will use to purchase seedlings and pay some of his workers. 

He will use the anticipated income to put back into the business. His dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: Ana es una mujer de 38 años que toda la vida se ha desempeñado como empleada básicamente en venta de mercancía como joyas, aretes, pulseras collares fabricados en acero y plata, actividad que realizaba con una cuñada pero ya se siente con ganas de empezar su propio negocio quiere dejar atrás el miedo al fracaso, a la quiebra a todas esas cosas malas que se le atraviesa a una persona a la hora de montar un microempresa, por ende solicita un crédito para la compra de una vitrina con la que iniciara su proyecto como independiente, piensa que este es el articulo más útil para ella pues podrá exhibir gran cantidad de productos con la esperanza de poder venderle al cliente alguno que requiera, su principal sueño es montar un almacén puesto que su vitrina la ubicara en su hogar y le venderá inicialmente a amigos y familiares su gran sueño es poder tener mejores comodidades para disfrutarlas con su esposo y sus dos hijos
texts.en: Ana is a 38-year old woman.  Her whole life she has worked primarily selling merchandise, such as gems, earrings, bracelets and necklaces made from steel and sliver.  She has run the business together with a sister-in-law, but Ana now feels that she wants to start her own business.  She wants to leave behind any fear of failure, of collapse, of all those negative things that occur to a person who is about to start a small business.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase a display case, with which she will start her independent business.  She thinks the display case will be her most useful item, as she will be able to show a large amount of product with the hope of being able to sell her customers what they are looking for.  Ana's main dream is to open a store, as her display case will be located in her home and she will initially sell to friends and family members.  Her greatest dream is to have greater creature comforts and to be able to enjoy them with her husband and her two children.

loans.use: to purchase a display case to show her products, which she will initially do from her home.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
