Jacqueline is 34 years old. She is married and together they have been blessed with four children. She has been running a bookstore and a grocery for 10 years now. She currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 105,000.

She would like a loan of KES 65,000 with which she will pay her children's school fees. She has successfully repaid all her previous loans. She will use her anticipated profits to educate her children to higher levels.

Her dream is to see all her children get a good education and live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Esteban Manuel

texts.es: Esteban en un hombre de 32 años padre de 3 hijos por los que vela cada día que no solo se preocupa por que tengan lo suficiente para vivir si no por brindarle comida, educación e incluso un juguete de calidad ya que quiere que estos evidencien el sacrificio que Esteban hace por ellos para que trabajen y se preocupen por su futuro. Se desenvuelve en el sector agropecuario básicamente en la compra y ventas de cerdos actividad que aprendió de sus padres y que hasta el día de hoy le ha servido para mantener a su familia, solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos y así aumentar el número de estos en su corral haciendo ver a su hacienda como un potencial en este campo y que los clientes lo busquen y lo tenga como referente a la hora de adquirir un cerdo. Su principal sueño es tener un negocio que compita a la par con los demás establecimientos semejantes y brindarles todas las herramientas necesarias a sus hijos para que sean todos unos profesionales universitarios
texts.en: Esteban is a 32-year old father of three children, for whom he works hard everyday.  He is concerned not only with giving his children what they need to survive, but also with providing them with food, an education and even a quality toy.  Esteban feels that a toy is evidence of the sacrifice he is making for his children so that they too will work and think of their future.  Esteban works in the livestock sector, basically buying and selling pigs.  He learned the business from his parents, and until now it as served him in supporting his family.  Esteban is requesting the loan to purchase pigs, which will increase the number in his corral.  This will make his ranch look strong in his field, customers will seek him out, and they will have him in mind when the time comes to acquire a pig.  Esteban's main dream is to have a business that competes on par with other similar establishments.  He also wants to provide his children with the necessary tools to become university-educated professionals.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to increase their quantity in his corral, which will make his business look more attractive and be more competitive.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy solar panel equipment (battery, regulator, inverter)

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los Ángeles” está  conformado por 12 socios entusiastas y dinámicos. Rosa de 39 años es separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Rosa es ama de casa en los quehaceres domésticos. Se siente feliz pues con su esfuerzo ha podido mejorar su vivienda y mantener sus hijos. Su mayor deseo es de terminar de construir su vivienda. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de cemento, madera y calamina. El grupo “Los Ángeles” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Rosa es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo negro.
texts.en: The group “Los Ángeles” (The Angels) is made up of 12 responsible and dynamic members. Rosa is 39 years old. She is separated and has two dependent children. Rosa is a homemaker who does all of the household chores. She is happy because with her efforts she has been able to improve her home and take care of her children. Her greatest wish is to finish building her house. This is why she is requesting the loan to buy cement, wood and corrugated iron. The “Los Ángeles”  group thanks the Kiva loaners for their support. Rosa is the first woman from the left wearing a black shirt in the photo.

loans.use: to buy cement, wood and corrugated iron.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 22-year-old single man who is the sole breadwinner for two members of his family. Hassan has a mobile snack truck which he moves from one village to another to provide them with the special sandwiches he offers with a special taste and encouraging prices. He started this business in 2010, and he is developing it gradually in a well managed way to keep it attracting different types of customers.

Hassan has also been employed earlier in a company because he has to provide his family members with the necessary standard of living and their needs are increasing, so he decided to take this additional income business to make sure that he meets his family's requests.

Today he is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua because he needs to buy the necessary raw materials to develop his business with special prices.

He hopes to keep on developing his business and will work hard to expand it by buying a wider car in the future and diversifying his products with a new released menu.

loans.use: to buy the necessary raw materials he needs

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 50 years old, married, and has one child. For 20 years, she has been working at her house in tailoring to help her family to meet the needs of life. She is well-known in her region by her good reputation. 

To better develop her work, Salma is requesting a loan from Vitas s.a.l., which she will use  to buy new materials, such as textiles and scissors, for her business. This loan will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase new materials for her business

loans.name: Eduardo Antonio

texts.es:
Eduardo de 27 años de edad, es un joven que estudio séptimo grado,  es soltero vive  solo con los padres y un hermano por lo tanto solo ellos dependen de él.

Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años, este trabajo se lo enseño el papá, solo a esto se dedica el papá decido inculcarle a este trabajo ya que de algo le iba a servir y fue así como ha crecido y se puede defender solo, este trabajo lo hace junto con su papá y un hermano en un horario de las 6 am a las 11 am.

Con el préstamo solicitado lo ocupara para comprar los insumos agrícolas  como el abono y herbicidas,  para matar la hierba mala que le afecta a los cultivos también pagara el alquiler de 10,500 metros cuadrados de terreno esto le va mejorar mucho porque con la ayuda del préstamo cultivara más y así podrá tener más ingresos cuando saque la cosecha. 

Sus sueños es poder seguir cultivando y poder ayudarles a los papás cuando él decida hacer su hogar y formar su propia familia darle lo mejor a la esposa y a los hijos esto lo legrara con mucho esfuerzo
texts.en:
Eduardo is a 27-year-old young man who studied until the 7th grade. He is single and lives with his parents and brother who depend on him.

He has been working in agriculture for 10 years. He learned this trade from his father who worked in agriculture. His father decided to give him this job because it would be useful. That's how he grew up and why he can take care of himself. He works with his father and brother from 6:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m.

The requested loan will be used to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer and herbicide to kill the weeds that affect his crops. It will also be used to pay the rent on his 10,500 square meters of land. With the help of this loan, his land will improve a lot because he will be able to grow more and will earn more income when he harvests his crops.

His dreams are to keep growing crops, to be able to help his parents out when he decides to start his own family, and to give the best to his future wife and children. He will achieve this with much effort.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer and herbicide to kill the weeds that affect his crops and to pay the rent on his 10,500 square meters of land. .

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 30 years old, married, and has one child. She sells various merchandise in her food stall, which she has been doing for four years. 

Ruth requested a loan, which she will use to buy more rice, sugar, and salt to sell. She will use the profits from the business to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 64 years. She is married and together with her husband have been blessed with six children. She has been farming and selling cereals for 10 years now. She currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 36,000. She would like a loan of KES 24,000.

Through this loan she will buy more cereals for selling to clients in her area. From her anticipated profits, she will purchase food for the family, expand her current business and buy fertilizer for farming.

loans.use: to buy more cereals for selling to customers.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a 53-year-old lady from Katito County. She is married to Otieno, who is a  businessman in the same town. They have three children aged 17, 10 and 5, respectively.

Peninah sells kerosene as a business and has done this for the last 6 years earning an average income of KES 6,000 per month. She is taking her 1st loan of KES 20,000 with Visionfund Kenya to use in buying more kerosene. The profits will be used to repay the loan and do some savings.

Her dream is to prosper.

loans.use: to buy kerosene in bulk.

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is a 36-year-old Lebanese married woman, living with her husband and three school-aged children. Malak has faced bad circumstances. This is why she works hard to show her perseverance of being able to enhance her family’s way of living. 

In 2009, Malak started her job in the agriculture area. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to increase her merchandise and to buy seeds for the business. Malak is very proud of her business growth and she hopes to enlarge her business in the future.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise and to buy seeds.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
La señora Olga Marina de 53  años  de edad es casada, no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, vive con su esposo   en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 31 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, refrescos, granos básicos, cosméticos, verduras, zapatos y sandalias,  su negocio esta ubicado en la comunidad de la finca,  San Lorenzo, Valle. Al sur de Honduras, en su negocio ella atiende a sus vecinos y personas que a diario transitan por ese lugar y también vende leña seca para cocina, es una cliente muy trabajador y con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Olga esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de abarrotería, frescos, granos básicos, sandalias ya que viene la semana santa y desea estar preparada con suficiente abarrotería para atender a sus clientes, con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también con las ganancias mejorara su condición de vida.
Doña su deseo es tener un buen negocio y atender mejor a sus clientes para tener una casa mejor.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2014.
texts.en:
Olga Marina, 53, is married and doesn't have any dependent children. She lives with her husband in their house. She has been working in her store for 31 years selling groceries, beverages, staple crops, cosmetics, vegetables, shoes and sandals. Her shop is located on a community farm in San Lorenzo, Valle, in the south of Honduras. In her shop she assists her neighbours and people who pass through this area. She also sells firewood for cooking. She is a hard worker with a strong will to come out ahead.

Olga is requesting a loan to purchase groceries, beverages, staple crops, and sandals as holy week is approaching and she wants to be prepared with sufficient supply to assist her clients. With this loan she will increase her revenue and with the earnings improve her living conditions.

Olga’s wish is to have a good business and better assist her clients and to have a better house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2014.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, beverages, staple crops, and sandals for her store.

loans.name: Lidivine

texts.en:
Lidivine is 31 years old and has four children. She sells cows, which she has been doing for nine years. 

Lidivine requested a loan, which she will use to buy more cows to sell. She will use the profits from the business to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase more cows to sell.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 46 years old. She sells maize and sorghum. 

She has requested a loan to buy more maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Peruth

texts.en:
Peruth is 32 years old. She sells charcoal and has been in the business for the past eight years. 

With the loan, Peruth would like to buy more charcoal to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Gemima

texts.en:
Gemima is 34 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She owns a butcher shop, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Gemima requested a loan, which she will use to buy more meat to sell. She plans to use the profits to pay chool fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 36 years old. She sells foodstuffs, which she has been doing for four years. 

Chantal requested a loan, which she will use to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. She will use the profits from the business to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purhcase more beans and sorghum to sell

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine, 35, is married with six children. She sells charcoal and has been in the business for eight years. With the requested loan, she would like to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. The profits from her business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 24 years old. She is married, with three children. 

With the loan, Grace would like to buy more rice, cassava flour, and peanuts to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more rice, cassava flour, and peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming supplies such as herbicide, to remove the weeds to cultivate and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more electronic products to sell

loans.name: Donaldo Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Donaldo es un hombre muy diligente y atrevido con sus proyectos.
El se dedica a la comercialización de mercados y bebidas, oficio que aprendió de manera empírica al sentir la necesidad de generar más ingresos para su familia.
Actualmente desea montar una salsamentaría donde pueda ofrecer variados productos al público aprovechando los proveedores que actualmente tiene.
Tiene el deseo de adecuar un local e instalar allí sui establecimiento.
Esto le permitirá tener ingresos estables para su negocio y su familia que al fin y al cabo son las personas por las que lucha día a día.
Su meta es tener un negocio muy bien acreditado y duradero en el tiempo, donde prime la variedad y el buen servicio.
texts.en:
Señor Donaldo is a very diligent man and daring with his projects. His job is selling beverages, a craft began upon sensing the need to generate more income for his family. 

He now wants to open a general store where he can offer various products to the public, taking advantage of the suppliers he currently has. He wants to renovate a place and open his business there. This will give him a stable income for his business and his family, who, at the end of the day are the people he is working hard for day after day. 

His goal is to have an accredited and lasting business over time, where he will prioritize variety and good service.

loans.use: to renovate a place to set up a general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sugar and rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, chicken, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Claudia María

texts.es: Claudia es una mujer que ha sido criado con los valiosos valores del campo como el trabajo, la humildad, el respeto y ante todo la alegría que caracteriza a estas personas que en verdad no necesitan ningún artilugio o dinero para sonreírle a la vida, se desempeña en la actividad de compra y venta de gallinas, negocio que tiene aproximadamente hace un año y que emprendió con la ilusión de adquirir un criadero de gallinas gigante el cual exporte estos animales por todo el departamento y ella más que todos sabe lo ambicioso que es este proyecto pero para una mujer colombiana nada le es imposible y sabe que solo necesita determinación y trabajo para alcanzar esta meta, por ende solicita un crédito para la compra de gallinas con las cuales pueda producir más huevos y tengas más animales para la venta, generando un aumento en su cartera para re-invertir en su negocio buscando siempre ese horizonte (su meta)
texts.en:
Claudia is a woman who has been raised with values that prevail in the field such as hard work, humility, respect, and above all, the joy that characterizes these people who don’t need material goods or money to go through life with a smile. She makes a living buying and selling chickens, a business she began about a year ago with the hope of acquiring a breeding ground of big chickens to export these animals throughout the area. She knows more than anyone how ambitious this project is, but to a Colombian woman nothing is impossible. 

She knows that she needs determination and hard work to achieve this goal, and is therefore requesting a loan to buy hens which can produce more eggs and have more animals to sell, and increase earnings to re-invest in her business, which is her ultimate goal.

loans.use: to buy hens to increase egg production and have more animals available to sell.

loans.name: Yader Ramón

texts.es: Yader es un hombre de 37 años de edad, habita en el Barrio Linda Vista del municipio de Nueva Guinea, desempeña el cargo de coordinación y evaluación institucional, lo que le ha permitido apoyar a su esposa para culminar sus estudios de administración de empresas. ÉL es papá de dos inteligentes niños que cursan su periodo de educación primaria, donde son alumnos ejemplaras. Yader tiene el objetivo de brindarles mejores condiciones de vivienda a su familia, para lo cual necesita invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como cemento, piedrín, arena, madera zinc y clavos, lo que le permitirá repellar las paredes interiores y cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya este último no presta las condiciones para la temporada de invierno que se avecina.
texts.en: Yader is a 37-year old man who lives in the Linda Vista Barrio of the Nueva Guinea municipality.  He works as an institutional coordinator and evaluator, which has allowed him to support his wife in finishing her business administration studies.  Yader is the father of two intelligent children, who attend primary school and are exemplary students.  Yader's goal is to provide the best living conditions for his family.  To do that, he needs to invest in the purchase of construction materials, such as cement, gravel, sand, wood, tin and nails.  These items will allow him to stucco the interior walls and replace  his home's roof, which is not in the condition it should be for the approaching winter season.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, gravel, sand, wood, tin and nails.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, salt, soft drinks, rice, pepper and other items for her business.

loans.name: Mariyama Group

texts.en:
Sobhamani, 40 years of age, is the leader of a group that hails from J. K. Pur of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. Her family comprises her husband and three sons, aged 16, 18 and 20. The member standing in the middle (third from left) with a raised hand is Sobhamani. 

Sobhamani is managing a small grocery shop in her locality. Her husband is going to different weekly markets for selling the grocery items.  At present, her monthly income is about Rs. 5,000, which is not sufficient enough to maintain her family. So she, along with four members, decided to form a group to avail a loan to improve their businesses.  

From the present loan, she will purchase grocery items like rice, pulses, sugar, tea, flour, oil, potatoes, onions, garlic, ginger, etc. 

She wishes to have a pacca house of her own and increase the grocery items in her shop.

The other four members of her group are Rita, Kanti, Jasoda and Chatula. They are doing an egg business, vegetable vending, fish selling, and a vegetable vending business respectively.

loans.use: to purchase a huge amount of grocery items like rice, pulses, sugar, tea, flour, oil, potatoes, onions, garlic, ginger, etc.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
El ser analfabeta no le impide a Cándida Rosa desarrollar otras habilidades. Ha logrado desenvolverse muy bien en el mundo del comercio. Ella es el vivo ejemplo de superación. El no contar con estudios, no ha sido excusa para alcanzar sus metas y aspiraciones. Su  pequeña pulpería es producto de su  arduo empeño y dedicación.  KIVA MiCrédito  desempeña un rol esencial en su vida, esta institución le brinda su apoyo cada vez que necesita capital. 
Cándida desea continuar satisfaciendo las necesidades de los clientes que la visitan diariamente.  Por lo que decidió optar por otro préstamo en  KIVA MiCrédito  para la compra de granos básicos tales como: Arroz, Azucar, Frijoles y Aceite productos que más se consumen, con el fin de no sufrir escasez alguna. Entre sus planes futuros está la posibilidad de adquirir una camioneta, que servirá como transporte de carga.
texts.en:
Being illiterate does not prevent Cándida Rosa from developing other skills. She has managed to do very well in the business world. She is a perfect example of overcoming obstacles. She doesn’t have an education, but this didn’t prevent her from achieving her goals and aspirations. Her small convenience store is the product of her hard efforts and dedication. KIVA MiCrédito plays an essential role in her life: this institution provides support whenever she needs capital. 

Cándida wants to continue to meet the needs of customers who visit the store daily. This is why she decided to opt for another loan in KIVA MiCrédito to buy basic grains such as rice, sugar, beans and oil: her most popular products, to avoid any supply shortages. Her future plans include the possibility of acquiring a van, which will be used to transport products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as rice, sugar, beans and oil

loans.name: Olvin Rolando

texts.es:
El señor Olvin  de 30  años  de edad vive con su conyugue, tiene  3 hijos que dependen de él,  tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 9 años trabajo como cocinero en un hotel de su comunidad.
Don Olvin está solicitando el crédito para mejora de vivienda ya que tiene su cocina sin techo, y no tiene pozo séptico para su letrina y quiere arreglarlo para vivir mejor con su familia.
Don Olvin con este apoyo del crédito le ayudara a mejorar las condiciones de vida de él y su familia porque realizara su sueño que es mejorar su casa. 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2014.
texts.en:
Olvin is 30 years old and lives with his spouse.  He has 3 children who depend on him, he has his own house and has worked for 9 years as a cook at a hotel in his community.  Olvin is asking for credit to improve his house since his kitchen doesn't have a roof and he doesn't have a septic tank for his latrine and he would like to fix it to live better with his family.  This loan will help Olvin improve living conditions for himself and his family because it will realize his dream of improving his house. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2014.

loans.use: To buy sheets of metal, cement, blocks and other materials for his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal, oil, peppers, onions, rice, etc., to expand her sales.

loans.name: Mahalaxmi Group

texts.en:
Sasmita, aged about 29 years, is the group leader of a five-member group from Muniguda town, situated in the Rayagada district of Odisha state in India. Her family comprises four members: her husband, one son aged 13, and one daughter aged 11. The member sitting in the middle with a raised hand is Sasmita. 

At present, she is doing a leaf plate-making business and silver utensils business in her locality. She is a very active lady who wants some extra income out of her own efforts.

During 2010, she, along with four other members of her village, formed a group, and for the first time they took a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing businesses. Sasmita’s husband is assisting her to run the business smoothly. At present, her family income is Rs. 5,000 per month, which is not sufficient to maintain the family. 

To improve her living condition and to earn some extra income, Sasmita wants to avail a fourth loan. From the loan amount, she will purchase a leaf plate press machine and a bulk amount of leaves for her business. She would like to convert her present business to a small grocery shop in the future.

The other four members are named Radhamani, Rina, Subasini and Sushama. They are doing leaf plate-making, auto-rickshaw, utensil business and a tent house business respectively.

loans.use: to purchase a leaf plate press machine and a bulk quantity of leaves.

loans.name: Shanti Group

texts.en:
Saram is the leader of a group that hails from J. K. Pur of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She is a married woman. She has a small family comprising four members: her husband and two sons, aged 15 and 13. The member standing in the middle (third from left) with a raised hand is Saram. 

Today, 35-year-old Saram has been running her small enterprise of leaf plate-making and selling in the market. Her husband is driving an auto rickshaw in the town and earns their livelihood. At present, the auto-rickshaw needs some repairing and also a change of tyres and tubes.

Saram, along with another five members of her locality, formed a group to avail a loan and improve their businesses. It is the first loan for development of their existing businesses. At present, Saram’s family’s income is Rs. 5,000 per month, which is not sufficient to maintain her family. 

So, she wants to take a loan to repair the auto-rickshaw and purchase new tyres and tubes for it. She has a cherished desire to run a standing business and purchase a new auto-rickshaw for her son.

The other five members are named Debi, Dipanjali, Sabita, Khira and Sushila. They are doing tailoring, auto-rickshaw, tailoring, kirana store and a vegetable business respectively.

loans.use: to repair the auto rickshaw and purchase new tyres and tubes for it.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is aged 30. She is married with four children. She sells foodstuff and has been in the business for the past five years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more foodstuff for resale, such as beans, maize, and bananas. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuff for resale, such as beans and maize.

loans.name: Ildephonse

texts.en:
Ildephonse is 31 years old. He is a father of one child. 

With the loan, Ildephonse would like to buy more rice and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Petronilo

texts.es:
El señor Petronilo de 71  años  de edad  casado no tiene  hijos que dependen de él  radica en la comunidad de Langue, Valle al sur de la región de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 45 años al negocio de la venta de maíz, condimentos, accesorios de costura, medicina natural y otros, sus clientes son los amigos y personas que le conocen que visitan a diario el mercado de langue.
Don Petronilo está solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz en carga, medicina natural, condimentos, semillas y otros productos.  EL desea aprovechar la oferta que hay en los precios del maíz para venderlo mejor mas adelante y así tener mejores ganancias, es un cliente ya con varios ciclos de trabajar con prisma.
Don Petronilo su sueño es mejorar su vivienda.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2014.
texts.en:
Petronilo, age 71, is married.  He does not have children who are dependent upon him.  He is from the Langue community, a valley in the southern region of Honduras.  For 45 years he has had a business of selling corn, condiments, sewing accessories, natural medicine, and others.  His customers are his friends and the people who know him that visit the Langue market daily.

Petronilo is requesting the loan to buy a load of corn, natural medicine, condiments, seeds, and other products.  He wishes to take advantage of the sale on the price of corn in order to sell it for a better price later.  This way he will have improved earnings.  He is a client who has worked with Prisma during various cycles.

Petronillo’s dream is to improve his house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – March, 2014.

loans.use: to buy a load of corn, natural medicine, condiments, seeds, and other products for his business.

loans.name: Marcela Abigail

texts.es: Marcela tiene 22 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 3 años de edad. Marcela  es una mujer trabajadora quien se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo. Ella es muy conocida en su localidad como una mujer responsable y visionaria. Con el fin da dar mayor seguridad a su hija a tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de su vivienda el cual se encuentra deteriorado. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder dar inicio a las mejoras lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Marcela, age 22, lives in her own house with her three year old daughter.  Marcela is a hard-working woman who sells beauty products by catalog.  She is very well-known in her area as a responsible and visionary woman.  

In order to make her daughter safer, she has made the decision to request this loan from FUSAI.  She will use the loan to repair the roof of her house.  It is damaged.  She will use the requested loan to buy galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails.  She hopes to be able to get this loan.  This way she will be able to start the improvements as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a generator and an air-conditioner.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and more stock in food products.

loans.name: Dieudonne

texts.en: Dieudonne is 33 years old an married. He sells goat meat, which is very much demanded in the area where he operates. With the loan, he would like to buy more goat meat for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more goat meat for resale.

loans.name: Jorge Enrique

texts.es:
Jorge se dedica a una difícil y ardua tarea, la fabricación de bloques para construcción.
Este oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica al lado de un amigo para el cual trabajaba como ayudante.
Actualmente aprovecha los contratos con las construcciones que están iniciando y de esta forma va afianzando su negocio.
Este oficio le ha permitido conseguir los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de sus dos hijos pequeños y su esposa.
Es un hombre trabajador, dedicado, emprendedor y muy entregado a su actividad.
El solicita apoyo para comprar materia prima y capitalizar su negocio ya que ha tenido algunos problemas financieros y no le ha ido del todo bien.
El solo quiere tener un negocio estable, que le genere ingresos para su familia, que sea rentable y duradero en el tiempo.
Y su mayor sueño es tener su vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Jorge makes a living in a difficult and labor intensive field: making blocks used in construction. 
He learned this job alongside a friend for whom he works as an assistant. 
He is currently taking advantage of contracts with construction sites that have begun and this is how he continues to finance his business. 
This job has helped him to earn enough income to support his two small children and his wife. 
He is a hard working man, enterprising, and dedicated to his work. 
He is asking for help to purchase prime materials and invest in his business because he has had some financial problems and not everything is going as well as he would like. 
He wants a stable business and one that generates income for his family, that is profitable, and will stand the test of time. 
His biggest dream is to own his own home.

loans.use: purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional fish to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cold water for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Each member of Domoo's group intends to buy sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Nancy Yaniris

texts.es: Gracias a su primer financiamiento Nancy pudo comprar los insumos que necesitaba para la elaboración de productos para la limpieza del hogar los cuales fueron vendidos satisfactoria mente en su comunidad con los diferentes habitantes. Gracias a este financiamiento su vida mejoro mucho tanto en su familia como en su negocio pues la idea de crecer ahora ya puede ser una realidad y como próximo proyecto para su micro empresa es la elaboración de una marca y patente la cual permita introducir sus productos en supermercados, tiendas, pulperías y demás lugares de comercio donde pueda crecer. En esta ocasión ella solicita nuevamente ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en KIVA para que su próximo proyecto pueda ser una realidad destinando una pequeña parte del efectivo para la compra de insumos y poder elaborar más producto para su venta así como también otra parte para empezar a tramitar la documentación pertinente para establecerse como micro empresaria de forma individual esperando nuevamente ser apoyada en esta ocasión y llevar a la realidad sus planes, metas y sueños.
texts.en:
Thanks to a previous loan, Nancy was able to buy the necessary materials to manufacture cleaning products for the home. These sold well within her community with the different inhabitants. Thanks to this loan, her life improved both in terms of her family and her business because the idea of growing has now become a reality.

As the next project for her small business, she would like to develop her brand and a patent, which would allow her to introduce her products in supermarkets, stores, small grocery stores and other places of business where they can grow.

This time, she again asks for the support of Kiva lenders to make her next project a reality. She will dedicate part of the loan for materials to manufacture her cleaning products to sell and another portion to start processing the paperwork necessary to establish her small business as an individual. She hopes that she can again have support on this occasion and have her plans, goals and dreams become a reality.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the manufacture of home cleaning products and for the cost of processing an operations permit

loans.name: Kifah

texts.en:
Kifah is a 37-year-old married mother of two children. She opened a small grocery store, seven years ago, next to her house to support her husband in covering their increasing living expenses. 

Kifah used to work as a hairdresser from her house, but she preferred to turn to a daily need income business, and she found out that food is the necessary daily needs.

Kifah is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special summer beverages. That will sure increase her income, since they are already requested by her customers and she is working on acquiring them.

She hopes that in the future, she can improve her financial situation, and open a beauty salon in addition to her current business.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special summer beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and materials to start his own crops

loans.name: Reyna Guadalupe

texts.es: Reyna tiene 24 años de edad  es madre soltera y habita junto a sus dos hijas de 5 años y 6 años de edad. Reyna tiene un negocio de venta de refrescos naturales y además se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos como planchar y lavar. Es así como va sacando adelante a sus hijas y dando lo necesario. Reyna solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena y cemento para repellar las paredes de la vivienda las cuales con las lluvias se deterioran y antes de que llegue el invierno desea actuar.
texts.en: Reyna is 24 years old, a single mother, and she lives with her two daughters who are 5 and 6 years old. Reyna has her own business selling refreshments made with natural ingredients and she also works as a domestic worker doing chores like ironing and washing. This is how she is able to care for her daughters and give them all that they need. Reyna is asking for this loan through FUSAI in order to invest in purchasing sand, cement, and to re-plaster the walls of her home because they are deteriorating due to the rain. She wants to get this done before winter arrives.

loans.use: purchase sand, cement and re-plaster the walls of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes (blouses, jeans, tee shirts, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: Ekome Feamo Group

texts.en:
These women are part of the group called Ekome Feamo. They are led by Tsotsoo, and they live in Teshie, Accra. They sell fish, canned products, foodstuff, onions, cooking oil and rice. They will need a total amount of 5,000 GHS to expand their businesses and will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

Tsotsoo is 58 years old and single with grown up children who do not depend on her. She stays in the house her parents built for her and her siblings. For the past ten years, she has been selling fried fish in a commercial quantity. She sells as a street vendor in the neighboring communities surrounding her home.

Tsotsoo is the leader of this group and seeking a loan to buy three cartons of fish, fry and supplies. With the support of the loan, she plans on improving her business and her quality of life. Tsotsoo's dream is to improve her business and build a home for her children, too.

loans.use: to buy three cartons of fish, fry and supplies.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel de 60 años de edad, un agricultor que estudio hasta sexto grado,  es acompañado la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, no ha procreado hijos la vida no le ha permitido poder engendrar hijos pero Manuel vive con la esposa y un hermano.

Manuel se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 15 años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseño el padre sabiendo que en un futuro le iba a servir este oficio y es así que hoy esa es la única fuente de ingreso.  

El préstamo  que esta solicitando es para comprar los insumos agrícolas comprara 7 sacos de abono para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de tierra y también comprara herbicidas  y también buscara más personas que le ayuden al cultivo.

El sueño de Manuel  es poder seguir cultivando y poder ayudarles a la  esposa salir adelante y poder tener una vejez muy bien que no les falte los alimentos al hogar.
texts.en:
Manuel is 60 years old. He is a farmer by profession who studied up to the sixth grade. He is married and his wife takes care of the home. He does not have any children, but Manuel lives with his wife and brother. 

Manuel has worked in agriculture since he was 15 years old. His father taught him knowing that in the future, it would serve him well to have a skill and to have a way to earn money. 

This loan will be used to purchase agricultural supplies: 7 sacks of fertilizer to cover 14,000 square meter of land and also to purchase herbicides, but also to pay for labor to help him with the work.

Manuel's dream is to be able to continue growing crop,  to be able to help his wife, and to be able to enjoy old age and not have to worry about hunger.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, yeast, sugar, ginger, etc. in order to produce a larger quantity of cakes and ginger beer to sell.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: La señora Gregoria , tiene 52 años,  ella tiene un hijo de la edad de 12 años, ella se dedica a la confección de  enaguas estas prendas son para mujeres de pollera, las enaguas es una prenda que se pone debajo de la pollera es de tela de encaje,  su taller se encuentra ubicado en la zona las Delicias de la ciudad de La Paz, ella confecciona según pedidos como también entrega a distintos mercados de la ciudad de La Paz y el Alto,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Gregoria va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de tela por mayor ya que tiene muchos pedidos por estas fechas ya que se acerca la temporada de invierno,  la señora Gregoria a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su negocio, su deseo para su negocio es  poder tener un taller más grande confeccionar en mayor cantidad y entrar al mercado a nivel nacional, se siente agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gregoria is 52, she has a 12 year old son. She makes petticoats for women in skirts, these petticoat being garments worn under the skirt and made of lace fabric. Her workshop is located in the Las Delicias zone of the city of La Paz. She fabricates based on orders, but also delivers to different markets in the city of La Paz and El Alto. 
This loan is her first sequence within the institution, she will use this loan to purchase fabric at wholesale because she has a lot of orders during this time as the winter season is approaching. Mrs. Gregoria will use the benefits to keep improving her business. Her hope for her business is to be able to have a bigger workshop, fabricate in larger quantity and enter the market at a national level.
She feels thankful for this opportunity given to her through the granting of this credit.

loans.use: purchase fabric at wholesale.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 47-year-old married mother of five children. She has been working in the Mouneh business (traditional way of conserving nonseasonal food) since nineteen years ago to support her husband in covering their family's increasing needs.

Fatima is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to pay the necessary legal document expenses for her son's legal residency in Lebanon. She is married to a non-Lebanese man, and in Lebanon, the mother can't provide her husband or children the Lebanese Nationality. Most of the NGOs in Lebanon are currently fighting for this issue, since it is one of the necessary women rights.

She hopes that one day her children can live freely as Lebanese. 

She is also working on manufacturing soaps from Olive oil in addition to her current conserving business, and hopes to expand it widely through opening her own selling shop in the future.

loans.use: to pay the necessary legal documents expenses for her son's legal residency in Lebanon.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 36-year-old man from Kakamega region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Mary, who is a farmer, and supports the family. He supports three people in his family, and was blessed with two children who are 11 and seven years old respectively.

He has a tailoring stall, which has been operating for the last one year, and generates a monthly income of KES 10,000. He is taking his first loan with Vision Fund Kenya, which he will use to purchase clothing materials. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the current business.

His dream is to expand his business and educate their children.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing materials.

loans.name: Rabab

texts.en:
Rabab is a 32-year-old Lebanese married woman, living with her husband and three children who are still attending school. Rabab provides her family with extra financial support due to her work in the agriculture sector since 2010. 

Rabab is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., to purchase new merchandise for her project, such as seeds and seedlings for plantings. Her loan will help her improve her productivity. These changes will increase her returns and result in higher profits in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise for her project.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 28-year-old man from Kisumu. He is married to Irene and they have three children aged nine, eight, and four years old.

He sells shoes, a business he has done for the past 13 years, earning an income of KES 41,000 monthly. He is taking a first loan of KES 30,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to use in purchasing more sacks of shoes. 

He plans to use the profits to improve the lives of his family members. His dream is to own a mega shoe store.

loans.use: to purchase shoes in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta tiene 6to grado, esta acompañado la esposa se dedica a los oficios  domésticos,  con su esposa han procreado 5 hijos lo cual tres viven con él y uno de los tres está en la escuela las otras dos ya están en hogares apartes aunque viven cerca de él.  

Antonio trabaja en una institución que distribuye sodas desde hace 7 años, entro a este empleo por la recomendación de un amigo desde entonces está trabajando como bodeguero,  también trabaja con compra de ganado de engorde y luego lo vende es así que él tiene ingresos de la venta de ganado.  Antonio trabaja en  la empresa de sodas en un horario de las 4pm a las 6am es un turno de toda la noche 

con el préstamo solicitado lo ocupara para comprar 4  terneras, esto le va ayudar porque en un futuro ellas crecerán y tendrán una ternera y de ahí las vende es ahí que obtiene ingresos esto ayudara mucho ya que la esposa se encarga de cuidarlos.

Los sueños de Antonio  es poder seguir trabajando en la empresa y también tener el ganado para que la familia se involucre y que cuando crezca el ganado y sean vacas obtener los ingresos de la leche,  esto lo lograran con sacrificio y mucho trabajo para que los hijos puedan superarse darle los estudios y que sean profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Antonio is 46 years old, has a 6th grade education, and has a stay-at-home wife. Together with his wife they have 5 children, three of which live at home (one in school) and the other two live in homes close to him.

Antonio has worked for a soda distributor for 7 years. He found that job by the recommendation of a friend, and since then Antonio has worked in the warehouse. He also works with buying feeder cattle and selling them. This is how he has income from selling cattle. Antonio works in the soda business from 4 pm to 6 am, which is an all-night shift.

He will use the solicited loan to buy 4 calves. This will help him because in the future they will grow and have a calf and he will sell them, and this is where he will gain income. This will help a lot since his wife is in charge of taking care of them.

Antonio's dreams are to keep working in the industry and also to have cattle for the family to get involved. And when the cattle become cows, he wants to obtain income from their milk. They will accomplish this with sacrifice and lots of work so that their children can overcome, he can give them an education and they can become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 4 calves

loans.name: Solange

texts.en: Solange is 24 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past two years. With this loan, she would like to buy more bananas, rice and cooking oil for resale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, rice and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Harapriya's Group

texts.en:
Harapriya, 42 years of age, is the leader of a group that hails from Hada Sikula village of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She has one son, aged 18, and her husband. The member sitting in the front row beside the sewing machine and with a raised hand is Harapriya.

Harapriya is looking after her tailoring shop in her locality. Her husband owns a kirana shop (small grocery or general store) and also goes to a nearby market to sell bags. In December 2012, Haripriya, along with eleven other members of her village, formed a group and took a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing businesses. This is the second-cycle loan.  

At the time of availing the first loan, her sales were not sufficient to meet her daily needs. Out of their small income, they are maintaining their family in a low profile. Now, she is very much confident in running her business and has developed her business significantly. At present, her monthly income is about Rs. 6,500. 

She wants to avail a further loan to purchase bulk quantity of grocery items like rice, pulses, sugar, tea, flour, oil, potatoes, onions, garlic, ginger, biscuits, mixture, and other grocery items. She has long desired to have two permanent stalls, one for tailoring work and another for the grocery shop.

The other eleven members of her group are doing milk businesses, mixture and snacks businesses, vegetable vending, hotel, fancy shop, and shoe shop businesses.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items like rice, pulses, sugar, tea, flour, oil, potatoes, onions, garlic, ginger, biscuits, mixture, and other grocery items.

loans.name: Lyvine

texts.en:
Lyvine is 25 years old. She is the mother of two children. She owns a boutique and has been running this business for the past six years. 

With the loan, Lyvine would like to buy more sugar, beans, and lotions to sell. The profits from the business will be used for making savings.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, beans, and lotions to sell.

loans.name: Athanas

texts.en:
Athanas is 23 years old. He is not married, however, he has one adult dependent. 

Athanas has been a farmer for two years now. He currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 13,000. 

Athanas would like a loan of KES 10,000, through which he will improve his farming by buying seeds and fertilizer.

He anticipates that, from the profits he makes, he will educate his brother.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Chrisphine

texts.en:
Chrisphine is a 31-year-old man from Kisumu town, which is found in Nyanza province in the western part of Kenya. He is married and supports four people in his family. Chrisphine has three children who are eight, four and one years old respectively.

He operates a motorcycle transport business that he has been operating for the last six years. He generates a monthly income of 10,000 KES. He has applied for his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to improve his motorcycle and any other home items. He will use the anticipated profits to grow his business. His dream is to have a stable business so as to support his family.

loans.use: to improve his motorcycle and any other home items.

loans.name: Noor  Fatima

texts.en:
Noor Fatima is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last two years with her son. She offers various goods for daily use, has good communication skills and counts on a good client list.

Noor Fatima is motivated to provide for her family. Her husband is a mason and earns an insufficient income to support his family alone. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and to also increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase an overlock sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tea, over-tea (fixed coffee), bread, milk, eggs, oil and butter for her business.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 54 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past fifteen years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and maize for sale. The profits from the business will be used to generate more savings.

loans.use: To buy more beans and maize for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials for the construction of a dwelling house for his family

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.en:
Sylvie is 34 years old. She is married with five children. She has requested this loan to buy more items for sale in her boutique such as lotions, utensils and flour. 

The profits from her business will be used to reinvest in the business for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more lotions, utensils and flour for sale.

loans.name: Lata

texts.en:
Lata is a 47-year-old woman who is married and a housewife. She has three school-going children (two sons and one daughter) who are in grade eight, five and one, respectively.  She lives with her husband Ajij and the children in their small kachha house (made of bamboo, mud and straw) in the small village of Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri. Both Lata and her husband are illiterate and were unable to get a primary education because their parents could not afford it.

Lata's husband has a plot of land where he cultivates vegetables like potatoes, beans, gourds, cucumbers etc. Every day he works hard and enthusiastically, tending to their crops with conviction so that he will have an excellent harvest as it is the way to generate more income.  Lata also helps him in his work. Now he wants to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, pesticides and other items.  His and as well as Lata's dream in the future is to grow jute, which is a very profitable crop .

So, Lata has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She hopes this new crop, which they have not yet cultivated, will enable them to obtain a greater income to get ahead, provide a greater opportunity in life, having a dignified home worthy of her family where her children can feel comfortable, and educating her children so that in the future, they are prepared for life.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase jute seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for jute cultivation.

loans.name: Anjuma

texts.en:
Anjuma is a young housewife from the village of Baroghoria in Jalpaiguri district.  There she lives with her husband and two grown-up sons.  Anjuma received an education up to grade seven, whereas her husband has a primary education.  Their sons were deprived of an education, so they are now working as masons.

Anjuma's husband Abul is a farmer. The family owns a small piece of land where they cultivate vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes, beans and fruits like banana, cucumber etc.  This is the main source of income for the family, as their sons have no permanent income.  Anjuma, though a housewife, helps her husband in his agricultural activities after finishing her household jobs.  She and her sons help with harvesting and selling the produce in the markets.  In spite of their hard toil, the family is facing financial problems and can't lead a decent life. They have decided to cultivate jute, which is a profitable crop in great demand in the market.

To create a comfortable condition for their agribusiness and to overcome the financial crisis, Anjuma has applied for a loan from BJS.  The loan will help her to purchase agricultural inputs to organize cultivation.  She hopes to have a decent profit from this to overcome their financial hardship. Her dream is to build a concrete-made house for their living.

She and her family will be very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for receiving their support and trust.

loans.use: To purchase jute seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school/college fees for his children.

loans.name: Viriato

texts.pt:
Viriato Jorge Mamite , nasceu numas das províncias do sul de Moçambique tem  54 anos de idade é casado e tem 12 filhos dos quais 5 já vivem em seus lares.
Reside núm dos bairros periféricos da Cidade Capital onde percorre cerca de 25 kms  diariamente para a sua Machamba. 
Estudou até a quarta classe e,não foi mais além devido a falta de condições por parte dos seus progenitores,facto que fez com que abandonasse a Escola e tão cedo começasse a trabalhar, foi admitido numa empresa Agrária em 1970 onde trabalhou até 1986 altura em que a empresa fechou.Porque tinha adiquirido larga experiênça nesta área,abriu a sua própria Machamba onde trabalha até então,tendo criado postos de trabalho para 5 pessoas,inicia a sua actividade as 7 horas até as 17horas produz hortículas as quais vende para a população local e abastece o mercado Grossista da capital.Ele tem a responsabilidade de produzir e a sua esposa de vender.Com o dinheiro do empréstimo vai comprar sementes da Batata reino e o  adubo.Com o rendimento da sua actividade,consegue para além de pagar  salários para os cinco trabalhadores,custear as despesas da sua familia: de saúde,educação e alimentação.
O seu grande sonho futuro é de comprar um tractor para lavrar e ampliar a sua Machamba e que o grande desafio será de conseguir  dinheiro para tal uma vez que,este custa muito dinheiro e está assima das suas capacidades.
texts.en:
Viriato was born in one of the provinces of south Mozambique. He's 54 years old and married with 12 children, 5 of whom already live in their own homes.

He lives in one of the neighbourhoods on the periphery of the Capital City and travels around 25kms on a daily basis to get to his small farm.
He completed fourth grade at school and didn't keep going because of his parents' lack of financial means which meant he had to abandon his education early to start working. He was given a job at an Agricultural company in 1970 and he worked there until 1986 when it closed down. As he already had vast experience in the area, he started his own small farm which he still works on today, having created jobs for 5 other people. He starts his activities at 07h00 and finishes at 17h00. He grows vegetables which he sells to the local population and on the wholesale market in the capital. He's responsible for growing the produce and his wife is responsible for selling it. 

With the money from this loan he will buy potato seeds and fertilizer. With the income from his activities he is able to not only pay for the salaries of his five employees but also for his family's expenses: health, education and food.

His big dream is to buy a tractor for ploughing and to expand his farm and his biggest challenge is to have access to the money to do so as this is a very expensive thing to do and is above his current means.

loans.use: buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, soap, oil, toothpaste, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Ahammadah

texts.en:
Ahammadah is 38 years old and married. He has four children who are all in school. He comes from Sigyirira I, Katongore parish in Ibanda district. 

He is an agriculturalist and the previous loan was used to buy fertilizers. He was able to increase productivity and make maximum returns. He would like more money to buy more fertilizers to put in his coffee plantation. Ahammadah is hardworking.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a small entrepreneur and Kubo Financiero’s client. This is her story.

Martha is 43 years old and married. She has three children. All of them are studying and one of them has a son, her little grandson. Together they live in a house with some relatives in the Chicoloapan suburb of Mexico City.

Martha owns a stationery store, selling office supplies, copies, notebooks, and many other products for the past 3 years. She asks for this loan to repair the photocopy machine in the store, since copies represent the biggest income of her business.

Martha’s goal in the near future is to continue growing her business and her challenge with the effort she puts into her work is to have stability for her and her family.

loans.use: to repair the photocopy machine in her stationery store.

loans.name: Aparna

texts.en:
Aparna is a hardworking young woman of only 25 years, married to Sukchan and a mother of one little son who is too young. She did not complete secondary education because her parents didn't have the economic resources.  After her marriage, she is now a housewife. They live in a small village in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Aparna's husband, only 30 years old, is a trader of beetle nuts (a kind of mouth freshener used in rural areas of India). They have no beetle nut trees, so he purchases from his own villagers and from the neighboring villages and sells in the local market.  It is the only source of income for their family and provides a very small income, which is hardly enough to manage the household.  They want to give the family the wellbeing they need to expand their existing business, but they don't have that much capital.

In order to help her husband, Aparna has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, who gives business loans to rural needy women.  She wants to purchase more beetle nuts with the loan. Her dream is to enhance the business and in this way, obtain a greater income that will enable her family to get ahead, provide a greater opportunity for life and educate her son so that he can be established in the future.

She is grateful to both Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase beetle nuts for their existing business.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio is a small entrepreneur and Kubo Financiero’s client. This is his story.

Sergio is 50 years old and married. He has three children, who are 7, 16 and 21 years old. They live in a house that was the property of his wife's parents and he and his wife carry out many types of work to make a living.

During the daytime, Sergio does electromechanical repairs and manufactures industrial grills, stoves and ovens. During the night, he has a vending stand that sells pizza and cotton candy. Also, his wife is in the sales business and offers footwear door by door to potential clients.

A big part of the income of Sergio comes from services to parties or big events, where attendees eat his cotton candy and pizza. One new issue that has emerged for him is that the events are far away from his home. This is why he asks for this loan to add to some savings he has to buy a car to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Basanti

texts.en:
Basanti lives in the village of Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri with her husband and two sons. Both Basanti and her husband are uneducated and can only sign their names.  Basanti is 50 and her husband is 57 years old.  
 
Basanti's husband is a farmer who runs a small, but beautiful farm, which currently includes arable land where he grows tomatoes, cabbages, cauliflowers etc.  Their two sons are also engaged in agriculture.  Basanti works hard with her husband after managing her household job, especially to gather each harvest.  Their sons help them to carry the produce to the market to sell.  As these vegetables are seasonal, there is no permanent income from this.  So, it is really difficult to cover all the costs of their family with this scant income.  So they have decided to cultivate bitter gourd, which is a year-round crop and is in great demand in the present market.

Basanti had taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizers and other agricultural inputs. She hopes to earn additional profits from this crop, and she can fulfill her dreams of giving her family a decent lifestyle and construct a farmhouse of their own.

She will be very much grateful to her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for their support in her farming business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to grow bitter gourd.

loans.name: Gitabala

texts.en:
Gitabala is a 32-year-old woman who has a primary education.  She is married and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter).  They live in their own kachha house (a house made of straw, mud and bamboo) in Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Their daughter is in grade 10 and their son is unemployed.

Gitabala's husband Bhobin, 56 years old, is a carpenter.  He makes small furniture like wooden chairs, tables, stools etc. and carries them to the local markets to sell.  He is unable to rent a shop in the local market due to insufficient capital. So he runs the business from his house.  As he has no steady income, Gitabala manages and owns a dairy farm where she has two cows and a few goats.  She supplies milk to her neighbors and in this process earns some profit to help the family economically. But her income is very small for a family of four, where there is a student. She wants to purchase one more cow for her dairy farm, as demand for cow's milk is high in her village.

Thus, she has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS.  She plans to use the loan to purchase a dairy cow.  She wants to expand her business and sell more milk. She and her husband will be ever grateful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her dairy farm.

loans.name: Dhritimala

texts.en:
Dhritimala is an energetic and optimistic woman of only 28 years, who lives in the small village of Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri with her husband, Swapan, and her two daughters. She attended school up to grade 8, and her husband studied up to grade 10. One of their daughters is in grade 1, and the other is too young for school.

Dhritimala's husband is an electrician. He has a small shop in the local market. He repairs and sells electrical goods, as well as offers a supply of electrical lights for different festivals on a rental basis. His meager income is on the verge of being exceeded by their expenses, and it gets increasingly difficult to keep their child in school. At the same time, it is hardly possible to maintain the family household.

Dhritimala heard about BJS and that they provide financial help to needy women to start businesses. So Dhritimala is seeking a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase necessary articles and more lighting boards and electrical lights for her husband's business to establish it well. 

As festival season is knocking at the door, there will be more demand for lighting, and to satisfy his customers, Dhritimala’s husband wants to increase his stock. She hopes that the loan will make their business stable and start to deliver returns.

She aspires to purchase a truck in the future with the profit from the loan, so her husband can supply his materials to different places.

She and her husband give their heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase electrical lights and necessary articles for her husband's business.

loans.name: Shukla

texts.en:
Shukla is a 39-year-old woman. She is a married woman and is raising two children (one son and one daughter). Both Shukla and her husband are illiterate and can sign their names only. But they are providing education to both their children, who are in grade 7 and 9. They live in the small village of Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Shukla's husband, Dulal, aged 42 years, is engaged in a small business of making and selling wooden furniture, which he runs from his house. He makes small wooden furniture and sells it locally. His products are in good demand in his locality.

Shukla is an enterprising woman. Coming from a small village does not stop this hardworking woman from having big dreams. She has been rearing cattle for the last five years to give financial support to her family. She sells milk to her neighbors. Like all mothers, it is her dream to give proper education to her children and at the same time, overcome the financial hurdles of her family.

In order to reach her goal, she has taken a loan from BJS. She intends to purchase a cow to enhance her milk supply business. She hopes to earn additional income, which will help her in fulfilling her wishes. She wants to purchase more cows in the future with the profit from her business.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her existing milk selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy building materials for the construction of a house for his family.

loans.name: Assita B

texts.fr:
Née à SIKASSO, Madame ASSITA B. est une femme mariée et mère de 2 enfants résidant avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Bougoula Ville Sikasso  troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
ASSITA B. après mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès s’est initiée dans des activités d’achat et de vente des articles divers tels que les habits pour enfants, des T-shirt, bonbons, allumettes, biscuits, savons, sucres, etc. 
 Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ trois ans. Après six prêts individuel tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son septième prêt individuel.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Ce septième prêt lui permettra d’acheter 10 douzaines de complets pour enfants, 5 douzaines de slip pour enfants, 5 paquets de biscuits, 10 cartons de bonbons et sur place à Sikasso qui seront vendus de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born in Sikasso, Assita B is a married woman and a mother of two children. She lives with her husband and children in a large, traditional, extended family in Bougoula, Sikasso, the third administrative region in the Republic of Mali.

Assita B, after having tried many other types of work without success, started a business buying and selling various goods, such as outfits for infants, t-shirts, candy, matches, cookies, soap, sugar, etc. In order to better satisfy her customers, who continue to grow in number, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yirwaso three years ago. After six individual loans which have all be repaid correctly, she is now on her seventh individual loan. This loan will serve to buy 10 dozen outfits for infants, five dozen pants for infants, five packets of cookies, and 10 boxes of candies in Sikasso. She will travel around reselling these goods to male and female customers for cash and credit.

With this loan she hopes to earn an average profit of 35,000 francs CFA, which she will use to increase her business funds, support her family's expenses, and pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to buy various goods

loans.name: Ernestine

texts.en:
Ernestine is 38 years old, married and has six children who all go to school. She owns a shop where she sells wedding dresses for brides and apparel for grooms.

She is applying for a 800,000 RWF loan through Urwego to buy more wedding dresses to rent or sell plus many types of decorations for use during wedding ceremonies. With the profits from her business Ernestine will pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more gowns for making business.

loans.name: Cooproriz Isabane Gp7 Group

texts.en:
Thomas is 52 years old. He is a father of four.  He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production: the farmers need to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.  

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilisers and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Coop Isabane 2014B Gp6 Group

texts.en:
Clarisse is aged 34. She is married to a farmer and they have three children. She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production. They need to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. Clarisse is pictured holding a red file as a sign of identification from other group members.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Benjamín Antonio

texts.es: Benjamín es un trabajador hombre padre de una numerosa familia pues con su esposa tiene 7 hijos, por los cuales se levanta cada en busca de un alimento y brindarles una educación apropiada para que sean alguien en la vida y es así como se caracterizan los campesinos unas personas humildes y trabajadoras que siempre busca el beneficio de su familia por encima del suyo, por ende requiere un crédito para la compra de cerdos con el que espera aumentar su capital y poder brindarle una educación universitaria a uno de sus hijos que iniciara esta nueva etapa su mayor sueño es poder ver a todos sus hijos con un buen trabajo cuidando a sus familias y que siempre recuerden su lugar de nacimiento que no pierdan la humildad pues es según Benjamín el valor más importante que marca a un ser humano
texts.en:
Benjamin is a working man and the father of a numerous family. He and his wife have 7 children, for whom they rise each day to search for food and to offer a proper education so that they may become someone in life. And this is how such farmers are characterized, as humble and hard-working people, who always place the well-being of their families above their own.

For this reason, Benjamin needs a loan to purchase pigs which he expects to increase his capital and be able to offer a university education to one of his children who will begin a new epoch. Benjamin's greatest dream is to be able to see all his children with good jobs, caring for their families. He hopes they will always remember their place of birth and not lose their humility. This Benjamin believes is the most important value that leaves its mark on a human being.

loans.use: buy pigs to augment his capital and be able to offer a better education to his children.

loans.name: Cooproriz Nyiramageni G5 Group

texts.en:
Christophe is 53 years old.  He is a father six, and is currently a group leader for his fellow group members.  He has spent 32 years in the business and he wishes to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer purchases during rice production.   Fertilizers are needed in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in the business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.  

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Owusu

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Owusu. He is single, but has children. In 2010, Owusu established his mixed-items business. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns a good profit from this business. He would like a loan amount of 1,800 GHS. Owusu requires a loan in order to buy more mixed items like polythene bags, sachet water, materials, etc. to sell. 

In the future, Owusu plans to educate his children to the university level, and to build a house. He is very hardworking, and he thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more mixed items like polythene bags, sachet water, materials, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Maa Thakurani Group

texts.en:
Manu is the leader of a group that lives in Muniguda of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 50 years. She has a small family comprising three members: her husband and one son, aged 27. The member standing second from left with a raised hand is Manu. 

Like most families in the village, she was managing a small silver utensils shop in her village. Her husband helps her in business by moving to different markets at nearby villages. She has already availed four loans, and this is the fifth-cycle loan.
 
At the time of availing her first loan, her husband was used to moving to weekly markets of nearby villages for selling silver utensils.
