Out of their small income, they are maintaining their family in a low profile. To improve her living condition and to earn some extra income, she availed four loans over a period of time.

At present, Manu's monthly income from her silver utensils business is Rs. 6,500, which is not sufficient to lead a better life. So, she wants to take a further loan to purchase varieties of silver utensils. She has a cherished dream to have a permanent stall in front of her house.

Out of the other three members, Kuni is also doing a utensils business, and Namita and Kadambini are doing leaf plate-making businesses.

loans.use: to purchase varieties of silver utensils.

loans.name: Eleodine

texts.en: Eleodine is a Cameroonian Married with a child of three years old in nursery school. She has been in this business for over two years which makes her stable and experience. Her business is likely to succeed because is it located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be use to buy communication credit to increase her turn over by forty three percent and her profit will be increase from forty four thousands FCFA to fifty nine thousands FCFA monthly.

loans.use: to buy communication credit

loans.name: Alfonso Manuel

texts.es:
Alfonso es un hombre emprendedor y trabajador, que se dedica a su tienda de abarrotes en la cual trabaja todos los días. Inicio con el negocio desde hace 1 año y medio, al ver la necesidad de ayudar con los gastos de su hogar. 
El solicita ayuda para comprar surtido de productos para su tienda. De esta manera tendrá un inventario amplio de productos de la canasta familiar. 
De esta manera seguirá ofreciendo mejor calidad y más variedad a sus clientes. Manifiesta que su mayor sueño es darle continuidad a su negocio, ofreciendo cada día un mejor servicio y calidad.
A pesar de ser soltero el sueña con formar un linda familia y heredar el negocio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alfonso is an enterprising and hardworking person who has a small grocery store, where he works every day. He started the business 1 and a half years ago when he saw the need to help out with his household’s expenses.

He is requesting help to buy product inventory for his store. This way he will have a large inventory of basic need products.
In this way he will continue offering better quality and more variety to his clients. He explains that his biggest dream is to provide continuity for his business, offering better service and quality every day.

Despite being single, he dreams of starting a lovely family and passing on the business to his children.

loans.use: to buy product inventory for his store.

loans.name: Helen Mambo

texts.en:
Helen Mambo is single and a mother of four children and they live in a three-bedroom apartment in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the Northwest region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are sickness in her family, inadequate finances to properly manage her business, and the deaths of her father, mother,brother and two sisters.

She has taken and repaid her loans successfully three times, and says with the new loan requested, she will buy more materials for her business, like firewood. Part will be used for her transportation to sell her products. She holds a positive view of her business because she has been doing the business for a long period of time, she has regular customers who buy from her, her business is situated at a good site and she also supply in bulk to other retailers in the community. 

With the profit from this loan, she will carter to her family's needs, and handle unforeseen problems. To her, GHAPE loans are preferable because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and because members are also trained on business and marketing skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy firewood and pay for transportation

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy greater quantities of ingredients for the dish she sells

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy building materials for the construction of a house for his family.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo tienen una bodeguita donde ofrecen variedad de productos de primera necesidad arroz, leche, menestras, aceite entre otros, son una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 500 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Agustina, 44, lives with her husband and children in the district of Oyotun, a community dedicated to farming, cattle raising and trade. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, belonging to the region of Lambayeque in the northern coast of Peru.
Agustina and her husband have a small grocery store where they offer a variety of basic consumer goods such as rice, milk, dried vegetables, oil, etc. They are a close family who work hard in their business. Agustina is asking for a loan of 3,500 PEN to buy a larger amount of products to offer her costumers and in this way generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of products to stock her business.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 3enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Konobougou, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou, (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments, de tubercules, de gâteaux et de calebasses(naturelles et ayant subie des améliorations et modifications: gravées, percées etc). 
Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur douzième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente BINTOU, deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de calebasses(de différentes sortes et variétés). Elle compte s’approvisionner en calebasse chez les grossistes à Tona. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Konobougou et celui dans les villages environnants à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en: The Djiguisseme Group is made up of married women with an average age of 36 and an average of three children each. They all live within traditional family frameworks in the town of Konobougou, Barouéli Prefecture, in the region of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other through the bonds of family, community and friendship. Their main businesses are running restaurants and selling condiments, tubers, cakes and calabashes (both natural and have undergone changes such as being engraved, drilled, etc.). This will be the twelfth loan for the women of the Djiguisseme Group. In order to satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they have sought help from Soro Yiriwaso. Bintou, the woman sat second from the right in the front row of the photograph, did not receive an education and currently works as a calabash vendor (of different sorts and varieties). She gets her supplies from the wholesalers in Tona. She sells her stock at retail for cash in Konobougou and the surrounding villages to a mixed customer base. She plans on making an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: to purchase calabashes

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUIYA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Konobougou, commune de Konobougou, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou, (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments, de céréales, de fruits et légumes, de poissons et de beignet. 
Les femmes du groupe DJIGUIYA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente AWA, première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de poisson fumé. Elle compte acheter des paniers de poisson fumé chez ses fournisseurs à Ségou. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en: The Djiguiya Group is made up of married women with an average age of 34 and an average of three children each. They all live within traditional family frameworks in the town of Konobougou, Barouéli Prefecture, in the region of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other through the bonds of family, community and friendship. Their main businesses are running restaurants and selling condiments, cereals, fruits, vegetables, fish and fritters. This will be the second loan for the women of the Djiguiya Group. In order to satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they have sought help from Soro Yiriwaso. Awa, the woman sat second from the right in the front row of the photograph, did not receive an education and currently works as a smoked fish vendor. She buys baskets of smoked fish from her suppliers in Ségou. She sells her stock at retail for cash from home and at market to a mixed customer base. She plans on making an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: purchase fish

loans.name: Ophilia Fon

texts.en:
Ophilia Fon is married and has four children. They live in a four bedroom house in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. Ophilia Fon has faced many challenges in life, including sickness in her family.

Ophilia Fon will use this newly-requested loan to expand her poultry farm by buying more food items such as rice, beans, maize, sweets, magi and oil. Part of the loan will go to her farm to buy seeds and manure. Ophilia Fon is positive the business will succeed because she has experience and regular customers who always buy from her. She will buy good breed piglets and chicks since she knows where to buy and at reduced prices.

Ophilia Fon will use the profit from this loan to feed the family, to educate the children, to expand the business by buying more piglets and chicks and to build her house. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and a well-structured repayment interval.

loans.use: To buy beans, sweets, magi, oil, seedlings, and manure

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is an honest and hardworking man. He is married and has three children, two of whom go to school; the third is too young to attend yet. The family lives in Ibanda within Engari Parish in Kiruhura District.

Ronald is a tailor who owns a shop in the town’s trade center. His wife also sews to help out in the shop’s business. His customers are his neighbors.

Ronald is applying for a 1,500,000 UGX loan through UGAFODE to buy more material and a new sewing machine. He hopes to construct a store within the trade center and set up a big business.

loans.use: to buy more material and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
Lucinda tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores desde hace 10 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera ofrecerlos a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Lucinda is 46 years old and lives with her husband and children in the district of Lagunas, a community dedicated to agriculture, livestock farming and trade, located in the Province of Morropon in the Piura Region on the north coast of Peru.

She has been raising and selling small farm animals for 10 years. Her business is located at the back of her home. She has requested a loan of 1000 soles to buy feed for fattening her animals so that she can offer them at a better price.

loans.use: to buy feed for fattening her animals

loans.name: Walter Alamiro

texts.es:
Walter Alamiro tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad ubicada cerca al valle del río Jequetepeque, lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de internet, play station y venta de accesorios, desde hace más de 6 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de accesorios para su negocio y una segunda parte para el mantenimiento de sus equipos y de esta manera seguir brindando un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Walter Alamiro is 43 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of Zaña, a community located near the Jequetepeque River valley. This location has given Walter the opportunity to work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. The community is in Chiclayo Province which belongs to the region of Lambayeque on Peru's northern coast.

Walter has run a business offering Internet services and Play Station out of his home for more than six years. He also sells accessories. He is seeking a loan of 2,500 soles to buy accessories for his business and also service the equipment. In this way he hopes to continue offering a good service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy CDs, USBs, and pay for the maintenance of his PC

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 48 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de cerveza, gaseosas, piqueos y abarrotes desde hace más de 2 años, cuenta con clientela en la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una congeladora para mejora de su negocio y para implementar mas su tienda de abarrotes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 48 years old. He lives in the Buenos Aires district, a community with a varied climate. The population works in agriculture, commerce and cattle. It is located in the province of Morropon, which belongs to the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru. 

He has worked in the sale of beer, soft drinks, snacks and groceries for more than 2 years, and has developed a clientele in the area. He has requested a loan of 4,000 new soles to buy a freezer to improve his business and better implement his grocery store, and in that way generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a new freezer for his grocery store

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 61 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Morropon, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de plátano y leña para los baseros de su distrito, cuenta con clientela en su comunidad, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 600 nuevos soles para la compra de abono para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de plátano y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fernando is 61 years old.  He lives in the district of Morropon, a community with a hot climate whose populace works in farming, commerce, and livestock and which is located in the province of the same name in the Piura Region of Peru's northern coast. 

He grows and sells bananas and firewood for a living.  He has clientele in his community and has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,600 nuevos soles to buy fertilizer to maintain his banana crops, which will result in better produce to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to maintain his banana crops

loans.name: Lipi

texts.en:
Lipi is a young and enterprising woman of 26 years from the small village, Baroghoria, in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married and a mother of two sons, who are students of grade 7 and 3. She and her husband, Bakul, both are illiterate and just can sign their names. Her husband farms on land at Baroghoria, which is a deep rural village.

Lipi has been practicing cattle farming for the last five years to give sustenance to her family through dairy. She finds dairy farming enjoyable and profitable. She has a dairy cow and a goat on her farm. She supplies milk from door to door to her neighbors. In order to increase her business, she needs to purchase one more cow.  But the biggest challenge she faces is limited funds.

Lipi is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. It will produce enough milk to enable her to supply more and satisfy her customers; thus earn more. So, she has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS.   

She dreams to purchase more cows in the future to enlarge her business. She gives her heartiest thanks to her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon comes from Kanoni, a trading center in Uganda's Kiruhura District. He is married with four children. Two are in school, and the rest are too young to study.

Simon runs a small drug shop with capital of 700,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX). His major challenge is insufficient capital to add to his business. 

He has applied for a loan of 1,300,000 UGX. This loan will help him to buy more veterinary drugs to add to his drug shop to increase his sales and profits and to pay rent for the new premises he hopes to move to. 

He also hopes to build a permanent home for his children.

loans.use: To buy veterinary drugs to sell

loans.name: Carmen Del Socorro

texts.es:
Un rico y exquisito olor a Vigoron atrae a las personas  que a diario transitan por el negocio de Carmen.  Los visitantes caen en la tentación  y se deleitan con el delicioso platillo. Su abuelita le trasmitió todo sus conocimientos desde niña, logrando que se convirtiera en una experta en su preparación hasta la fecha de hoy.  El tiempo ha transcurrido y ahora es ella quien administra y está al  frente,  porque su abuelita se retiró por complicaciones de salud.
Con mucho esfuerzo ha  logrado crecer en muchos sentidos. Ya cuenta con sillas, mesas  y todo el equipo necesario para brindar una atención de calidad.  Sin embargo, Carmen tiene planeado una remodelación, con el fin de ofrecer un ambiente agradable en su negocio. Por lo tanto, solicitó un financiamiento para comprar mas sillas y mesas y hacer realidad su sueño. Las ganancias serán a beneficio de toda la familia.
texts.en:
A rich and exquisite smell of Vigorón [a traditional Nicaraguan dish of cabbage salad, boiled cassava and fried pork wrapped in a banana leaf] attracts people who pass by Carmen's business daily. The visitors fall prey to the temptation and delight in the delicious plate. Her grandmother passed on all of her knowledge to Carmen since she was a girl, managing to turn her into an expert in the preparation of the dish. Time has passed and now Carmen is the one who administers and is in front of the business because her grandmother retired due to health complications. With a lot of effort, she has managed to grow in a lot of senses.

She already has chairs, tables and all of the equipment necessary to provide quality customer service. However, Carmen has planned renovations in order to offer a pleasant environment in her business. She has therefore asked for a loan to buy more chairs and tables and to make her dream a reality. The earnings will benefit the entire family.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a 62 years old and lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City. In order to help the family, she runs a small sari-sari store in their barangay. 

For the start-up capitalization, she has reached out to Paglaum.  Recently, she has sought additional financial capital to purchase stocks  like basic commodities. She will buy rice, canned goods, sugar, and oil.

She hopes that she can maintain being a member in good standing with the Cooperative so she can always go to them in times of financial need.

loans.use: to purchase stocks like rice, canned goods, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 63 years old and married. She lives in Toril, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. To earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from her neighborhood. The piglets' owners share in her profits upon sale. The profits are divided at a rate of 60/40 or 70/30, depending on the agreement.

With a desire to earn more, Josephine had decided to raise pigs of her own as well. Through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan  to purchase additional pigs to raise. 

She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and, added to her husband's income, benefit her family. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Harrieta

texts.en:
Harrieta is 51 years old and lives in Tubod, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. To help her family, she sells a variety of snacks in addition to ready-to-wear clothing and other dry goods. 

She became a full fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative five years ago. Now she wants to obtain financial assistance to purchase raw ingredients for snack vending. 

Harrieta wishes to maintain her membership with Paglaum to continuously enjoy the insurance benefits.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for snack vending

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 65 years old and lives in Lawaan Aloran Mis.Occ. In order to help the family she sells snacks. She earns an income of PHP 7,000 per month doing this type of work.

She has been an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing since 2011. PMPC has been her constant financial partner. Recently, she wanted to obtain financial assistance to purchase more goods for her food vending. She has doubled her effort to save more so she can have her house be repaired.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her food vending

loans.name: Genevie

texts.en:
Genevie is 33 years old and lives in Dolipos, Oroquieta City. She  joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year  2012 and she appreciates the programs, services, and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. 

She is requesting a loan to buy additional bags of feed for hog fattening. Genevie  dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her  business.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of feed for hog fattening

loans.name: Jilyn

texts.en:
Jilyn is 36 years old, married, and a resident of Dolipos, Oroquieta City. She earns a living through farming and buying and selling of charcoal. 

She has been a member of PMPC for three years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the cooperative. 

Now she is applying for a loan to buy farm inputs and to pay for land preparation. Jilyn deeply wishes to maintain her membership with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and to pay for land preparation

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.en:
Cirilo is a carpenter and is from Burgos, Aloran. He joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2012 and he appreciates the programs, services, and continuous education of the co-op. He is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. 

He is requesting a loan intended for house repair. Cirilo  dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of his business.

loans.use: to repair his house

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is married with four children. She is 69 years old and lives in Dolores, Clarin, Philippines.

She sells variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Manuela has been a member of PMPC for nine years.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is from Ospital Aloran Mis.Occ. She  is 38 years old and is single. For many years, Rosie has maintained her membership with PM.  Hearing all the benefits of being a member, she never hesitated to become one. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Rosie is asking financial assistance of PHP 14,900.00 as an additional capital to buy more dry goods (clothing) to sell. Through this, she hopes to increase her more income and be of help in the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods to sell

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is 38 years old and lives in Balintawak, Pagadian City. She is married with three children.                  

She has a shop that sells grocery products. She had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan to pay for grocery items like milk, canned goods, sugar, and noodles.                                                                                               

Cleofe has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Cleofe hopes to have a fine grocery store.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is married with four children. She is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines.                           

She is a farmer and grows palay (unhusked rice) to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to pay for 10 sacks of fertilizer and pesticides.                                                        

Maria has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to harvest more palay crops.

loans.use: To pay for ten sacks of fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is married with four children. She is 52 years old and lives in San Jose, Sinacaban, Philippines.

She sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,600 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12,000 to restock her store with basic commodities  and to buy additional farm supplies.

Melissa has been a member of PMPC for seven years.  In the future, she hopes to supplement her family's income and part will be saved for future emergencies.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and to buy additional farm supplies

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 60 years old and lives in Lawa-an, Aloran. She operates a small business retailing vinegar. This has helped her family earn an income of 6,000 Philippine pesos per month.

As a micro-finance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, Loreta has met her obligations. Recently, she reached out to PMPC for financial assistance for a house renovation. She is confident that she can pay off this loan with the help of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for a house renovation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy doors

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her business with summer products, underwear, towels, t-shirts and personal use items

loans.name: Idalia Araceli

texts.es: Idalia tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 8 años de edad. Idalia es una mujer trabajadora quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para dar a su hija mejores condiciones de vida. Ella se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos y además vende productos de belleza por catalogo desde hace mucho tiempo. Idalia desea repellar las paredes de la vivienda con el objetivo de protegerlas de las humedades y de los insectos que normalmente les gusta anidar en paredes deterioradas  como es el caso del inmueble de Idalia. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, ladrillo y cemento para el mejoramiento de las paredes de la vivienda el cual es su principal patrimonio.
texts.en:
Idalia is 35 years old and lives in her own house with her eight-year-old daughter. Idalia is a hardworking woman who does everything in her power to give her daughter better living standards. For a very long time, she has been working as a domestic and also selling beauty supplies by catalog. 

Idalia wants to repair the walls of her house in order to protect them from humidity and from the insects that like to nest in deteriorated walls like the ones in Idalia's house. That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI. She will ivest in purchasing sand, bricks, and cement in order to improve the walls of her house, which is her main asset.

loans.use: to buy sand, bricks, and cement to improve the walls of her home.
